Joel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz, soya hace 10 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan. Solicita el crédito para sembrar cacao y comprar abonos. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar las matas de cacao.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas. El sueño es tener una hectárea de cacao.

En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse a cuidar a los animales que tiene (chanchos).
texts.en:
Joel Isidro is 32 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children. He lives with his wife and children (ages 7 and 6 months) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Joel is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco and part of the parish of San Juan. The members are farmers.

Joel is a farmer who has been growing rice, corn, and soybeans for 10 years. He buys and sells in San Juan. The loan he is requesting will be used for growing cacao, so he will buy compost. The loan will be of great help because he will be able to buy cacao plants. At the moment, he is not facing any types of problems. His dream is to have a hectare of cacao.

In his free time, Joel enjoys taking care of the animals that he owns (specifically pigs).

loans.use: to buy cacao plants and compost.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Luisa sigue dedicándose a la venta de ropa, artefactos y artesanía. 

Luisa con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio. 

Luisa requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa para esta campaña navideña. 

Luisa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luisa continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Choquequirao”, which is part of the microfinance organization Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She continues to sell clothing, appliances, and handicrafts.

With her previous loan, Luisa did very well and was able to obtain good benefits. For this reason, she wants another loan because she believes it will be a great help to her business. Luisa is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing for the Christmas season.

She is grateful for the opportunity being given to her, so she promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en:
Sylvestre is 24 years old and married. He has two children between the ages two and three years old. Sylvestre owns a business selling shoes. His business is well organized. The hours of this business are from 7 am until 6 pm every day and he has three years of experience. 

Sylvestre has requested a loan from Kiva lender, via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase his business by buying more shoes to sell. With this profits, he will be able to build a house for his business and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Jose

texts.es:
Jorge José tiene 22 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz hace 3 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos agrícolas, urea, fertilizantes. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar insumos.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema en los cultivos. El sueño es tener una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar en los desmontes.
texts.en:
Jorge José is 22 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Jorge José is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco and part of the parish of San Juan. The members are farmers.

Jorge José is a farmer who has been growing rice and corn for three years. He buys and sells in San Juan. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies, urea, and fertilizers. The loan will be of great help because he will be able to acquire these products. At the moment, he is not experiencing any problems with his crops. His dream is to own a house.

In his free time, Jorge José enjoys being out in the open fields.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, urea, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Domitila De Jesus

texts.es:
La sra. Domitila de Jesus tiene 51 años, vive en la colonia brisas del sur de la ciudad de Choluteca, Domitila es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es la venta  de ropa  americana, tiene mas de 7 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, la ropa la vende en su casa y tambien la vende en diferentes empresas de la ciudad de choluteca, Domitila se levanta a las 6 de la mañana todos los dias para atender a su clientela. 
Domitila es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad, y en ocaciones le ayudan economicamente.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa, ya viene la epoca de navidad y es cuando mas vende, pero en estos momentos no tiene capital suficiente para comprar mas ropa.         
Sus tiempos libres los dedica para visitar la iglesia y tambien para la crianza de gallinas.
texts.en:
Domitila de Jesús, 51, lives in the city of Choluteca’s Brisas del Sur neighborhood.  Domitila is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business which is sales of American clothing.  She’s been in this line of work for more than 7 years.  She sells the clothes at home and also in various firms in the city of Choluteca.  Domitila rises at 6am every day to tend to her customers.  

Domitila is the mother of two children who are adults and sometimes help her out economically.  She will use the loan to buy clothing because the Christmas season is near and that’s when she sells the most but she doesn’t have enough capital at the moment to buy more clothes.  In her free time she attends church and raises chickens.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 9, 3 y 7 meses de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz hace 5 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura para el ciclo corto y comprar insumos agrícolas. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar semillas. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. 

El sueño es tener terreno propio.
En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is 31 years old, in a common-law marriage, and lives with his wife and three children (ages 9, 3, and 7 months) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Juan Manuel is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco and part of the parish of San Juan. The members are farmers.

Juan Manuel is a farmer who has been growing corn for five years. He buys and sells in Ventanas. The loan he is requesting will be invested in short-cycle farming, so he plans to buy agricultural supplies. The loan will be of great help because he will be able to buy seeds. At the moment, he is not encountering any problems. His dream is to have his own land.

In his free time, Juan Manuel enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is 26 years old and is single. He is a carpenter and sells products such as tables, chairs, windows, and doors. His business is well organized. He works from 7 am until 5 pm every day and has five years of experience in this business. Anastasie employs five people to help him.

Anastasie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more wood to build more tables, chairs, windows, doors, and so on. With the profits from this loan, Anastasie will buy his own house and save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Yulisa Rosanna

texts.es:
YULISA ROSANNA tiene 30 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Yulisa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz hace 13 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan . Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar semillas. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.  El sueño es tener terreno propio.
En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse a los hijos.
texts.en:
Yulisa Rosanna is 30 years old and lives in the Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos settlement, with her two children, ages 14 and 10, and her husband.  She’s a member of the San Juan communal bank, located in the San Fransisco part of the San Juan parish.  They are farmers.

Yulisa has been raising rice and corn for more than 13 years.  She buys and sells in San Juan and is asking for this loan in order to buy fertilizers and urea.  The loan will be of great help and will allow her to buy seeds.  She hasn’t had any problems and she hopes to have her own land in the future.

She likes to spend time with her children in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy Rebeca

texts.es:
Nancy Rebeca tiene 24 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 6, 5 y 3 años de edad  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Nancy  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz hace 7 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para seguir sembrando  y comprar insumos agrícolas. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar los insumos. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.  
El sueño es tener terreno propio.

En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar la natación.
texts.en:
Nancy Rebeca is 24, married, and has three children. She lives with her husband and their children, ages six, five, and three, in the Ventanas canton, in Los Rios province. 

She is a member of the "San Juan" communal bank, located in San Francisco, which is part of the San Juan parish. She is a farmer, and has been growing corn for seven years. She does her buying and selling in Ventanas. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy agricultural supplies so that she can continue planting. The loan will be a great help to her in buying supplies.  She hasn't had any problems. Her dream is to have her own land. In her free time she likes to go swimming.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, so that she can continue planting.

loans.name: C6204 Abahuje Group

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 42 years old and has six children, aged between 3 and 15 years old. She owns general store business which is open from 6am until 7pm every day except the weekend. She currently employs two people to help her. She is the leader of the group, called "C 6204 Abahuje" in the local language. Alphonsine has two years of experience in this work. 

Alphonsine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more products like cooking oil, sugar, rice, Irish potatoes, soap and so on to sell. With this profit from the loan, she will save money for her future and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more products like soap, rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad es una cliente antigua aproximadamente trabaja con la institución hace  4 años, pertenecía al Banco de emprendimiento Agua de Vida, actualmente trabaja en la venta de productos de ropa de temporada, es decir vende blusas poleras, ropas de bebé, chompas, camisetas, polares en época de invierno, el préstamo le servirá para viajar hasta la localidad del Desaguadero y comprar al por mayor de poleras, blusas y por esta temporada que esta cerca  la navidad también tiene pensado dedicarse al negocio de juguetes. La Sra. Felicidad,  vive con una de sus hijas que se encuentra en la casa, y ella colabora con la atención  y mantención de sus 2 nietos. Aumentando su capital tiene pensado el ahorrar para su anticrético y darles más comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Felicidad is a long-standing client who has been working with the institution for approximately four years. She belonged to the "Agua de Vida" communal bank.

Now she sells seasonal clothing; that is to say, she sells blouses, skirts, baby's clothing, sweaters, T-shirts, and fleeces in the wintertime. 

She will use the loan to travel to the town of Desaguadero to buy skirts and blouses at wholesale. Because it's close to Christmas, she has also thought about selling toys. 

Felicidad lives with one of her daughters who is at home, and she helps support and look after her two grandchildren. 

In increasing her working capital, she has thought of saving for her anticrético (rental contract where the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum), to provide more home comforts for her family.

loans.use: To buy clothing, such as blouses, and sweaters.

loans.name: Tabaksineh Traders Association Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tabaksineh Traders” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mado. Mado is aged forty-seven; she was born in Mansoberie village but currently resides in Magburaka town together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary and secondary school. For nearly twenty-five years now, Mado has been a businesswoman. She sells plastic bowls, dishes, buckets, spoons, etc. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy more plastic bowls, dishes, buckets, spoons, etc. in larger quantity for sale.

loans.use: to buy more plastic bowls, dishes, buckets, spoons, etc. in larger quantity for sale.

loans.name: Nancy Maria

texts.es:
Nancy María tiene 67 años de edad es soltera tiene una hija, vive con la hija en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Nancy se dedica a la venta de sábanas y manualidades (adornos de sala). Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan y en Quito. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería, sábanas y manualidades. 
El crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá aumentar el negocio.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.  El sueño es tener casa propia..
En los tiempos libres le gusta realizar manualidades.
texts.en:
Nancy María is 67, single, and has a daughter. She lives with her daughter in Ventanas canton, in Los Rios province. She is a member of the "San Juan" communal bank, located in San Francisco, which is part of San Juan parish, a farming area. 

Nancy sells sheets and crafts(room decorations) She does her buying and selling in San Juan and Quito.  She is applying for the loan to buy merchandse, such as sheets and crafts. The loan will be a great help to her, because she will be able to increase her business. 

She hasn't had any problems. Her dream is to have her own house. In her free time she likes to do crafts.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as blankets and crafts.

loans.name: C18519 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Immaculee is 36 years old and is married. She has five children between the ages 5 and 10 years old. Immaculee is also the leader of this group, which is called "C18519 Twitezimbere" in the local language. She sells at a boutique (Salt, Irish potatoes, rice, sugar). Immaculee employs one person to help her and she has five years of experience. She works from 7:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m every day. She is the first person on the left in this picture. 

Immaculee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her business by buying more rice, sugar, milk and bananas to sell. With this profit, Immaculee hopes to satisfy their customers and to save for the family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, sugar, rice, milk and so on.

loans.name: Denis Evenor

texts.es:
El joven Denis tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el caserio asacualpa, Denis es un hombre muy trabajador y  dedicado a su negocio propio que es una pulperia, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo tipo de productos de consumo diario, Denis se levanta a las 6 de la mañana todos los dias para atender  a sus clientes, Denis es padre de 1 hijo, el cual tiene un año de edad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio, en esta espoca es cuando mas vende y desea tener surtido su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de hogar.          
Su tiempos libres lo dedica para visitar la iglesia.
texts.en: Denis, 29, lives in the hamlet of Asacualpa.  He is a very hardworking man who is dedicated to his own business which is a grocery store.  His store is home-based; he sells all types of daily consumption items.  Denis rises at 6am every day to tend to his customers.  Denis is the father of a one-year-old son.  He will use the loan to buy stock merchandise for his store.  This is the season when he sells the most and he wants to have his store well-stocked.  He needs the profits to cover household expenses.  He uses his free time to go to church.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Aldo Roy

texts.es:
Aldo Roy tiene 26 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de 9 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Aldo Roy tiene un comedor de comida hace 2 años. Las compras los hace en Ventanas y las ventas lo hace en el local. Solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio, comprar verduras, carnes y frutas. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar material de trabajo, mesas, sillas, manteles. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.  El sueño es comprase un solar 
En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Aldo Roy, 26, lives in a common-law relationship and has one child.  He lives with his partner and his nine-year-old son in Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the San Juan communal bank, located in the San Francisco area in San Juan parish.  The people there work in agricultural jobs.

Aldo Roy has had a food canteen for two years.  He shops in Ventanas and he sells in his business.

He is requesting the loan to invest in the business, buying vegetables, meat, and fruit.  The loan will be of great help to him so he can buy work materials, tables, chairs, tablecloths.

He has not had any type of problem.  His dream is to buy himself a piece of land.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to invest in the business and to buy vegetables, meat, and fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: C18520 Abungumugayo Group

texts.en: Beatrice is 41 years old and is married, with seven children between the ages of five and 14 years old. Beatrice is also the leader of this group, which is called "C18520 Abungumugayo" in the local language. Beatrice employs two people to help her and has two years of experience. She works from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m every day. Beatrice is the first person on the right in this picture. Beatrice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more goods, like beans, rice, soap, cooking oil, and so on, to sell. With this profit, Beatrice hopes to satisfy her customers and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like beans, rice, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: La señora María Josefa a sus 69 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 37 años. La señora María Josefa vivía en un municipio de Antioquia y debido a la situación de violencia presentado en éste, se vio en la necesidad de trasladarse para la ciudad de Medellín hace aproximadamente 15 años. En el año 1996, la señora María Josefa inicia su propio negocio en la ciudad de Medellín de venta de fritos como pasteles y empanadas y además gaseosas, posteriormente las entidades encargadas de manejar el espacio publico le otorgaron a la señora María Josefa un kiosco para que pudiera trabajar, desde ese entonces la señora María Josefa pudo sacar adelante a su hijo luego de haber quedado viuda. La jornada laboral de la señora María Josefa es de 7:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. La señora María Josefa requiere de la compra de surtido para su negocio tal como gaseosas, snacks, galletas, y dulces. Con lo anterior la señora María Josefa podrá incrementar sus ventas y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. El sueño de la señora María Josefa es agrandar su negocio y tenerlo acondicionado con un mejor piso y más sillas.
texts.en: María Josefa is 69 years old.  She is the mother of a 37 year old son.  She lived in the town of Antioquia but because of the violence occurring in the East, she felt it was necessary to relocate to the city of Medellín approximately 15 years ago.  In 1996, she began her own business selling fried foods such as pies and empenadas (stuffed pastries) as well as soft drinks.  Later, the company responsible for managing the public space granted her a kiosk where she could work.  Since then, and after having been widowed, María Josefa was able to get her son ahead in life. Her work day is from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm.  She needs to purchase inventory for her business such as soft drinks, snacks, cookies, and sweets.  With this loan, she will be able to increase sales and, in this way, improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to enlarge her store and have it outfitted with a better floor and additional seating.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business such as soft drinks, snacks, cookies, and sweets.

loans.name: Uvaldo

texts.es:
El sr. Uvaldo tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el caserio asacualpa y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva como ser jeans, camisetas, blusas, calsonetas y sandalias. Uvaldo es una persona trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio, hace varios años que se dedica a este tipo de actividad,  su mercancia la vende en varios  lugares  cercanos a su comundad.  Uvaldo se levanta  a las 6 de la mañana para salir a vender la ropa y las sandalias.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y sandalias, tiene muchos pedidos para navidad y desea cumplirle a todos los clientes. 
Uvaldo es padre de 3 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela publica de su comunidad.         
Su tiempo libre lo dedica a visitar la iglesia.
la meta de Uvaldo es graduar a sus hijos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Uvaldo is 41 years old and lives in the village of Asacualpa. He sells new clothing such as jeans, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, and sandals. Uvaldo is a hardworking individual who is dedicated to his business. He has been in this line of work for many years. His merchandise is sold in various places near his community. Uvaldo wakes up at 6am so that he can leave in order to sell clothes and sandals.

This loan will be used to buy clothing and sandals. He has many orders for Christmas and wants to keep all of his customers satisfied. Uvaldo is the father of three children who attend public school in their community. In his free time, he attends church. His goal is to see his children graduate from the university.

loans.use: to buy new clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Adelphine

texts.en:
Adelphine is 23 years old, married, and has two children. She works with her husband selling shoes in a store they have run for seven years. 

Adelphine is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more shoes for the store. The profits will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of flour and baskets of fish.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: La señora Simona vive con su hija,  en casa propia,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida hace varios años, desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta  las 16:00,  la cliente prepara su comida para la venta en su domicilio y vende en el mercado de la misma zona donde ella vive,  gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo la cliente pudo adquirir su propia vivienda, el crédito esta destinado a la compra de un frízer grande para poder ampliar mas su negocio así también la cliente invertirá en capital de trabajo, de esta manera la cliente podrá generar mayores ingresos y poder terminar de construir su vivienda, es una persona muy amable y muy buena se siente agradecida con  la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que gracias a su apoyo sacara adelante su negocio mejorando asi su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Simona lives in her own home with her daughter. For the past several years, she has been selling food beginning in the early morning hours until 4pm. Simona prepares the food at home and then sells it at the market in the area where she lives. Thanks to the effort she puts forth in her work, Simona has been able to acquire her own home.

This loan will be used to buy a large freezer so that she can increase her business. Simona also wants to invest in operating capital so that she can generate more income and finish the construction of her house. She is a friendly and good-natured person who is grateful for the support Emprender has provided. Thanks to this assistance, Simona has been able to move forward so that she can improve her business and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large freezer.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es: Alba  de 54 años, vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio con su familia conformada por su esposo, quien es comerciante de artículos de cacharrería puerta a puerta, y sus 5 hijos que ya son mayores de edad.  Allí Vende papelería, productos de aseo, detalles de ocasión, y  variedades en general además de gaseosas, pasabocas, mecatos.  Sus clientes son los vecinos del sector y transeúntes del barrio, sus ventas son de contado, así como también sus compras que las realiza en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Este negocio es atendido por la empresaria y una de sus hijas y lo inició desde el año 2003, como parte de la experiencia tradicional de su familia paterna, núcleo en el cual todos son comerciantes.   Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio y de otros aledaños, peatones que transitan el sector. Aunque la competencia es alta,  Alba Luz se sostiene con un buen servicio, respondiendo a las necesidades de su clientela y con precios competitivos. En la actualidad tiene su sueño de crecimiento empresarial y considera que esta es una de las mejores épocas para invertirle a su negocio capital de crédito, como al que está aplicando en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque tradicionalmente conoce que es la temporada en la cual incrementa sus ventas de contado y rota rápidamente su capital de trabajo. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento,   comprará artículos alusivos a la navidad, juguetes, accesorios femeninos  y ropa elegante, sobre pedidos que ya hicieron sus clientes, lo cual garantiza que su inventario rote muy rápido, y también la ampliación de su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Alba is 54 years old and lives in the July 20th neighborhood with her family which consists of her husband, a merchant who sells housewares door-to-door, and their five grown children. She manages a store where she sells stationery, toiletries, seasonal gifts, and a variety of other products such as sodas, snacks, and packaged lunches. Her customers include her neighbors and people who pass through the area. She sells on a cash basis. Alba purchases her merchandise in the central part of the city of Barranquilla.

She has been managing this business with one of her daughters since 2003. Alba is continuing a tradition since everyone on her father’s side of the family was in the retail trade. Her primary customers are residents of the neighborhood and from the surrounding areas. She also serves pedestrians who visit the neighborhood. Although the level of competition is high, Alba Luz is able to maintain good service. She responds to the needs of her customers and offers competitive prices. At the moment, she dreams of growing as an entrepreneur and considers this moment to be one of the best times to invest in a loan for her business.

Alba is submitting a request to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because she knows this season is traditionally the time when her cash sales increase and her inventory has rapid turnover. With this Kiva loan, her first form of financing, she will buy items for Christmas such as toys, women’s accessories, and formal clothing. Her customers have already placed their orders, so Alba is guaranteed of very quick turnover and the need to increase her operating capital.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for Christmas such as toys, women’s accessories, and formal clothing.

loans.name: Alicia Felipa

texts.es:
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca”  ubicado en la provincia de Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. La señora estudió educación secundaria.

La señora Alicia es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementará al capital de su negocio de venta de ají.
Con este dinero comprará un quintal de ají, el cual lo vende molido y entero.  Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo se dedica a la venta de ceviche (plato típico de Perú).

La señora desea tener una empresa de venta al por mayor de ají molido.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad  del préstamo.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Communal Bank “Kapia Marca” which is located in Yunguyo Province in the Department of Puno. She is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Sra. Alicia received her high school education.

She is a new member who recently joined Manuela Ramos. Alicia is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN and will use the money to increase her business capital for selling “ají” peppers. With this money, she plans to buy a “quintal” (1 quintal = 46 kg) of ají peppers, which she will sell ground and whole. Alicia works alone in her business. Her husband sells “ceviche” (a traditional Peruvian seafood dish).

Sra. Alicia wants to have a business where she can sell ground ají peppers in bulk. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to buy ají peppers.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La sra. Reyna tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Luis de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y niños, Reyna es una mujer emprendora  y con muchos deseos de superacion,  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, tambien sale a vender a empresas privadas y publicas de la ciudad de choluteca, Reyna se levanta a las  6 de la mañana todos los dias, primero atiende a sus hijos y luego se prepara para atender a sus clientes, que por cierto son muchos. Reyna es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, mismos que los tiene estudiando en la  escuela publica del barrio.
Su tiempo libre lo dedica  a visitar la iglesia.
Reyna utilizara el credito para la compra de ropa, desea estar preparada para la epoca de navidad, muchos de sus clientes ya le estan haciendo pedidos y no quiere quedarles mal.
texts.en: Reyna, 41, lives in the city of Choluteca’s San Luis neighborhood and she sells women’s and children’s clothing.  Reyna is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  Her business is home-based and she also goes out to sell to private and public firms in the city of Choluteca.  Reyna rises at 6am every day.  First she tends to her children and then gets ready to take care of customers, which by the way, are quite a few.  Reyna is a single mother of two children who attend the local public school.  In her free time she goes to church.  Reyna will use the loan to buy clothes.  She wants to be prepared for the Christmas season.  Many of her customers are already placing orders and she doesn’t want to disappoint them.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia se dedica a la elaboración de aretes, camándulas, anillos y collares para dama y caballero en diferentes materiales tales como plata, murano y fantasía. Lo anterior lo aprendió en cursos que tomo de bisutería. La señora Patricia vende sus productos a vecinas, amigos y compañeras de estudio. La señora Patricia desea comprar materiales para hacer sus productos tales como pedrería, plata e hilos con el fin de suplir la demanda de fin de año, poder incrementar sus ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo de 5 años. El sueño de la señora Patricia es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia makes earrings, rosaries, rings, and necklaces for women and men out of different materials such as silver, murano glass, and precious stones. She previously took jewelry-making courses where she learned this skill.

Sra. Patricia sells her products to neighbors, friends, and classmates. She wants to buy materials for making her products, such as precious stones, silver, and thread, so that she can meet the year-end demand. This will enable her to increase her sales and improve the quality of life for her five-year-old son. Sra. Patricia dreams of having her own store.

loans.use: to purchase craft materials.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 56 años de edad, es una hombre trabajador y dedicado a su labor en el campo, es conviviente con Rosalva que también es agricultora y ama de casa, fruto de esa feliz unión tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 12, 9 y 6 años de edad que son su mayor alegría y por los cuales  se esfuerza por salir adelante. Ellos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Alejandro es la agricultura, para eso tiene su terreno propio en donde tiene sombríos de palma aceitera, además de  plátanos, maíz, éstos últimos son para el consumo de su hogar. Asimismo cría aves de de corral como gallinas y patos, habiéndose iniciado en esta actividad desde hace 24 años. Actualmente cuenta con la ayuda de 4 peones a los que paga por jornada trabajada. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es poder estar en el campo, tener contacto con la naturaleza, donde se siente muy a gusto, además que le brinda lo necesario para vivir cómodamente, y para educar a sus  hijos, que son su mayor orgullo, por eso se siente con muchas ganas de progresar y mejorando sus técnicas de cultivo comprando un tractor agrícola. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado dice sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser excelentes personas. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles. Los invertirá en la compra de abono  en volumen para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 56, is a hardworking man who is dedicated to his work in the fields.  He lives with Rosalva who is also a farmer and housewife.  This happy union produced four children who are 17, 12, 9, and 6 years old; they are his greatest joy and the reason he strives to get ahead.  They all live together comfortably in their own home.

Alejandro’s activity is farming.  He has land of his own where he grows palms for palm oil and also bananas and corn; the latter two are for home consumption.  He also raises barnyard fowl like chickens and ducks having started this activity 24 years ago.  He currently employs four laborers that he pays for each day worked.  What he likes about his activity is being able to be out in the countryside, to have contact with nature where he feels very good.  Besides, it provides what’s needed to live comfortably, to educate his children who are the source of his pride.  Because of this, he very much wants to make progress and improve his farming techniques including purchasing a tractor.

This will be MFP loan #3 and he hopes for your cooperation to continue toward his goals.  He says that he feels good in his communal bank because he considers the members to be excellent people.  He will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy manure in volume to improve the quality of his land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Don Tomas, de 66 años de edad, de oficio agricultor, es originario de Miraflor municipio de Estelí conocido por sus áreas protegidas y una imponente flora y fauna, clima fresco  donde la mayoría de los finqueros se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos, hortalizas y crianza de ganado que al final llegan aportar de manera positiva a la diversidad de la zona. Donde la mayoría de su población se levanta con el alba y el canto del gallo, las aves. En medio de estas actividades es que se desarrolla  don Tomas quien nos cuenta que se dedico al cultivo de papas a la edad de 41 años ,el no fue ala escuela pero fue alfabetizado , tiene 7 hijos. El empezó sembrando una manzana de papas con la ayuda de una cooperativa llamada PROPA . Ahora cuenta con 24 manzanas de tierra las cuales obtuvo mediante la reforma agraria y las ocupa para siembra de papas cuando no esta sembrando, se dedica al cultivo de repollo, café  y crianza de ganado. El vende su producto en Managua y cooperativas comercializadora de papas. 
El realizo el préstamo para compra de semilla, insumos y pago de mano de obra para siembra de 2.5 manzanas de papas. Pues tiene terreno sin utilizar debido a que para sembrar se necesita mas financiamiento y es lo que hace falta, el desea que sea una cosecha de buena calidad y rentabilidad. Entre sus expectativa es sembrar repollo una ves finalizada la cosecha de papas.
texts.en:
Tomas, 66, is a farmer from the town of Miraflor in Estelí Municipality known for its protected areas and an important flora and fauna, cool weather where most farmers grow basic grains, vegetables and raise livestock which in the end contributes to the area's diversity.  Most of the population rises at dawn with the crowing of the roosters and the birds.  In the midst of this activity Tomas carries out his activity which for the last 41 years has been potato farming.  He never went to school but he is literate.  He has seven children.  He started growing potatoes on just one manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] with help from a cooperative called PROPA.  Now, he owns 24 manzanas of farmland that he acquired thanks to agrarian reform and he uses them to grow potatoes.  When he’s not planting he grows cabbage, coffee and raises livestock.  He sells his products in Managua and to potato cooperatives.

He took out the loan to buy seeds, supplies and to pay labor costs to plant 2.5 manzanas of potatoes because he has fallow land that he needs more financing to be able to plant in.  He hopes harvests will be good quality and profitable.  Among his expectations is planting cabbage once he finishes harvesting potatoes.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of planks to make pieces of furniture for sale.

loans.name: Yudith Cirila

texts.es: La socia Yudith sigue con su negocio de compra y venta de ropa, tanto para damas como para caballeros, la socia compra todo tipo de prendas de vestir como carteras.  pantalones, camisas, blusas, chompas y polos, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a  diferentes instituciones y a sus diferentes amistades. La socia desea a futuro cercano implementar su negocio y ampliar su mercadería y hasta poner una tienda de venta de ropa para exhibirla y en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de ropa al por mayor porque tiene muchos pedidos y desea viajar a traer la mercadería. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ropa y viajar.
texts.en: Yudith continues with her business of buying and selling clothes for women and men.  She buys all types of items such as purses, trousers, shirts, blouses, sweaters, and polo shirts.  Yudith works independently and sells to different institutions and to her various friends.  In the near future, Yudith wants to establish her business and expand her inventory of merchandise.  She hopes to have a clothing store where she can display her products.  On this occasion, she wants a loan so that she can purchase clothing in bulk because she has many orders and must travel to acquire the merchandise.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to invest in clothing and pay for her travel expenses.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and pay for her travel expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Zoila Blanca

texts.es:
Zoila sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Zoila sigue trabaja en una empresa pública ósea en una empresa del estado (INPE). 

Zoila con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el gasto familiar.

Zoila solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago de mensualidades de estudios de sus hijos.

Zoila se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Zoila continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Choquequirao”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She continues to work for a public entity that is owned by the state (INPE).  

With her previous loan, Zoila did very well and was able to obtain good benefits.  For this reason, she wants another loan to help with family expenses.  Zoila is requesting a loan to invest in the monthly tuition for her children’s studies.  

She is grateful for the opportunity being provided and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to pay her children's monthly tuition.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Iván tiene 21 años de edad es soltero y platica que termino su preparatoria pero ya no siguió estudiando debido a que tenía que ayudar a sus padres a sacar adelante a sus hermanos el es originario de un lugar rico en naturaleza donde su principal actividad económica es la venta de Flor de Noche Buena también conocida como flor de pascua. El joven Iván ha iniciado la inversión en un  huerto de aguacates Haas, el esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su huerto ya que tiene  planeado comprar otras plantas de aguacate, fertilizante orgánico para nutrir el suelo y para no dañar el  ambiente e insecticidas para eliminar plagas y enfermedades  de la manera más segura y para hacer crecer de manera optima las plantas de aguacate en su huerto.  Además de esta actividad, el joven Iván se dedica entre semana a trabajar en una constructora en la capital del país para ayudarles a sus padres y hermanos con los gastos del hogar. Iván tiene la esperanza de que este huerto de aguacates sea lo suficientemente rentable para que el ya no salga a trabajar a otros lados, ya que es un trabajo muy pesado y peligroso, su deseo es volver a casa y dedicarse de lleno a sus árboles de aguacate. La meta que tiene es poder meter una toma de agua a su huerto para ya no comprarla ya que sale muy cara y no le alcanza para regar todos los árboles, también se sueño es aumentar el número de matas de aguacate ya que su terreno es muy amplio.
texts.en:
Iván is 21 years old and single. He says that he finished preparatory school, but was not able to continue studying because he had to help his parents support his siblings. Iván is originally from a place that is rich in natural beauty and where the main business activity is selling poinsettias, which are also known as the “flower of Pascua”. Young Iván began investing in a Haas avocado orchard. He is requesting a loan to invest in his orchard and already has plans to buy more avocado trees and organic fertilizers to nourish the soil without harming the environment. In addition, he will buy insecticides to eliminate pests and diseases so that his trees will be more secure, thus allowing his orchard to produce an optimal quantity of avocados.

In addition to farming, Iván has a construction job during the week in the capital that allows him to help his parents and siblings with the household expenses. He hopes that his avocado orchard is profitable enough to allow him to quit taking other jobs because the work is exhausting and dangerous. Iván wants to return home and dedicate himself full-time to his avocado trees. His goal is to install a water intake system for his orchard because buying water can be very costly since there is not enough to irrigate all of his trees. He also dreams of increasing the number of avocados tress he has on hand because he has enough land.

loans.use: to buy avocado trees, organic fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  La señora cuenta con estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja desde hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que incrementó al capital de su negocio, antes se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes, actualmente se dedica a la venta y alquiles de prendas de vestir (vestidos).

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1700.00 nuevo soles comprará quince vestidos, una docena de zapatos para señoritas.  Nos cuenta que la mercadería la trae de Lima y la vende en la ciudad de Puno.  En el negocio le ayuda su hijo.

La señora desea crecer más en le negocio y mejorar sus ganancias
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unión y la alegría de las socias
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Brisas del Lago” (Lake Breezes) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, single, and has three children. Sra. Elena received her higher education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and was used to increase her business capital. Elena previously sold groceries, but she now sells and rents dresses.

With this new loan of 1700 PEN, Elena will buy 15 dresses and 12 pairs of shoes for young ladies. She says that the merchandise is shipped in from Lima and then she sells the goods in the city of Puno. Her son helps with the business.

Sra. Elena wants to grow more in her business and improve her earnings. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the unity and the cheerfulness of its members.

loans.use: to buy 15 dresses and 12 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda comenta que estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria porque sus papas ya no pudieron seguir apoyando económicamente ya que eran más hijos y no les alcanzaba para darles más estudios, ella tiene 38 años de edad es casada con el señor Demetrio el cual es empleado, ellos tienen 5 hijos y 3 de ellos viven en su casa Carlos de 17 años quien trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, Vanesa de 15 años y Fernanda de 13 años de edad ellas dos estudian la secundaria. Ella está pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para poder hacer crecer su negocio de  venta de aguacate y nopal. Imelda comprara abono e insecticidas y plantas de aguacate, su negocio lo tiene hace  aproximadamente hace 25 años, platica que lo tiene en su casa porque tiene un terreno muy amplio y puede  estar al pendiente de sus plantas. Dice que sale a vender sus aguacates y nopales a diario a la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de ella y también dice que tiene pedidos de clientes. Platica que el crédito le beneficiara ya que a sus hijas las menores les podrán comprar lo que necesiten para sus trabajos escolares. La meta que tiene con su negocio de aguacate y nopal es seguir sembrando y cuidarlo más ya que de ahí ellos se mantienen y salir a otras ciudades donde vendan sus productos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Imelda says that she studied through the third year of high school because her parents were not able to continue providing financial support. She has other siblings and there was not enough money to further their education. Imelda is 39 years old and married to Sr. Demetrio, who is employed. They have five children, three of whom live at home: Carlos, age 17 who works and helps with the household expenses; Vanesa, age 15; and Fernanda, age 13. Both daughters attend high school.

Imelda is requesting a loan from the microfinance organization so that she can grow her business of selling avocados and cactus pads. She plans to buy compost, insecticides, and avocado plants. Imelda has been in this business for approximately 25 years. She says that she has a very spacious plot of land at home that is suitable for her plants. Imelda sells avocados and cactus pads every day at a supply depot in a nearby town where she receives orders from her customers.

She says this loan will benefit her young daughters because she will be able to buy the things they needs for school. Her goal is to maintain her avocado and cactus pad business by providing additional care to her crops, thereby allowing her to sell her products in other cities at a better price.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, and avocado plants.

loans.name: Auscencio

texts.es:
Auscencio tiene 49 años de edad el estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria ya que sus papas no le pudieron seguir apoyando ya que eran mas hermanos y no tenían los recursos suficientes para comprarle los útiles escolares, don Auscencio se dedica al cultivo y venta de aguacate desde hace 12 años, el esta pidiendo su crédito a la Financiera para invertir en su huerto, ya que tiene  planeado comprar otras plantas de aguacate y fertilizante orgánico para nutrir el suelo y no dañar la tierra. Dice que cuando es temporada de cosecha sale a vender el fruto a una central de abastos que se encuentra cerca de su localidad y tambien vende en diferentes poblaciones ya que tiene clientes que el le surte de fruto. Platica que vende por cubeta los aguacates por que dice que así le saca mas ganancia. 

Don Auscencio esta casado con la señora Petra ella se dedica hacer servilletas bordadas y tienen 3 hijos de nombres Sandra de 17 años la cual estudia la secundaria, Guadalupe de 6 años la cual desgraciadamente que al nacer le lastimaron la cadera y tiene que pagar terapias para que la niña pueda caminar y Alejandra de 3 años. La meta que tiene para su huerto es sembrar mas plantas y darles cuidado para obtener así un mejor fruto, también cuidarlo que las arañas no se coman la flor, y meterle un buen fertilizante y un buen insecticida. El esta muy contento y agradecido con las personas que hacen posible los créditos por que sus negocios crecen y puede el darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Auscencio is 49 years old and only attended three years of primary school.  His parents could not continue supporting him as he had other siblings and they could not afford to pay the school tuition.  Auscencio has been cultivating and selling avocados for 12 years.  He is requesting the loan from Financiera to invest in his orchard as he plans to purchase more avocado plants and organic fertilizers to nourish the ground while protecting the soil.  He says that when harvest time comes, he sells his fruit to a supply center near his town and also sells his fruit in various towns since he has customers whom he provides with fruit. He says that he sells the avocados by the bucket because it is more profitable.  

Auscencio is married to Petra who makes embroidered napkins and they have three children. Sandra is 17 years old and attends secondary school, Guadalupe is 6 years, and Alejandra is 3 years old. Unfortunately, Guadalupe hurt her hip at birth and he has to pay for therapy so that the child can walk. His goal is to plant more plants in his orchard. He hopes to obtain better fruit by caring for them and applying good fertilizer as well as good insecticide to ensure that the spiders don’t eat the flowers.  He is very happy and is grateful to the people who make the loans possible because his business is growing and he is able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to cultivate and sell avocados.

loans.name: Ma Julia

texts.es: Doña Julia tiene 55 años de edad estudio hasta el cuarto año de primaria y no pudo continuar con sus estudios por que sus padres no pudieron seguir apoyándola por que eran 13 hermanos y no podían darles estudios a todos. Ella es viuda y tiene cinco hijos pero nada mas 4 viven con ella por que el mayor le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, doña Julia se dedica a cultivar y vender aguacate en diferentes poblaciones aledañas a su localidad desde hace 8 años y dice que comenzó con este negocio para apoyar a sus hijos con las escuelas ya que ella es la cabeza de la familia y tiene que sacar a sus hijos adelante, dice que cuando no es temporada de aguacate se dedica a la compra de venta de fruta de temporada la cual la vende en diferentes tianguis. Platica que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para invertirlo en sus árboles para comprarles abonos, fertilizantes e insecticidas para que den fruto de mejor calidad, la meta que tiene Julia es que sus hijos terminen la escuela y puedan estudiar una carrera corta y sembrar otros frutos en su huerto para tener de diferentes variedades de fruto. Ella esta agradecida por el crédito porque así puede hacer su negocio.
texts.en: Mrs. Julia, 55, was unable to continue her education past fourth grade because her parents weren't able to keep supporting her; she had 13 siblings, and their parents could not afford to educate all of them. Julia is a widow and has five children; only four of them live with her, and the oldest helps her with the household costs. Julia grows and sells avocado in various towns near to her own. She has done this for eight years and says that she started her business so that she could support her children with their studies. She is the head of the family and needs to get her children ahead. She is requesting a loan from this institution so that she can invest in her avocado plants. She will buy manure, fertilizers and insecticides so that her trees will produce a better quality of fruit. Julia's goal is for her children to finish school and get degrees. Another goal of hers is to sow other types of fruit so that she will have a variety. She is grateful to have this loan because she will be able to put it toward her business.

loans.use: to grow and sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: La socia Dolores; continua trabajando en su negocio, ella administra y atiende su restaurante todos los dia y desde muy temprano como siempre, la socia, desearía futuro implementar su local y hacerlo mas grande para comprar mas mesas, sillas y tener mas clientes, ella en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos para la cocina, la socia desea comprar al por mayor bolsas de arroz, azucar para los refrescos, papa por arrobas, fideos en cajas, aceite en bidon grande, condimentos y especias al por mayor, ella desea hacer esta inversión para tener mas ingresos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la cocina.
texts.en: Dolores is still working in her business: she runs a restaurant and tends to it every day. As always, she gets up very early to do so. In the future, she wants to fit out her restaurant and make it bigger so that she can buy more tables and chairs and have more customers. She now wants to invest in the purchase of kitchen utensils wholesale. She wants to buy bags of rice, sugar for the drinks, potatoes by the kilo, pasta in boxes, a large barrel of oil, condiments, and spices. She wants to make this investment in order to have more income. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of kitchen supplies.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of kitchen supplies.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera, tiene cuatro hijos independientes.
Estudió educación superior pero no pudo terminarlo.

La señora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, gaseosas, helados y gelatinas, trabaja más de seis años con Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo invirtió en su negocio venta de abarrotes.

Faustina solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar mercaderías como chocolates, gaseosas, galletas, etc, sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio, también cuenta con servicio telefónico (cabina).

La señora desea seguir y mejorar su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unión, la distracción con las socias y las charlas educativas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the "Brisas del Lago" communal bank, located in the province and department of Puno. She is 52, single, and has four independent children.
She was studying toward a degree in higher education but was unable to finish.
Faustina sells groceries, pop, ice cream and jell-o. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for over six years. She invested her first loan in her grocery store.
Faustina is requesting a new loan of 600 nuevo soles, which she will use to buy merchandise such as chocolate, pop, cookies, etc. Her children help her with the business. She also has a telephone booth.
She wants to continue to improve her business in order to increase her income.
What she most likes about her communal bank is its unity, having fun with the members, and the educational talks about business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as chocolates, pop, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Cintia Yolany

texts.es:
La joven Cintia tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la colonia brisas del sur y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica, Cintia es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, tiene 2 años de haber inciado su negocio, Cintia se levanta todos los dias temprano para atender a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su hija, Cintia es madre soltera. 
Cintia tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas.
texts.en: Cintia, 22, lives in the Brisas del Sur neighborhood and she sells basic items of popular consumption.  She has a small, home-based grocery store.  She sells everything related to basic family staple needs.  Cintia is a hard working woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She started her business two years ago.  She rises early every day to take care of customers.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock the store.  She needs the profits to get ahead with her daughter; Cintia is a single mother.  She also raises chickens.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rokel Social Club Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present the members of the 'Rokel Social Club' group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Rugiatu is the leader of this group. Rugiatu is thirty-six years old and married. She has three children. Two are in primary school while the youngest isn't old enough to go to school yet. Rugiatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), and uncooked rice. With the help of this loan, Rugiatu will invest in her business by buying gallons of palm-oil and bags of rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil and bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marleny De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Marleny a sus 65 años de edad es madre de cuatro hijos, se dedica la confección de prendas de vestir especialmente trajes de novia, disfraces y uniformes. La señora Marleny desde los 12 años aprendió este oficio puesto que su madre tenia muy pocos recursos y era viuda, por lo que a la señora Marleny le tocaba confeccionar a mano su ropa y la de sus siete hermanos. Actualmente, la señora Marleny trabaja sola desde su propia casa. La señora Marleny requiere de la compra de materiales e insumos para realizar su trabajo tales como telas, hilos, tijeras y moldes. Con lo anterior, La señora Marleny podrá cubrir la demanda que tiene para la temporada de fin de año, aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella, sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en: Mrs. Marleny is 65 years old and a mother of four. She makes garments such as bridal dresses, costumes, and uniforms. Mrs. Marleny was taught at 12 years of age by her widowed mother with little resources and was in charge of hand sewing her own and her seven siblings' clothes. At the moment, Marleny works alone from her home. Mrs. Marleny needs to buy materials and supplies to make garments such as fabrics, thread, scissors, and patterns. Mrs. Marleny will be able to satisfy her demand that comes at the end of the year, increase her profits, and improve her quality of life as well as her childen's and grandchildren's.

loans.use: buy materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ronald Luis

texts.es:
Luis sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Luis sigue dedicándose a su profesión que es ingeniero geólogo y también sigue trabajando en la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos, chalinas, guantes, gorros, mantillas, mantas grandes, ponchos, chalecos y adorno en cerámica.

Luis con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio.

Luis solicita este nuevo préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería como por ejemplo desea comprar más tejidos. 

Luis se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luis continues to be an active member of communal "Choquequirao" from the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. Luis continues being a geological engineer and also continues selling crafts such as woven fabrics, scarves, gloves, hats, baby clothes, large blankets, ponchos, sweaters, and ceramics.

Luis was successful with his previous loan which is why he is interested in requesting a new one.

Luis is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as fabrics.

Luis is thankful for the opportunity offered through this medium and commits to pay off the scheduled repayments.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as fabrics.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca”  ubicado en la provincia de Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, tres dependientes y un independiente.

La señora Silvia trabaja desde hace seis años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, también se dedica a la crianza de truchas.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez sacos de alimentos para truchas.

La señora desea tener una empresa donde pueda vender al por mayor.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad  del préstamo y las reuniones con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of communal bank "Kapia Marca," located in the Yunguyo province, Puno department. She is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children three who are dependent of her and one who is independent.

Mrs. Silvia has been working for six years with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her first loan was for $300.00 Peruvian Soles which was invested in her grocery business. She also raises trout.

With this new $3000.00 Peruvian soles loan she will buy ten sacs of feed for the trout.

Silvia wishes to have a business where she can sell wholesale.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the ease to receive a loan and the meetings with the other members.

loans.use: buy ten sacs of feed for the trout

loans.name: Dionocio Gerardo

texts.es:
Dionocio de 34 años, desde hace 10 años atrás empezó con esta actividad de costurero en su sastrería, y gracias a Dios hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien.

Comienza a trabajar desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido problemas en su negocio.

Está casado y su esposo se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tienen 1 hijo de 9 años que estudia en escuela fiscal.

Su meta es poder termina su casa de cemento y agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionocio, 34, started sewing in a tailor shop 10 years ago, and thank God, so far, it has gone well.

He starts working at 7 am and continues until 9 pm and thanks to God, he hasn’t had any problems in his business.

He is married, his wife works in the home and they have a 9-year old son who is in public school.

His dream is to finish his cement house and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy material and sewing machines

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.es: La socia Anastasia; tiene aún su negocio de elaboración de tejas y ladrillos, la socia tiene su fabrica en casa y tambien se dedica  la crianza de animales menores, ella cria aves de corral como pollos, la socia tambien vende menestras en el mercado es una mujer muy trabajadora y en esta oportunidad ella desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elboracion y fabricacion de tejas y ladrillos. La socia desea a futuro cercano poder crecer y aumentar sus ventas para dedicarse solo a una cosa y dedicarle tiempo completo alternando con su familia. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer las tejas y ladrillos.
texts.en: Anastacia has a workshop in her home where she makes bricks and tiles. She also raises small animals like chickens. In addition, she sells stews in the market - she is a very hard working woman! On this occasion she wants a loan to buy materials for making bricks and tiles. In the near future she would like to grow and increase her sales so that she can dedicate herself to just one business and also have time to spend with her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bricks and tiles.

loans.name: Francisca  Delfina

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado  en la  provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene  56 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos. Cuneta con educación secundaria.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de fabricación de prendas de vestir, también se dedica a la venta de ropas.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de telas, bayetas  de diferentes colores, algodones, tijeras, para confeccionar los trajes, también comprará un fardo de ropa para su respectiva venta.  En el negocio le ayuda su hijo y su hermano.

La señora desea tener más capital para poner su propia tienda y captar más clientela.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y la ganancia generada por el ahorro.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the village bank "Ahorro es Progresso" [Saving is Progress], located in the province and department of Puno. She is 56, married and has 5 children. She completed high school.

Francisco has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, money that she invested in the manufacture of garments. She also sells clothing. 

Now she wants a loan for 1200 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of fabric, flannels of different colors, cottons and scissors to make suits. She also will buy a package of clothing for resale. Her son and brother help her in the business.

She wants to have more capital so she can open her own store and get more customers. 

What she likes most about her village bank is the punctuality, the responsibility, and the earnings generated from the savings.

loans.use: to buy fabric, flannels, cotton and a package of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tarp to protect customers from the Caribbean sun and constant rain, and to finish furnishing the kitchen with things like plastic containers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica es una señora de 45 años, su desafío son problemas de salud y la situación económica del Paiz. Verónica tiene un sueño que realizar y es aumentar sus ventas en esta temporada,  porque es época navideña y la venta son buenas. Verónica solicita este crédito para poder comprar zapatos, vestidos, bolsos, perfume, y ropa de niños y otros. Ya que ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general.
texts.en: Verónica is a 45 year old woman who is challenged by health problems as well as the economic situation in her country. Her dream is to increase her sales during this holiday season when sales are good. Verónica is requesting this loan in order to buy shoes, dresses, handbags, perfume, children’s clothes and other items, because she is dedicated to selling general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes, dresses, handbags, perfume, children's clothing and other items.

loans.name: Nicolás Fredy

texts.es:
Nicolás es un emprendedor de 49 años de edad, oriundo de El Carmen de Víboral al oriente de Antioquia, Colombia, por su origen campesino, desde pequeño aprendió los oficios propios del campo, es así como desde hace algunos años se dedica no sólo a la agricultura sino también al corte y mantenimiento de pastos, servicio que le presata a sus vecinos. 

Este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar una guadaña y abonos para sus cultivos lo que le permitirá mejorar sus productos y sus servicios así como su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nicolás is a 49 year old entrepreneur who is a native of El Carmen de Viboral to the east of Antioquia, Colombia. He has a farming background and as a young child he learned the tasks related to agriculture. For several years he has not only farmed, but also cut and  maintained pasture lands, a service that he lends out to his neighbors.

This entrepreneur needs a loan to purchase a scythe and fertilizer for his crops, which will enable him to improve his products and services as well as his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a scythe and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elvia Marina

texts.es:
Doña Elvia tiene 50 años de edad, vive en Guasaule Choluteca, es una mujer emprendedora y  dedicada a su negocio, que es la venta  de ropa  nueva, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su negocio lo  tiene ubicado  en  frontera con Nicaragua. sus clientes son personas que viajan de Honduras a Nicaragua y viceversa, todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para abrir su negocio.
Elvia es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad, y en algunas ocasiones le ayudan economicamente.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa al por mayor, con esto obtiene mejores precios y mas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Elvia en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.
texts.en: Elvia, 50, lives in Guasaule, Choluteca.  She’s an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business which is new clothes sales.  She’s been in this line of work for several years.  The business is located on the border with Nicaragua and her customers are people who travel from Honduras to Nicaragua and vice versa.  She rises quite early every day to open her store.  Elvia is the mother of three children who are all adults now; they sometimes help her out economically.  She will use the loan to buy clothes at wholesale because she gets them at better prices that way and earns higher profits that she needs to cover household expenses.  In her free time, Elvia goes to church.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothes.

loans.name: Linda Elvis

texts.es:
Linda de 34 años, empezó con su pequeña escuela desde hace 6 años atrás y con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de Dios ya casi termina de obtener la documentación de la escuela para tener mas niños. 

Los horarios de clases son de 7 de la mañana hasta las 1 de la tarde, y de ahí en adelante preparan los horarios de clases. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ningún problema.  Esta felizmente unida a su esposo que es albañil, y tienen 3 hijos de 10, 6 y 3 años.

Tienes muchas aspiraciones de seguir con la escuela por eso quiere terminar de arreglarla comprando con el prestamo cemento, bloques y pintura. Su meta es poder hacer la escuela más grande  para así poder educar a más niños.
texts.en:
Linda, 34, started her small school six years ago and through her hard work and God’s help she has almost finished obtaining the documentation needed for the school to admit more children.

Class hours are from 7 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon and from then on they prepare the class schedules. By the grace of God, there have been no problems. Linda is happily married to her husband, who is a bricklayer, and they have three children, who are 10, 6 and 3 years old.

She aspires to continue on with the school and therefore wants to finish fixing it up by using the loan to buy cement, blocks and paint. Her goal is to be able to build a larger school so that she can educate more children.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks and paint.

loans.name: Minerva Estrella

texts.es:
Minerva es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, la señora estudió educación secundaria (incompleta).

Trabaja más de dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de golosinas, también se dedica a la venta de comida.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará utensilios como vajillas, ollas,  víveres para la preparación de alimentos, también invertirá en la salud de su hija.
En el negocio le ayuda su hija, su esposo realiza servicio de taxi (transporte). 

La señora desea implementar y reabrir su tienda de abarrotes.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad  del préstamo y el plazo de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Minerva is a member of the communal bank "Brisas del Lago," located in the province and department of Puno.  She is 33 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 children.  She completed part of middle school.

Minerva has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for more than 2 years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 Peruvian soles, which she invested in her business selling candy.  She also has a business selling food.

With this new loan of 800 Peruvian soles, she will buy kitchenware such as dishes and pots, and groceries to prepare her food.  In addition, she will invest in the health of her daughter.

Her daughter helps her with the business, and her husband works as a taxi driver.

What Minerva likes most about her communal bank is that the loans have easy payment terms.

loans.use: to buy dishes, pots and groceries to prepare her food

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: La señora Amparo a sus 40 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 16 y 8 años de edad. La señora Amparo tiene una tienda desde hace aproximadamente dos años; esta labor la inició la señora Amparo luego de trabajar por siete años en una fábrica de arepas y querer independizarse para mejorar sus ingresos y darle una mejorar la calidad de vida a sus dos hijos. La señora Amparo trabaja sola en su tienda de lunes a domingo desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 de la media noche. La señora Amparo desea comprar surtido para su negocio tal como gaseosas, snacks, aceite, productos de aseo personal y duces, con lo cual pueda atraer más clientes e incrementar sus ventas. El sueño de la señora Amparo es comprar su propia casa y ver a sus hijos siempre felices.
texts.en: Amparo, 40, is the mother of two children aged 16 and 18.  Amparo has had a store for about 2 years.  She started up this business after working for 7 years in a factory in Arepas.  She wanted to become independent in order to improve her income and provide a better quality of life to her two children.  Amparo works alone in her store every day from 8am until midnight.  Amparo wants to buy merchandise for her business such as: soft drinks, snacks, cooking oil, personal care products and sweets, so that she can attract more customers and increase her sales.  Amparo dreams of buying her own house and of seeing her children always happy.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Roxana Teresa

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de abarrotes.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1200.00 nuevo soles dinero que invertirá en la compra de víveres, golosinas, panetones, leche, chocolates, todo para la campaña navideña.
En el negocio le ayuda su hija, la señora también trabaja en el Municipio de la zona.

Sueña con tener un negocio grande, una casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la distracción y el compañerismo con las socias.
texts.en:
Roxana belongs to the “Brisas del Lago” (Lake Breezes) communal bank located in Puno Province and Department.  She’s 38 years old, has a spouse and three children.  She attended higher education.  

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she invested in her grocery store.  She will request a new, 1200 new sol, loan to use to buy foodstuffs, snacks, panettones, milk, chocolate; everything for the Christmas season.  Her daughter helps her in the business.
