Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas hace 1 año atrás, le va muy bien con esta actividad ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales ya 2 son independientes y dos siguen estudiando, La señora demuestra ser responsable en sus créditos anteriores. Ahora el crédito otorgado a la señora es para compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su negocio ya que tiene muchos mas clientes y ella desea brindarles más comodidad a sus clientes ya que van por el trato amable que les brinda y por el buen sazón de que tiene la Sra. en la preparación de las comidas.
texts.en:
María is from the city Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She currently lives in the Coronado zone. She has been a food vendor for a year. Everything is going well for her with this activity, and it is the only activity that she uses to sustain the family. She has four children, two of whom are independent and two are still studying.

She has demonstrated her responsibility through her previous loans. Now the loan granted to her is for purchasing tables and chairs to grow her business. She has many more clients, and she wants them to be comfortable. They come to her because she is really friendly and because she does an excellent job preparing the dishes.

loans.use: purchase tables and chairs for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana,  su estado civil soltera  nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra,  vive actualmente en la zona Cañada El Carmen. Su negocio esta ubicado  en la avenida cerca de su domicilio, ella se dedica a la venta de comida (Pollos a la Broaster) hace 1 año, trabaja de lunes a domingo de horas 18:30 a 23.30. La señora demuestra ser responsable y trabajadora. El crédito otorgado a la señora es para la compra de una cocina freidora de pollos y el saldo para comprar mesas y sillas. La señora esta muy agradecida con emprender por confiar en ella y poder darle la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio, incrementar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señora Ana is single and was born in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She currently lives in Cañada El Carmen. Her business is located in the avenue close to her home. She has been selling food (Broasted chicken) for a year and works Monday to Sunday from 18:30 to 23:30. The lady has proved to be responsible and hardworking. The loan given to the lady is to buy a deep fryer for chickens and with the balance tables and chairs. The lady is very grateful to Emprender for the trust placed in her and for giving her the opportunity of growing her business, increasing her income and so improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer for chickens as a capital investment.

loans.name: Matagalu

texts.en:
Matagalu is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Vaisala. She is married and has four adult-aged children. To earn a living, Matagalu owns and  operates a business venture in the arts sector, operating a handicrafts business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling traditional handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Matagalu has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 1000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Matagalu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Matagalu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Matagalu is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase paints, design board, fabrics, glitter and pandanus leaves. This will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Matagalu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase paints, design board, fabrics, glitter and pandanus leaves.

loans.name: Taei

texts.en:
Taei is 40 years old, married, and has six children who attend school. She lives in the town of Asau. To make a living, Taei raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. Taei has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 600 WST a month.

Taei is requesting her first loan from SPBD for 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. In 2011, Taei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Taei plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en: Connie is 28 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, which is located in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, soap and home products. To help expand her business, she is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more items to sell. Her goal is to increase her profits so that she can buy more food for her family. Her goal for the future is to own a wholesale business. Connie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which serves people who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that are too large to qualify for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap and home products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene lives in Changamwe, Kenya with her husband and two school-aged children. For the last eight years, she has made a living by running a retail shop and by working on a farm. She has taken out and repaid one loan, and is applying for a second, for Ksh 50,000, to buy items to sell in her retail shop. Her main challenges are the lack of a permanent place to sell her wares and slow business during the rainy season. Her goal for the future is to own a large store in the town center. Magdelene hopes to use the additional income made possible by this loan to educate her children, meet basic expenses and save for investments she hopes to make some day in real estate.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Agustina es una señora trabajadora humilde con ganas de salir adelante y triunfar en la vida ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años le gusta mucho su negocio por que cada día trata de ganar mas clientes y con el buen trato que les da regresan a comprarles.
Tiene la cantidad  de dos hijos a quien quiere mucho y por quien trabaja esta muy agradecida con dios por todas las cosas buenas que le ha dado como son sus hijos, su negocio y a fundación ya que in su ayuda tal vez  ya hubiera perdido su negocio.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ropa como son ropa de  dama y caballero que es lo que mas se vende y  de lo que obtiene mas ganancias.
Les da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Agustina is a hardworking, humble woman. She is driven to succeed and get ahead in life. She has sold clothing for the past three years. She really likes her business. Every day she tries to gain more clients, and with the good service that she gives them, they come back to make purchases. 

She has two children that she loves very much. It is for them that she works. She gives thanks to God for all of the good things that He has given her, such as her children and her business. She is also thankful for the foundation, without which, she may have already lost her business. 

She requested a loan to purchase more clothing such as clothes for women and men, which are the best sellers and give her the most earnings. She is grateful to the foundation for the support that it has given her to get ahead and provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is 27 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, Uganda with her husband and three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the last two years, Maureen has worked hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, soap and other products for the home. To help expand her business, Maureen has applied for a loan for 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to buy more food for her family. Her goal for the future is to someday own a wholesale business. Maureen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that are too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more sugar, soap and other home supplies to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
La señora Silvina es una señora trabajadora con ganas de superarse y tener un mejor futuro.
La señora Silvina es viuda pero eso no le da miedo para enfrentarse a la vida si no le da fuerzas para darles una mejor  vida a sus hijos y mejorar  sus estudios.
Doña Silvina se dedica a la venta de comida  desde hace tres años elabora carne frita de res, enchiladas verdes, enchiladas rojas, sopes, tacos dorados y entomadas.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra  de: chile verde, cebolla, jitomate, carne de pollo, carne de res, aceite y maíz para la elaboración de tortillas.
Le da las gracias  a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Señora Silvina is a hardworking woman with the desire to excel and have a better future.

Señora Silvina is a widow but she is not afraid to face life, even if she does not have the strength, to give her children a better life and better education. 

Doña Silvina has been selling food for 3 years. She makes fried beef steak, green and red enchiladas, sopes (stuffed corn flour patties), fried tacos covered with a tomato chilli sauce.

She asked for the loan to buy green chillis, onions, chicken meat, beef, oil and corn to make tortillas. She gives her thanks to the Fundacion for the support it has given her to get ahead and tiumph in life.

loans.use: to buy chillis, tomatoes, onions, corn, etc.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma es una señora alegre, humilde, creativa, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde  hace cuatro años.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Luis con quien tiene un hijo por quien los dos trabajan ya que desean darle un mejor educación.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es atender a sus clientes para  que vuelvan a comprarle y se vayan con una buena impresión.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para la compra de ropa para dama y caballero que es lo que más se vende en su localidad.
Ella vende su ropa en pagos  y acotando, también vende productos de omilfe  desde hace  cinco años.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en: Señora Irma is a happy, humble and creative woman who has been selling clothes for the last 4 years. She is happily married to Señor Luis with whom she has 1 child for whom they both work as they wish to give him a better education. What she likes the most about her busiiness is serving her customers so that they return to buy again and leave with a good impression. She asked for the loan to buy ladies' and men's clothes which are what sells the best in her area. She sells her clothes on credit and for cash. She has also been selling Omnilife products for the last 5 years. She thanks the Fundacion for the support given her to get ahead and triumph in life.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Desde hace varios años Rosa se dedica a prestar servicios de belleza a sus cliente y con su negocios a podido sacar a delante a sus hijos y les a permitido tener una buena calidad de vida.

Ella tiene su propia sala de belleza, sin embargo necesita adecuarla mejor con sillas, tocadores y demás mobiliario que le permita prestar un mejor servicio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa has for several years offered beauty treatments to her clients. With her business she has been able to raise her children and allowed them to have a good standard of living.

She has her own beauty salon, however, she needs to fit it out better with chairs, dressers and other furniture which will allow her to give a better service and thus improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy dressers, chairs and hairwashers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
La señora  Araceli  nos cuenta que desde pequeña empezó a trabajar ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace cinco años es una señora que le gusta cumplir sus sueños y romper todas las piedras que se cruzan por su camino para lograr  lo que propone.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Gaudelino con quien tiene  dos hijos  por quien trabaja día a día para  que tenga un mejor futuro el día de mañana.
 Tambien vende dulces ,galletas en su casa para que los niños que salen de la escuela pasen a comprarle.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra  de ropa para niños y niñas dama y caballero ya que su esposo sale a vender a los pueblos vecinos y ella se queda vendiendo en casa.
Les da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para cambiar su vida  y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs.  Araceli tells us that she started working when she was very young. She has sold clothing for five years. This is a woman who enjoys fulfilling her dreams and breaking every barrier.
She is happily married to Mr. Gaudelino, and they have two children. They work hard every day so that their children can have a better future. She also sells candy and cookies from her home to the children who walk by after school.
She requested this loan for the purchase of clothing for men, women and children. Her husband travels to sell in the neighbouring villages and she stays home and sells from there.
She is grateful to the Fundacion for the support that they have offered so that she can change her life and offer her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 41 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, she has worked hard at her bar, where she sells soda and beer. To help expand her business, Harriet has applied for a loan for 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more soda and beer to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to buy food to feed her family. In the future, Harriet hopes to build rental houses. She is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that are too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda and beer to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela  tiene  cincuenta y cuatro años de edad, es una señora trabajadora  desde pequeña empezó a trabajar, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es acodar su ropa, ofrece sus servicios en su casa ya que todavía no cuenta  con un local.
También se dedica a la venta de chichorones, sabritas, refrescos y dulces.
Tiene un hijo es viuda ya que su esposo murió hace  tres años  pero gracias a dios pudo superar su perdida y salir adelante para enfrentar la vida  y aprovechar las cosas buenas.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de  más ropa como es vestido para niñas y vestidos para señoras.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ángela, 54, has been a hard worker all her life and started working when she was quite young. What she most enjoys about her business is folding the clothing. She sells from home because she does not have another location yet.
She also sells pork rinds, Sabrita snacks, pop, and candy.
She has one child and is a widow. Her husband died three years ago, but thanks to God she has been able to move past this loss, face life head on, and see the good.
She requested this loan for the purchase of more clothing, especially children's and women's clothing.
She is grateful to the Fundacion for this support so that she can get ahead and triumph in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 32 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her produce stand, which sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize and beans for resale and will help Winnie generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to continue expanding her business. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Winnie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora  Julia    se dedica a la venta de artesanías desde hace siete años.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es  ordenar  sus artesanías y visitar a las localidades vecinas  para que vean su mercancía.
Tambien tiene una tienda de abarrotes y tambien vende dulces y refrescos.
Es soltera pero eso no le  da miedo para enfrentarse a la vida  ya que  ella sola trabaja  y maneja su tiempo.
Pidió  el préstamo para comprar más  mercancía como es: trajes típicos, bolsas tejidas, aretes, collares y blusas tejidas.
L e da las gracias a fundación  por ser parte de  las cosas buenas que le han pasado en la vida.
texts.en:
Julia has been selling handicrafts for seven years.  What she likes the most about her business is ordering the handicrafts and visiting neighboring place so that her merchandise can be seen.

She also has a grocery store, and she sells sweets and soft drinks.  She is single, but this does not make her afraid to face life.  She works alone, and she manages her time.

She asked for the loan to buy more merchandise like typical dress, woven bags, earrings, necklaces, and woven blouses.

She thanks the Fundación for being part of the good things that have happened in her life.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Jose Rodrigo

texts.es:
Desde hace ya 28 años José Rodrigo e instructor de conducción, el con este trabajo de ha conseguido el sustento para su familia, además de poder darles a sus hijos estudio.

El para poder seguir trabajando necesita renovar su matrícula de instructor y de esta manera continuar construyendo el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Rodrigo has been a driving instructor for 28 years.  With this work he has supported his family in addition to being able to give his children an education.

In order to be able to continue working he needs to renew his instructor’s license.  That way he can continue building his children’s future.

loans.use: to renew his instructor's license.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula es una señora trabajadora humilde, con muchos sueños por realizar.
Doña Pau como sus compañeras de grupo la conocen se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace un  año, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es ofrecerle un buen servicio a sus clientes para que vuelvan a comprarle.
Doña Pau también vende dulces y refrescos, galletas y bolis.
Tiene un hijo quien le ayuda en lo que es acomodar la mercancía  y también en atender a los clientes cuando llegan muchos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra  de ropa  como es pantalones  para dama y caballero, vestidos para niñas que es lo que más se vende en su localidad.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paula is a hard-working and humble lady, with many dreams that she wants to fulfill. Her fellow group members call her Doña Pau.

Doña Pau has been selling clothes for the past year. What she likes most about her business is providing a good service to her customers, which encourages them to return.  Doña Pau also sells candy, sodas, cookies and pens. She has a son who helps her with arranging the goods and serving customers when the store gets busy. 

Doña Pau has asked for this loan to purchase clothing such as men and women's trousers and girls' dresses, which are the garments that she sells most of in her area. She thanks the foundation for the support she has been given to help her progress and succeed in life.

loans.use: purchase clothes for subsequent sale

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 29 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Tom has been working hard to manage his small shop, which provides computer services. 

To help expand his business, Tom has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more printing supplies and will help Tom generate greater profits and buy food to feed his family. Tom hopes that in the future he will be able to continue expanding his business. 

Tom is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tom who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more printing supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Mujeres con Futuro" esta conformado por 6 mujeres trabajadoras y muy responsables todas viven en la misma comunidad que se encuentra en lo mas alto de una colina, el nombre del grupo lo elijieron porque llevan tiempo trabajando en la institucion y en sus activiadades todas han prosprerado y se consideran mujeres sobresalientes es por eso que eligieron este nombre.
Marisol quien es la presentante del grupo tiene 28 años esta casada desde hace 9 años con el señor Anastacio quien trabaja de comerciante juntos han procreado 3 hijos David de 8 años se encuentra en tercer año de primaria, Leonardo Daniel de 6 años esta en 1 de primaria y Romina de tres años aun no va a la escuela.
Marisol se dedica a elaborar tejidos de estambre como chalecos, sueteres, tambien hace costuras (servilletas, manteles). Esta vez has solicitado el credito para comprar estambres, hilos, aujas, adornos u accesorios. 
Su desafio que presenta es que hay dias en los que no tiene dinero para cubrir con todos sus pedidos pendientes entonces muchas veces tiene que retrasarlos, tambien se le complica consegir el material a buen precio ella prefiere comprar sus productos por mayoreo yaq ue asi sale mas barato.
Una de sus metas es llegar a tener un local donde pueda exponer sus  bordados y tejidos tambien le gustaria enseñarle a otrs personas como se teje y borda.
Todas las integrantes estan muy contentsa y agradecidas ya que comentan "Gracias al prestamo nosotras comprraremos para invertir en nuestras actividades, yo Margarita comprare Juagolotes pra despues verder, yo talalia comprare productos de belleza para luego vender, yo Maridalia comprare guantes, gorros, bufandas para vender en este temporada de frios, yo karina invertire en una tienda de abarrotes, y yo Alicia invertire en pollos esto nos ayudara a mejorar nuestra calidad de vida"
texts.en:
The group, “Mujeres con Futuro” (Women with a Future) is made up of six hardworking and very responsible women from the same community.  The community is located atop a hill.  They selected this name because they’ve been working with the institution for a long time and they have all prospered in their businesses.  They consider themselves to be survivors, so they selected this name.


Marisol represents the group and is 28 years old.  She’s been married to Anastacio for nine years and they have three children, 8 year old David who’s in third grade, 6 year old Leonardo Daniel who’s in first grade, and 3 year old Romania who does not go to school yet.  Anastacio works as a merchant.


Marisol knits things like vests, sweaters, and also sews napkins and tablecloths.  This time she is asking for this loan to buy knitting needles, thread, sewing needles, adornments, and accessories.


Her challenge is that there are days where she doesn’t have enough money to fill all of her pending orders, so many times she has to backorder them.  It’s also difficult for her to find the raw materials at good prices.  She prefers buying her products in quantity because they’re less expensive.  One of her goals is to have a shop where she can show her embroidery and knitting.  She would also like to teach other people to knit and embroider.


All of the members are very happy and grateful and say, “Thanks to the loans, we are able to invest into our businesses.  I, Margarita, will buy toys to resell; I, Talalia will buy beauty products; I Maridalia will buy gloves, hats, and scarves for the cold season; I, Karina will invest in a grocery store; and I, Alicia will invest in chickens.”

loans.use: to buy supplies for needlework.

loans.name: La Iniciativa Group

texts.es: Este Grupo solidario se llama La Iniciativa, está conformado por la señora Fortunata va a comprar con su préstamo alimento para puerco, la señora Paula va a comprar ropa de dama, caballero y niños, la señora Verónica va a comprar agua por garrafones, la señora Florencia va a comprar chocolates, chicles, paletas, chicharrones, etc. La señora Maira Elizet va a comprar zapatos para dama y caballeros, la señora Herminia va a comprar puercos. La señora Fortunata tiene 58 años de edad, ella es soltera, tiene 2 hijos 1 varón de 17 años de edad ya trabaja en el campo ya le ayuda a pescar y 1 mujer que estudia la secundaria, ella vende pescado, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar 1 tarraya para pescar, ella inicio su negocio hace 18 años este negocio es un sustento de su localidad, ella sale a vender su pescado al mercado de otra comunidad en trasporte colectivo, su negocio es importante porque de ahí van comiendo y es el sustento de la familia, ella está orgullosa de su negocio de ser su propio patrón y gracias a este negocio siempre tienen para comer.  Su negocio es importante porque ofrece a sus clientas, las señoras amas de casa el pescado fresco vivo, ella utiliza las ganancia para comprar lo que necesita en su casa, para la comida y para los gastos de la escuela de su hija, sus sueños y esperanza son agrandar su negocio, que sus hijos tengan donde vivir y que sigan estudiando, los integrantes del grupo le quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “ les agradecemos sus préstamos, esperamos no defraudarlos y que nos sigan prestando para crecer nuestros negocios”.
texts.en:
This group, called “La Iniciativa,” (The Initiative), includes Fortunata who will use her part of the money from this loan to buy feed for her pigs; Paula will use her part to buy men’s, women’s, and children’s  clothing; Verónica will buy large bottles of water; Florencia will buy chocolates, gum, suckers, pork rinds, etc.  Maira Elizet will buy men’s and lady’s shoes; Herminia will buy pigs.

Fortunata is 58 years old, single, and has two children; a 17 year old son who works in the fields, and a daughter who attends junior high school.  [Fortunata] sells fish and is asking for this loan to buy a fishing net.  She started her business 18 years ago and now it’s a community staple.  She goes out to sell her fish in the market in a different community and this is how she supports her family.  She’s proud of her business, of being a good employer, and always being able to feed her family.

Her business is important because it offers her clients, the ladies of their houses, fresh live fish.  She uses her earnings to buy the things needed in her household, to buy food, and pay her daughter’s school expenses.  Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business, that her children will have a place to live, and that they stay in school.

The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad, “We appreciate your loans and we promise not to defraud you.  We hope that you will continue to give us loans so that we can grow our businesses.”

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Jhon Herney

texts.es:
Desde hace 15 años aproximadamente Jhon Herney tiene un taller de confecciones. Aprendió desde muy joven esta labor  y en su taller tiene 3 operarias  y cada 8 días entrega producción.

Para que su taller continúe creciendo necesita una máquina plana y así mejora su producción y la calidad de sus prendas, además asi mejora su calidad de vida y el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jhon Herney has had a sewing workshop for the past 15 years.  He learned to do this when he was very young and has three employees.  He delivers his items every week.

He needs to buy another sewing machine so that he can continue growing the business and also improve his production.  He also wants to improve his and his children’s quality of life.

loans.use: Compra de maquina plana

loans.name: La Cueva Del Cabrito  ( Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama la cueva del cabrito y se integra de tres señoras   quien cada una tiene su respectiva actividad y se ubica en un barrio pequeño.

 La señora quien se le tomo al entrevista se llama María Saray  ella es casada  con el señor  Rafael y con quien procreo y con quien  procreo tres hijos que a un está a su responsabilidad.

   Solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta d en  compra de mercancía como son: frijol, aceite, harina, huevo, galletas, refrescos, entre otros,  para surtir su tienda de abarrotes  en donde lleva trabajando ocho años y un mes  y cometa que la va bien ya  que con ello ha mejorado muchos sus ingresos para su hogar y su negocio.

    Quien la inspiro en esta actividad  fue su familia quien le comentaron que pusiera un negocio ya que  esta en un lugar la cual se vendería bien y le daría resultado en sus venta  en la que le  da gracias a dios por que le  va bien.

   Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad  y el préstamo  ella pueda seguir  trabajando para incrementar más sus ingresos para su familia que es la más importante para ella.
 
    Las personas que integran en el grupo son las señoras: María de Jesús quien invertirá en la compra y veta de de ropas para damas caballeros y niños por otra parte la señora América  quien invertía en la compra y venta de depósito de refresco.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Cueva del Cabrito,” (The Little Goat’s Cave) is in a small neighborhood and is made up of three ladies, each with their own business.

The lady we interviewed is named María Saray.  She’s married to Rafael and they have three children who depend on them.

She asked for this loan in order to invest in merchandise, such as beans, cooking oil, flour, eggs, cookies, and soft drinks, among other things, so that she can stock her grocery store that she’s been running for the past eight years and one month.  She says that things are going well for her and this will help her grow her business and increase her household income.
  
It was her family who inspired her to start this business, because she is in an area where sales would be good and she gives thanks to God that things have gone well for her.

She would like, with the help of this loan, to be able to continue working in her small business so that she can increase her family’s income.  They are the most important thing to her. 

The members of this group are: María de Jesús, who will use the money to invest in buying and selling ladies’, men’s and children’s clothing.  América will invest in a soda machine.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Wendy Group

texts.es: Loa nuevos integrantes son la señora Juana va a comprar con su prestamo cafe "XN" para diabetico y el joven Ivan va a comprar zapotos por mayoreo, las demas integrantes sigen en su actividad que vienen desempeñando. La señora Ana María tiene 60 años de edad, ella es viuda tiene 6 hijos 3 mujeres y 3 varones todos mayores de edad ya casados e independientes, ella tiene un taller de costura, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar hilos, tela, cierres, bies, botones, tijeras, alfileres, agujas, cinta métrica y una parte para lo que necesite en su casa, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años a ella le gusta coser confecciona  faldas, blusas, vestidos y trajes de bailables de la escuela , también pone cierres, ella no estudio corte pero ella trabajo medio año con una señora que tenía su taller de costura ponía cierres, componía faldas y le gusto, ella pensó en poner su taller y no sentirse sola, su negocio es importante porque le gusta confeccionar faltas y blusas, su negocio es conocido por el buen precio y por la calidad de su trabajo, ella utiliza las ganancias para pagar la luz el agua, sus sueños y esperanza son si Dios le presta vida abrir su negocio de jugos, paletas, esquimos y que sus hijos estén bien de salud y en su trabajo. Los integrantes del grupo le quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos su apoyo, son muy amables de su parte darnos estos préstamos sin conocernos y nos van ayudar mucho a crecer los negocios”.
texts.en:
The new members are Juana who will use her loan to by “XN” coffee for diabetics; and Ivan who will buy shoes in quantity.  The rest of the members will continue in their businesses.

Ana María is 60 years old.  She’s a widow and has six adult children, three daughters and three sons, all adults, married, and on their own.  She has a sewing shop and requested her loan to buy thread, fabric, zippers, snaps, buttons, scissors, pins, needles, measuring tapes, and some things that she needs in her home.  She started her business three years ago and she likes making skirts, blouses, dresses, and dance outfits for schools.  She also adds zippers.  She did not study sewing formally, but she worked for another lady who had a workshop, adding zippers, for six months.  She also repaired skirts and she liked it and thought about starting her own workshop so that she would not feel alone.  Her business is important because she likes making skirts and blouses, and it’s well known for its good prices and quality.  She uses the earnings to pay for water and electricity.  Her hopes and dreams are, God willing, to start an amusement business, including sweets and ice cream, and that her children remain well in their health and work.

The group’s members would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “We appreciate your support.  You are very friendly for giving us these loans without knowing us.  They will help us very much in growing our businesses.”

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.en:
In his native country, the Dominican Republic, Jorge worked at an electronics business where he was twice recognized as the most innovative employee at the company. He then moved to Mexico to study electronics and satellite systems before relocating to the United States in search of more opportunities. Jorge started working at a company that specializes in building alarm systems—this is where he got the idea to launch his own electronics business. 

Four years later, Jorge’s business offers five core services including security system installation, computer repair, POS system installation, soap distribution, and marketing services for small businesses through his television programs with two TV channels in Boston. Jorge’s son works with him part-time to install alarm systems at local businesses. Today, Jorge is growing his business to serve clients in additional neighborhoods of Boston and was recently recognized as Latino Business Person of the Year by the North Shore Business Association. The impacts of the recession on other businesses have encouraged Jorge to expand and innovate by trading services with other small businesses in his area.

After attending a financial management workshop with Accion USA, Jorge applied for a loan and is using it to purchase cameras, cables, screens and other equipment in bulk. Purchasing large quantities of inventory will help keep costs down, as well as help Jorge grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase cameras, cables, and screens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bedcovers.

loans.name: Deysi Yolanda

texts.es:
La  joven Deysi tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el caserio Soni y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, Deysi es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, la joven Deysi se levanta a las 5 de la mañana todos los dias para atender a su  clientela, el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia al por mayor y asi surtir su negocio, se aproxima la navidad y quiere comprar unos productos que no tiene en existencia y que sus clientes le estan pidiendo.
Deysi es madre de 2 hijos los cuales estan pequeños de edad.
      
Sus tiempos libres se lo dedica a sus hijos y tambien a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
texts.en:
Deysi is a young person, 27 years old. She lives in the village of Soni and she sells basic staples. 

Deysi is a hardworking woman and is eager to get ahead. Her business is located in her home. Deysi gets up at 5:00AM every morning in order to assist her clients. 

This loan is to buy merchandise at wholesale to supply her business. Christmas is on the way and she wants to buy some products that she does not have on-hand that her clients have been asking for.

Deysi is the mother of 2 young children. In her free time she takes care of her children and she raises chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to buy groceries, basic grains and dairy products

loans.name: Zacapalco Group

texts.es: La señora Fidelfa tiene 44 años de edad, ella es casada, su esposo es jornalero ellos tienen 4 hijos 2 hombres ya mayores de edad y 2 mujeres que están estudiando una bachilleres y otra la primaria, ella vende ropa de bazar, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar blusas, zapatos, botas, camisas, pantalones, vestido, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años para tener ingresos para su casa ya que había escases, su esposo le dio para comprar la paca de ropa. A ella le gusta vender,  sus clientas son las señoras y muchachas a quien atiende amablemente y cordialmente para que regresen a comprar sus productos, ella cada semana los días martes es día de tianguis en su comunidad baja a vender la ropa, también llegan a su casa a comprar la ropa,  ella utiliza las ganancias para pagar su préstamo y para comprar lo que necesite en su casa, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio comprar más ropa para tener bien surtido su negocio y darle mejor servicio al cliente y lo piensa logar con las ganancias. Sus sueños y esperanzas son vivir mejor, que sus hijos estén bien y agrandar su negocio. Ella está contenta con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar la ropa para surtir su negocio. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos sus prestamos gracias a Dios y a ustedes tenemos la oportunidad de estos prestamos, gracias por confiar en nosotros".
texts.en:
Fidelfa is 44 years old.  She’s married and her husband is a laborer.  They have four children, two sons and two daughters who attend school, some at university and some in elementary school.  She sells clothing at the market and is asking for this loan to buy blouses, shoes, purses, shirts, pants, and dresses.  She started this business two years ago in order to have an income for her household, since there was a shortage.  Her husband gave her the money to buy a pack of clothing.

She enjoys selling.  Her customers are ladies and young women to whom she offers cordial, friendly service so that they will return to buy her products.  Every Tuesday is market day in her community and she sets up to sell clothing.  She uses her income to repay her loan and buy what she needs at home.

She’s planning to expand her business and buy more clothing in order to have a good selection and be able to provide better service to her customers.  She will do this with her earnings.  Her hopes and dreams are to have a better life, for her children to be well, and to grow her business.

She’s grateful for this loan that she is about to receive.  She will buy clothing to stock her business.  The members of the group would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “We are grateful for your loans.  Thanks to God and to you, we have the opportunity for these loans.  Thank you for believing in us.”

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: El Carrizo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el Carrizo está conformado por  once  integrantes indígenas con deseos de superarse y darle una mejor vida a sus familias.
Sus integrantes decidieron ponerle El CARRIZO a su grupo por que se identifican con su localidad sus culturas y sus tradiciones.
Las integrantes son cuentan que están muy  orgullosas una de la otra ya que juntas se siente seguras para realizar sus sueños y apoyarse una de la otra  que sus negocios crezcan cada día mas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Claudia de cincuenta años de edad, es una señora responsable trabajadora y llena de fuerzas para apoyar a sus compañeras y a su familia.
Doña Clau como le dicen sus compañeras de grupo se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes desde hace cinco años.
Ella nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es tener limpia su tienda para que de un buen aspecto y también nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de quesos ya que su esposo Julián  va ordeñar y cada lunes, miércoles y viernes se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más mercancía de abarrotes como son: chiles secos y chiles verdes, jitomate, galletas, aceite, jugos, refrescos, sabritas, dulces y pan.
Está muy contenta y agradecida con fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante  a ella y a sus compañeras ya que todas son mujeres trabajadoras, humildes con ganas de triunfar en la vida.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Leovigilda– se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Dominga- se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos.
Adelfa- se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Fidelfa – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Rosa- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Margarita- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Ángela   Micaela - se dedica a la venta de postres.
Sofía- se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Elena- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
María del Carmen – se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Bernabé- se dedica a la venta de  mercancía de abarrotes.

Gracias fundación por ayudar a la gente humilde y mixteca que tiene sueños por cumplir y gracias  por ayudarnos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Carrizo” and is made up of eleven members with a desire to get ahead and provide better lives for their families.  They decided to call the group “El Carrizo” because they identified with their area, its culture, and traditions.

The members are very proud of one another, since they feel certain to be able to achieve their dreams together and support one another in their businesses.  They grow more each day.

Claudia is one of the members.  She’s 50 years old, and is a very hardworking responsible lady full of energy to support her fellow members and her family.

Ms. Clau, as her fellow members refer to her, has been selling groceries for five years.  

She says that what she likes most about her business is keeping her store clean in order to give a good impression.  She also says that she sells cheeses.  Her husband, Julián, milks the cows, and she sells cheese on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays.

She requested this loan to buy more groceries, such as dried peppers, green peppers, tomatoes, cookies, cooking oil, juices, soft drinks, potato chips, candy, and bread.  She is very happy and grateful to the foundation for the support it’s given her and her colleagues, because they’re all hardworking, humble women with a desire to get ahead in life. 

The other members of the group are:

Leovigilda – sells Mexican food
Dominga – sells Mexican food
Adelfa – sells fruits and vegetables
Fidelfa – sells Mexican food
Rosa – sells Mexican food
Margarita – sells bread
Ángela Micaela – sells desserts
Sofía – sells fish
Elena – sells soft drinks
María del Carmen – sells chickens
Bernabé – sells groceries

Thank you for helping for helping the humble, diverse people with dreams to fulfill.  Thanks for helping us.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Abasolo San Juan Jicayan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Abasolo San Juan Jicayan  está conformado por once mujeres indígenas, trabajadoras con muchas ganas de salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
Sus integrantes decidieron ponerle Abasolo San Juan Jicayan porque se siente orgullosa de su localidad y de sus artesanías y de cultura y vestimenta.
Las integrantes de este grupo  son personas indígenas que casi no hablan el español, se comunican por el idioma mixteco.
Su vestimenta  es una falda de huipil o bien conocida como nagua y en su pecho solo utilizan un pequeño trapo color blanco.
Esta vestimenta solo las usan las abuelitas  ya que esa cultura se va perdiendo cada día más.
Una de sus integrantes es la señora Francisca de treinta y un año de edad  es una señora humilde y con muchos sueños por cumplir.
Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales  de costilla de marano, tamales de pollo en mole y tamales de chipiles con pollo.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Agustín de cuarenta y cinco años de edad con quien tiene  cuatro hijos Briseida de diez años de edad, Dagoberto de cuatro años de edad y Fernando Ignacio de siete años de edad, ya que Doña Francisca está embarazada  tiene seis meses de embarazo.
Uno de sus sueños es tener una tienda de abarrotes  ya que le gusta mucho atender a sus clientes y dar su mercancía en pago para beneficiar  a la gente podre como ella.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de chiles, cebollas, tomates, aceite, manteca, maíz para la masa y hojas de plátano.
Está muy contenta  por el apoyo que le ha dado fundación a ella y a todas las personas que las necesitan un apoyo para octenerun negocio y ayudar a sus familias.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
Valencia- se dedica a la venta de elaboración de servilletas.
Elvira – se dedica a la venta de venta de pan.
Edna – se dedica a la venta de compra de maíz para la venta.
Gabriela- se dedica a la venta de compra de  frutas para la venta.
Hilaria- se dedica a la venta de servilletas.
Julia- se dedica a la venta de  pan.
Angélica María- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Aurelia- se dedica a la venta de maíz.
Alicia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Lucia – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.

Gracias fundación por el apoyo que le das a las familias podres con deseos de superación como nosotros.
texts.en:
This group is called “Abasolo San Juan Jicayan” and is made up of 11 hardworking, indigenous ladies with a great desire to get ahead and succeed in life.  They decided to call the group “Abasolo San Juan Jicayan” because they are proud of their area, its art, culture, and clothing.

The members of this group are indigenous and don’t speak very much Spanish.  They communicate in Mixteco.

Their dress is a huipil skirt, or better known as nagua, and a small white top.  Only grandmothers wear this type of outfit because this style of dress is disappearing more and more each day.

Fransisca is one of the members.  She’s 31 years old and is a humble woman with a desire to please.  She sells pork tamales, chicken tamales in mole, and chipile tamales with chicken. 

She is happily married to 45 year old Agustín and they have four children; 10 year old Briseida, four year old Dagoberto, and seven year old Fernando Ignacio.  She’s also six months pregnant.

One of her dreams is to have a grocery store because she really enjoys serving her customers and selling her merchandise on credit to help out the poor people, like herself.  She is asking for this loan to buy peppers, onions, tomatoes, cooking oil, lard, dried corn for dough, and banana leaves.

She is very grateful for the support from the foundation, to her and to other people who need it to grow their businesses and help their families.

The other members of the group are:

Valencia – makes and sells napkins
Elvira – sells bread
Edna – buys and sells corn
Gabriela – buys and sells fruits and vegetables
Hilaria – sells napkins
Julia – sells bread
Angélica María – sells Mexican food
Aurelia – sells corn
Alicia – sells Mexican food
Lucia – sells Mexican food 

Thank you foundation for the support you provide to poor families with a desire to succeed, like us.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Las Chispitas ( Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las chispitas y se integra de  tres señoras quienes viven en una localidad muy pequeña.

   Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama esperanza  quien es casada con el señor  Hipólito y con quien procreo  sietes hijos quienes  ya todos están casados y la a poya con los ingresos de la casa, ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  mercancía  como son: harina, huevo, aceite, leche, galletas, entre otros para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, a un así también se dedica a la elaboración de panes  que sale a vender casa por casa.

   Quien la animo a esta actividad fue su hijo quine le dio unos ahorritos para poner  otro negocio que le deje ingresos para  que juntos con su esposo  trabajen y mejoren sus ingresos de la  casa.

Lo que ella desea es que con estas dos actividades logre ahorrar para comprar materiales y construir un local para poner más amplia su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Chispitas” and is made up of three ladies who live in a very small community.

Esperanza was the one interviewed.  She’s married to Hipólito and the have seven children, all married now.  He supports her with his income.  She asked for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as flour, eggs, cooking oil, milk, and cookies, among other things to stock her grocery store.  She also bakes bread and sells it door to door.

It was her son who encouraged her to start this business, and gave her some of his savings to start another business so that she and her husband could work together and increase their household income. 

What she desires is to be able to save up to buy building materials to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: San Judas Group

texts.es:
El  grupo se llama San Judas y se integra de  tres señoras quien  cada una tiene su  respectiva actividad y viven en una localidad muy bonita ya que tiene un excobento.

La señora quien se le tomo la  entrevista se llama  María Flor de Luz, ella es casada con el señor  Amín y con quien procreo  una hija que tiene la edad de tres años, solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de refrescos, como también  es para darle mantenimientos a sus maquinitas de video  juego.
 Quien lo motivo a  esta actividad fue su esposo  ya que llego un señor quien daba rentado maquinitas y como  su esposo tenia  a unos  ahorros le  rento dos y después con el tiempo se las compro  y comenta que le va bien ya  que con  las ganancias  ha comprado mas que ya tiene quince  juegos.

 Lo que más desea  es que con su pequeña   actividad pueda mejorar cada día más sus  ingresos  para que con el tiempo  tenga una papelería.
 
  Quienes integran en el grupo son las  señoras: María  quien invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas y la señora Sonia,  quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de ropas.
texts.en:
The group is called San Judas, and it is comprised of three women.  Each one of them has their respective business activity.  They live in a very pretty place because it has an ex-convent. 

María Flor de Luz is the woman who was interviewed.  She is married to Amín, and they have a three year old daughter.

She requested the loan to buy soft drinks.  She will also use the loan for maintenance on her video game machines.

Her husband motivated her in this business activity.  A man arrived who rented out the small machines.  As her husband had some savings, he rented two.  Later, as time passed, he bought the machines.  She says that it is going very well for her.  With the income she has bought more, and she now has 15 games.

What she wishes for the most is that with her small business she will be able to improve her income each day.  She wants this to, in time, open a stationery business.

María is a member of the group.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make food.  Sonia, the other member of the group, will use the loan to buy and sell clothes.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her small machines.

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Manantial está conformado por  doce mujeres indígenas llenas de sueños que poco a poco van haciendo realidad gracias a fundación ya que antes ninguna contaba con un negocio pero gracias a dios y al trabajo de cada una están haciendo sus sueños realidad.
Decidieron ponerle Manantial al grupo por que se intensifican  como un manantial ya que son personas indígenas dignas de ser apoyadas  y transparente como el agua.
Hablan el idioma mixteco su vestimenta son naguas y mandiles.
Una de las  integrantes es la señora  Catalina de treinta y cinco años de edad, se dedica a la venta  servilletas y piezas para motocicletas  desde hace tres años.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Margarito de  treinta y cinco años de edad , con quien tiene  tres hijos dos mujeres y un varón.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es tejer y bordar, doña Catalina es una señora muy creativa y talentosa.
Uno de sus sueños es tener un local donde pueda exhibir sus mercancías  y las personas aprecien y reconozcan su trabajo.
Pidió el préstamo para comprar más: hilos de colores, aros, ganchos para tejer, listones y ajugas.
Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le ha dado  que les ha dado fundación a las personas de su grupo ya que son personas que desean superarse y darles una mejor vida a sus familias.
Las integrantes del grupo son: 
Cesilia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Antonia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Juana- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Isabel- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Gloria- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Cecilia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Luciana- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Aurelia- se dedica a la venta de venta de ropa.
Benita Ángela  – se dedica  a la venta de alfarería.
Sofía Josefa   - se dedica a la venta de  quesos.
Felicita- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.


Gracias fundación por ayudar a la gente  trabajadora y pobre con ganas de  enfrentar a la vida.
texts.en:
This group, called Manantial [Spring], is made up of twelve indigenous women who are full of dreams that are slowly becoming a reality thanks to the foundation. Before, none of them had their own business but thanks to God and the work that each one of them put in, their dreams are coming true. They decided to call the group Manantial [Spring] because they gather strength like a spring does, they are indigenous people worthy of support and they are as transparent as water. They the Mixtecan language. They wear petticoats and aprons. 

One of the members is Señora Catalina who is thirty five years old. She has sold napkins and motorcycle parts for a living for the past three years. She is happily married to Señor Margarito who is thirty five years old and they have three children - two girls and a boy. The thing she likes most about her business is tiling and embroidery. Doña Catalina is a very creative and talented lady. One of her dreams is to have a place to showcase her merchandise so people can appreciate and recognize her work. She requested the loan to buy more colored threads, hoops, sewing hooks, ribbons and needles. 

She is very grateful for the support that the foundation has given to to her and the people in her group as they want to better themselves and give their families a better life. The members of the group are:

Cesilia - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.
Antonia - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.
Juana - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.
Isabel - She sells bread for a living.
Gloria - She sells bread for a living.
Cecilia - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.
Luciana - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.
Aurelia - She sells clothes for a living.
Benita Ángela - She sells pottery for a living.
Sofía Josefa - She sells cheese for a living.
Felicita - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.

Thank you to the foundation for helping the poor, hardworking people who want to face up to life.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles and calico to make napkins.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón tiene 61 años de edad es casado tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 20, 19, 17, 15, 13 y 11 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.Simón es jornalero se dedica a sembrar arroz, maíz hace 50 años, Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en ventanas.


Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la siembra de maíz, arroz y poder comprar los abonos agrícolas.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos sin ningún tipo de problema. El sueño es poder tener terreno y una casa. 
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse más al trabajo.
texts.en:
Simón is 61 years old, married and has six children.  He lives with his wife and children who are 20, 19, 17, 15, 13 and 11 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Las Palmas” communal bank are located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.  Simón is a day laborer who has been growing rice and corn for 50 years.  His purchases and his sales take place in Ventanas.

He is asking for the loan to work his corn and rice crops and to be able to buy agricultural manure.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy supplies problem-free.  His dream is to have a piece of land and a house.  He has had no type of problem and in his free time he enjoys spending still more time working.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Tomas Martin

texts.es:
Tomás Martín tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 11, 8 y 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Tomás se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 15 años  , Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Pueblo Viejo.

Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la siembra de maíz, arroz y poder comprar los abonos agrícolas.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos sin ningún tipo de problema. El sueño es poder comprase un tractor. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Tomás Martín is 31 years old, in a common law relationship and has three children.  He lives with his wife and children who are 11, 8 and 5 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Las Palmas” communal bank are located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.  Tomás is a farmer who has been growing rice and corn for 15 years.  His purchases and his sales take place in Pueblo Viejo.

He is asking for the loan to work his corn and rice crops and to be able to buy agricultural manure.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy supplies problem-free.  His dream is to be able to buy a tractor.  He has had no type of problem and in his free time he enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Damaris Elena

texts.es:
Damaris tiene 40 años y vive con su familia en la maravillosa provincia de Limón la cual marca una gran diversidad cultural: con una población predominantemente negra y con importantes rasgos de la cultura indígena costarricense, la afro caribeña, blancos y chinos, cada grupo le aporta a la zona su estilo propio. Esta provincia tiene hermosas lugares con arenas blancas, playas y palmeras y exuberantes parques nacionales que protegen bosques húmedos tropicales y arrecifes de coral, así como centenares de especies de flora y de fauna en vías de extinción. El parque nacional Tortuguero, contiene la muestra más grande de bosque húmedo tropical protegido y aquí usted podrá recorrer sus canales y ríos, observar la flora y la fauna, apreciar el desove de las tortugas marinas y tener la oportunidad de observar a más de 300 especies de aves dentro de las que se encuentra la lapa verde, el pavón y los tucanes. En esta zona se llevan a cabo importantes investigaciones científicas y se ha convertido en un punto especial para el turismo científico y ecológico.

Hace unos meses atrás Damaris desea tener suficiente mercadería para asi poder salir adelante con su negocio, dedicarle más tiempo, para asi brindarles a los vecinos de la comunidad  prendas de calidad. Con el ingreso que obtenga de este negocio le dará también una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Es por esto que Damaris está solicitando un crédito por el monto de 596,000.00 (quinientos noventa y seis mil colones), para comprar mercadería, específicamente mas ropa, para asi continuar haciendo sus ventas ambulantes y llegar a alcanzar sus metas.

Damaris es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y están felices porque los resultados han sido muy buenos y la Empresa ha ayudado a muchas mujeres a trabajar en sus diferentes negocios.
texts.en:
Damaris, 40, lives with her family in the wonderful province of Limón which is noted for its cultural diversity.  Its population is predominantly Black with important traits from Costa Rican indigenous culture: Afro-Caribbean, White and Chinese.  Each of these groups contributes its own particular style.  

This province has beautiful places with white sand, beaches, palm trees and exuberant national parks that protect tropical rain forests and coral reefs as well as hundreds of species of flora and fauna in danger of extinction.  

The Tortuguero national park contains the largest protected rain forest and one can travel its canals and rivers, observe flora and fauna, witness sea turtles laying their eggs and have the opportunity of observing over 300 species of birds among which are the Green Macaw, the Great Curassow and Toucans.  Important scientific investigations take place here and it has become a special point for scientific and ecological tourism.

For a few months now Damaris has wanted to have sufficient merchandise available to get ahead with her business and dedicate more time to it thus providing local residents with high quality items of clothing.  With income earned in this business she will also provide her family with a better quality of life.

Because of this, Damaris is asking for a 596,000.00 (five-hundred ninety-six thousand colones) loan to buy merchandise, specifically more clothing to continue her street sales and to reach her goals.

Damaris is a member of the “Batán” communal bank one of EDESA’s 150 social organizations in Costa Rica.  They are happy because results have been very good and the firm has helped many women to work in their various businesses.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 10, 9, 7 y 2 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 20 años.  Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abonos agrícolas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos sin ningún tipo de problema. El sueño es poder comprase una casa. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
José Luis is 33 years old, in a common law relationship and has four children.  He lives with his wife and children who are 10, 9, 7 and 2 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Las Palmas” communal bank are located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.  José is a farmer who has been growing rice and corn for 20 years.  His purchases and his sales take place in Ventanas.

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds and agricultural manure.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy supplies problem-free.  His dream is to be able to buy a tractor.  He has had no type of problem and in his free time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es:
La sra. Gloria tiene 42 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de peroles, utencilios para cocinar elaborados de metal, sus ventas las realiza a personas que viajan, ya que su negocio esta ubicado en la frontera de Honduras - Nicaragua, muchas personas la prefieren ya que la calidad de sus productos es buena y los precios son bajos comparados con otros vendedores. Gloria todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para salir a vender sus peroles, muchas personas transitan temprano y ahi es donde ella aprovecha a venderles sus peroles.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de peroles, viene la navidad y muchas personas compran este tipo de mercaderia, desea estar preparada para dicha temporada.
Gloria es madre de  3 hijos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old, and she engages in selling saucepans, cooking tools made of metal. She sells her products to travelers crossing the border between Honduras and Nicaragua, which is where her shop is located. Many people choose her because of the good quality of her products and because her prices are low compared to those of other sellers. Every day Gloria gets up very early to go selling her saucepans, as many people cross the border early in the morning and she takes advantage of this to seller her saucepans.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy saucepans. As Christmas is approaching and many people buy this kind of products, so she wants to be ready for the upcoming season.
Gloria has 3 children.
She uses the earnings she makes to pay for her household expenses.

loans.use: To buy kitchen tools.

loans.name: Cornelio Cipriano

texts.es:
Cornelio Sipriano tiene 48 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 20, 19,16 y 7 años en el cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Cornelio se dedica al agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz hace 22 años, Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Pueblo viejo.

Solicita el crédito para seguir trabajando en la siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar sin ningún tipo de problema los insumos. El sueño es poder hacer un mejoramiento en la vivienda, No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Cornelio Cipriano is 48 years old, in a common law relationship and has four children.  He lives with his wife and children who are 20, 19, 16 and 7 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Las Palmas” communal bank are located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.  Cornelio is a farmer who has been growing rice and corn for 22 years.  His purchases and his sales take place in Pueblo Viejo.

He is asking for the loan to continue working his corn and rice crops.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy supplies problem-free.  His dream is to be able to do some home improvements.  He has had no type of problem and in his free time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Ninfa Teodora

texts.es:
Ninfa Teodora tiene 46 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 25, 22 y 10 años de edad en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Ninfa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 10 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realizan en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la agricultura, comprar abonos agrícolas. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar los insumos. El sueño es poder tener un terreno. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar la natación.
texts.en:
Ninfa Teodora, 46, lives in a common law relationship and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 25, 22 and 10 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “Las Palmas” communal bank located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.

Ninfa has been growing corn and rice for ten years.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Ventanas.  

She is asking for the loan to work in farming and to buy manure.  With help from the loan she will be able to acquire the supplies.  Her dream is to own a piece of land.  She’s had no type of problem with her crops and in her free time she likes to swim.

loans.use: to work in farming and to buy manure.

loans.name: Cecilia Gladys

texts.es:
Cecilia Gladys tiene 53 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 35, 32 y 24 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Cecilia se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 20 años.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en ventanas. Solicita el crédito para seguir trabajando en la siembra y compra de abonos agrícolas.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar los insumos a tiempo.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir de visita donde los familiares.
texts.en:
Cecilia Gladys, 53, lives in a common law relationship and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 35, 32 and 24 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “Las Palmas” communal bank located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.

Cecilia has been growing corn and rice for twenty years.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Ventanas.  

She is asking for the loan to continue to work in farming and to buy manure.  With help from the loan she will be able to acquire the supplies in time.  She’s had no type of problem and in her free time she likes to go spend time with her relatives.

loans.use: to continue working in farming and to buy manure.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia se dedica al comercio de calzados,  cuenta con puesto de venta y también lo realiza de forma ambulante en los días que no hay feria tanto en la ciudad de Cochabamba y la ciudad de Quillacollo, la señora se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace diez años dicha actividad la iniciaron conjuntamente su hermana y esta es su única fuente de ingresos,  solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo ya que comprara calzados por mayor,  ya que por las fiestas de fin de año las ventas se incrementan y necesita comprar mercadería con anticipación ya que los precios se incrementan para dichas fechas, es soltera y vive con su madre, ella sola con esta actividad mantiene a su madre, es una persona muy amable se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Julia is a footwear merchant; she has a sales stand and on non-market days she also sells as a street vendor in the city of Cochabamba and in the city of Quillacollo.  She’s been in this business for ten years having started it in partnership with her sister; this is her only source of income.  

She’s asking for a loan to use as working capital since she will buy footwear at wholesale because during the end-of-year festivities sales increase and she needs to buy merchandise ahead of time because prices rise in those days.

She’s single and lives with her mother and she supports her mother alone through this business.  She is a very kind person who feels happy about the support provided.

loans.use: to buy footwear at wholesale.

loans.name: Nelson Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Nelson tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de San Marcos de Colon, junto con el viven sus hijos y su esposa, Nelson es un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su negocio propio que es venta de calzado, dicha actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, su negocio esta ubicado en un punto estrategico por el cual transitan muchas personas y esto hace que sea muy visitado, todos los dias se lavanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de calzado al por mayor para tener mayores ventas y buenos ingresos para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Nelson is 41 years old and he lives in the town of San Marcos de Colon with his wife and their children. Nelson is a hardworking man committed to his retail activity: he sells shoes, an activity he has been engaged in for 4 years. His shop is located in a very convenient spot in the town center: as the area is attended by many people, the shop has many customers, and he gets up early every day to open his shop. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy shoes at wholesale price to improve his sales and increase his earning in order to offer a better standard of living to his family.

loans.use: To buy shoes for his shop.

loans.name: Maira Quintina

texts.es:
La señora Maira tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de los Colorados, ahi vive con sus hijos y su esposo, Maira es una mujer emprendedora y que se dedica a la venta de frutas, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, estaciona su carro y ahi llegan sus clientes para comprarle sus deliciosas frutas. Maira es muy responsable, honrada y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, junto con su esposo trabajan muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de sandias, papayas, manzanas y naranjas.
texts.en:
Maira is 32 years old and she lives in the Los Colorados community with her husband and children. Maira is a very resourceful woman who engages in selling fruits, an activity she has been engaged in for many years. She parks her truck along the ring-road that leads to San Marcos de Colon and her customers go there to buy her delicious fruits. Maira is very responsible and honest and she has a great desire to grow, and she and her husband work very hard to provide for their children.

She will use this loan to buy watermelon, papayas, apples and oranges.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Solanda Maricela

texts.es:
Solanda Maricela tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Solanda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 5 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y comprar abonos agrícolas. Con la ayuda del crédito se le hará más fácil al adquirir los insumos.

El sueño es poder tener casa propia. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta visitar a la mamá.
texts.en:
Solanda Maricela, 32, lives in a common law relationship and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 15 and 11 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “Las Palmas” communal bank located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.

Solanda has been growing corn and rice for five years.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Ventanas.  

She is asking for the loan to plant corn and to buy manure.  With help from the loan it will be easier to acquire the supplies.  Her dream is to own a house.  She’s had no type of problem and in her free time she likes to visit her mother.

loans.use: to plant corn and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Flavio Milton

texts.es:
Flavio Milton tiene 38 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos. Vive con la esposa Y con los hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad en el cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Flavio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz arroz hace 20 años. Las compras y las 
Ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la siembra de maíz y comprar los abonos y fertilizantes.

Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudara ha comprar los insumos sin ningún tipo de problema.

No se le ha presentado ningún problema en la agricultura.En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Flavio Milton is 38 years old, in a common law relationship and has two children.  He lives with his wife and children who are 15 and 11 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Las Palmas” communal bank are located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.  Flavio is a farmer who has been growing rice and corn for 20 years.  His purchases and his sales take place in Ventanas.

He is asking for the loan to continue working his corn and rice crops and to buy fertilizer.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy supplies problem-free.  His dream is to be able to buy a tractor.  He has had no type of problem with the farming and in his free time he likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, a 27-year-old resident of the town of Kinubi, located in the Luweero region of Uganda, is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past eight years, he has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells electronic items.
