To help expand his business, Wilson has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy electrical items for resale, and will help Wilson to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in the future he will be able to build a good house for his family.

Wilson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy electronic goods for resale.

loans.name: Floricelda Lorena

texts.es:
Floricelda Lorena tiene 35 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Floricelda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz hace 10 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y comprar abonos agrícolas.

Con la ayuda del crédito  podrá invertir en la agricultura y tener un beneficio económico.

El sueño es poder tener una casa.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir de visita donde los familiares.
texts.en:
Floricelda Lorena is 35 year old and lives in a common law marriage with two children. She lives with her husband and children, who are 15 and 8 years old, in Canton Ventanas in the Los Ríos Province. 

She is a member of the “Las Palmas” [The Palms] community bank, which is located in the Campo Alegre region of Canton Baba. They make a living doing agricultural work. 

Floricelda has worked in agriculture planting corn for ten years. She buys and sells in Ventanas. She is asking for the loan to plant corn and buy agricultural bonds. 

With the help of the loan, she will put money towards agriculture and have an economic benefit. 

Her dream is to be able to have a house.
She has not had any problems. In her free time she likes to go visit her relatives.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy agricultural bonds.

loans.name: Oswaldo Mauricio

texts.es:
Oswaldo Mauricio tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, hace 15 años . las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Vicente. Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y comprar abonos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá tener beneficios económicos.

El sueño es poder tener una casa.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear.
texts.en:
Oswaldo Mauricio is 32 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and has two children, ages 15 and 8. He lives with his wife and their children in Cantón Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios.

He is a member of the communal bank Las Palmas, which is located in the Campo Alegre district, which is in Cantón Bab. This communal bank is dedicated to agricultural work.

Oswaldo works in agriculture. He has been planting corn and rice for 15 years. He buys and sells in San Vincente. He is applying for the loan to plant corn and buy compost.

With the help of the loan, he will realize economic benefits.

His dream is to be able to have a house.

He has not been faced with any particular problems. In his free time he likes to go for walks.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy compost

loans.name: Javier Isaias

texts.es: Javier  de 42 años es un hombre casado tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 15 y 18 años y vive en la población de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, tierra de artesanías, mochilas y hamacas en tejido vertical, que producen las mujeres y han transmitido de generación en generación. Allí tiene un negocio a través del cual ofrece servicios de hospedaje, aprovechando la oportunidad del estacionamiento que hacen los conductores de cargas pesadas, para descansar y continuar su camino por las carreteras de Colombia. En este municipio donde hay muy pocos hospedajes  y muchas veces los transportadores,  deben quedarse en los parqueaderos donde están estacionados, Javier cuenta con un familiar muy especial que es el mayor promotor de este negocio, pues como cuida los camiones en un estacionamiento, recomienda los servicios de este hospedaje. Su necesidad de financiamiento está basada en que son pocos muy pocos los hospedajes que hay en el pueblo y esto  genera que   permanezcan colmados y con el cupo completo y los potenciales huéspedes pasen mucho trabajo al llegar al municipio. Esta es la razón por la cual Javier acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual  acondicionará habitaciones para aumentar el servicio, adecuará cuartos de baño, pintará y  embaldosará estas habitaciones. Su inversión es exitosa porque la hace con base en una necesidad de su creciente clientela, en la temporada de fin de año, época en la cual se incrementan el paso de los conductores de carga pesada, por San Jacinto,  así como también los turistas visitantes y Javier no se quiere quedar atrás con el desarrollo turístico de su región..
texts.en:
Javier, 42, is a married man with two children, 15 and 18. He lives in the town of San Jacinto in the department of Bolívar, a land of traditional vertical-woven  handicrafts, shoulder bags, and hammocks made by the women, who have passed the trade down from generation to generation. Javier has an inn where travelers with heavy loads can avail themselves of the opportunity to rest before continuing along Colombia's roadways. In this town, where there are very few inns and truckers often need to stay where their vehicles are parked, Javier has a very special relative who is the primary promoter of Javier's line of business; he looks after the trucks in the lots, and recommends people to the inn. 

Javier needs financing because there are so few inns in town that they're always full, so it's a big problem when potential guests come to town. He's seeking a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so he can air-condition the rooms for better service, and paint and tile the bathrooms to bring them up to snuff. The investment will be a success because he's doing it in response to his clientele's growing need during the end of the year, when more heavy-load truckers are passing through San Jacinto.  The are also tourists and Javier doesn't want to miss out on the developing tourism industry in his region.

loans.use: to air-condition rooms for better service, and to paint and tile the bathrooms to bring them up to par.

loans.name: Gloria Beatriz

texts.es:
Gloria Beatriz tiene 26 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con la mamá y con  los hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.
Gloria se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 8 años. Las compras y las Ventas lo realiza en Ventanas y en Pueblo viejo. Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la siembra de maíz y compra de abonos agrícolas.
Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a comprar semillas. El sueño es poder tener una casa.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Gloria Beatriz is 26 years old, she is single and she has two children. She lives with her mom and children, who are 7 and 5 years old, in the Canón Ventanas province of Los Ríos.

She is a member of the communal bank Las Palmas, located in the the Campo Alegre area which is part of Cantón Baba. They carry out agricultural work.

Gloria has been working in agriculture and sowing corn for the past 8 years. She carries out the purchases and sales in Ventanas and in Pueblo Viejo. She is requesting the loan for sowing corn and to buy agricultural fertilizers. The loan will help her to buy seeds. Her dream is to have a house.

She hasn't encountered any problems. In her free time she likes working.

loans.use: to sow corn and to buy agricultural fertilizers.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: El señor Pascual tiene 50 años de edad, vive en la aldea de Monjaras, ahi vive con su hija de 16 años, Pascual se dedica a la venta de mariscos, es muy trabajador y dedicado en toda su plenitud a su negocio propio, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, tiene una gran cantidad de clientes, la calidad de sus mariscos es muy buena  y hace que tenga mucha demanda, cada dia que pasa trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante su negocio y de esta forma darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija que es lo que mas quiere en este mundo.
texts.en: Pascual is 50 years old and he lives in the village of Monjaras with his 16-year-old daughter. Pascual engages in selling seafood, he is very hardworking and totally committed to his shop. He has been engages in his activity for 7 years, he has many customers and as the quality of his seafood is very good he receives many requests. As days goes by he works harder and harder to make his activity grow in order to offer a better standard of living to his daughter, as she is what he most loves in this world.

loans.use: To buy shrimps and fish.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en:
Friday, a 44-year-old resident of the town of Kinubi, located in the Luweero region of Uganda, is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 20 years, she has been working hard to manage her mini supermaket, which sells various food items and home supplies.

To help expand her business, Friday has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap for resale, and will help Friday to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. She hopes to further expand her business in the future.

Friday is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Friday who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Mateo

texts.es:
Jorge Mateo tiene 25 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 8 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realizan en Pueblo Viejo. Solicita el crédito para seguir trabajando en la siembra y comprar abonos agrícolas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar semillas, el sueño es poder tener un terreno.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jorge Mateo is 25 years old and he has a partner and two children. He lives with his wife and children, aged 4 and 2, in the Cantón Ventanas province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the communal bank Las Palmas, located in the Campo Alegre area which is part of Cantón Baba. They carry out agricultural work.

Jorge has been working in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for the past 8 years. The purchases and sales are carried out in Pueblo Viejo. He is requesting the loan to continue sowing and to buy agricultural fertilizers. The loan will help him to buy seeds. His dream is to have a plot of land.

He hasn't encountered any problems. In his free time he likes playing sport.

loans.use: to continue sowing and to buy agricultural fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosa Carlota

texts.es:
Rosa Carlota tiene 45 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos de 19, 17 y 12 años de edad en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 12 años. Las compras y las ventas los realiza en ventanas. Solicita el crédito para seguir trabajando, comprar abonos agrícolas.

 Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá pagar a los trabajadores. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas. 
En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Rosa Carlota, 45, is a single mother.  She lives with her three children--19-, 17-, and 12-years old, respectively--in Ventana, a canton of the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.  

Rosa Carlota is a member of the Las Palmas community bank in the rural town of Campo Alegre.

Rosa Carlota has been a farmer for 12 years.  She grows maize and rice.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy manure to fertilize her land.

Your loan will help Rosa Carlota to pay her workers.  She's never had problems of this kind before.  She likes to work, even in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Saul Humberto

texts.es:
Saúl Humberto tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Saúl se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 20 años.

Las compras y las ventas los realiza en ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar insumos.

El sueño es poder tener un terreno. No se le presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta dormir.
texts.en:
Saul Humberto, 32, lives with his partner and their two children--11- and 5-years old, respectively--in Ventana, a canton of the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios. 

Saul Humberto is a member of the Las Palmas community bank in the rural town of Campo Alegre.
 
Saul Humberto has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He buys and sells whatever he needs in Ventanas.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other supplies for his farming business.
 
Your loan will help Saul Humberto pay for the supplies he needs. His dream is to buy land.  He's never had problems of this kind before. In his spare time, he likes to sleep.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La señora Petronila tiene 63 años de edad,  vive en la aldea de Monjaras, ahi vive con su esposo y su hijo,  Petronila es una mujer muy responsable, honrarda y dedicada a su negocio propio, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo tipo de productos relacionado con la canasta basica, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, cada dia trabaja muy fuerte para poder hacer crecer su negocio y tener una calidad de vida mejor.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, granos basicos, lacteos y embutidos.
texts.en:
Petronila is 63 years old and she lives in the village of Monjaras with her husband and their child. Petronila is a very responsible and honest woman deeply committed to the activity she runs. She has set a corner shop in her house where she sell basic necessities. She has been engaged in this activity for 8 years, and she works hard every day to make her activity grow and to reach a better standard of living.

With the loan she will buy groceries, basic grains, dairy products and bread.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, eggs, bread, drinks and dairy products for her corner shop.

loans.name: Eryab

texts.en:
Eryab, a 41-year-old resident of the town of Kinubi, located in the Luweero region of Uganda, has four children, three of whom currently attend school. For the past four years, he has been working hard to manage his small bar, which sells beers, wines, spirits and soft drinks.

To help expand his business, Eryab has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda and beers for resale, and will help him to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Eryab hopes that in the future he will be able to further expand his business.

Eryab is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eryab who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda and beer for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Esneider De Jesús

texts.es:
Con 19 años de edad y cinco años de experiencia en el trabajo de agricultor, Esneider sueña con tener su propia extensión de tierra para poder cultivar y sacar grandes producciones de legumbres, frutas y hortalizas que aumenten sus ingresos y pueda tener capital para seguir en esta actividad que ayudará a salir adelante a toda su familia. 

Con el crédito conseguido quiere comprar insumos para poder sacar una producción que le ayude a conseguir dinero y así empezar el año 2012 con un capital que le permita continuar con sus estudios y con su trabajo de agricultor en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
At 19, and with five years of farming experience, Esneider dreams about having his own piece of land to cultivate, and of harvesting large crops of legumes, fruits and vegetables. This will enable him to increase his income, and have the necessary working capital to continue farming, and help his whole family get ahead in life.  

With the loan, he wants to buy supplies, so that can get a level of production that will enable him to make money. This way he will start 2012 with working capital, so that he will be better able to continue his studies and his farming.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and materials.

loans.name: Las Cazuelitas Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes del grupo son las señoras Leovigilda, Fresvinda, Maximina y Esperanza van a comprar con su prestamo materiales para elaborar alfareria van a comprar barro, greta por bulto y leña, la señora Esther va a comprar ropa de dama, caballero y niños, las otras integrantes siguen en su actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Esther tiene 43 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo no trabaja, ellos tienen 1 hijo varón pequeño esta en preescolar, ella vende ropa de dama, caballero y niños, ella solicito su préstamo para surtirse de ropa va a comprar faldas, blusas, vestidos de niña y ropa interior,  pantalones de dama, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años por necesidad, ella vende en los tianguis de los pueblos, su negocio es importante porque de ahí gana para comer, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio de convivir con sus clientes y atenderlos amablemente, las ganancias de negocio las utiliza para volver a invertir, ella quiere ampliar su negocio comprar mas mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio, ella lo piensa lograr con el crédito y con las ganancias, sus sueños y esperanzas son ampliar su negocio, tener salud para trabajar y mejorar la calidad de vida para sus hijos. Las integrantes del grupo le quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos sus préstamos, gracias a su apoyo salimos adelante en los negocios y en las familias".
texts.en:
The new members of the group are Leovigilda, Fresvinda, Maximina and Esperanza. They are going to use their loan to buy materials for making pottery, such as clay, packages of glaze, and firewood.   

Esther is going to buy ladies', men's and children's clothing. The other members are continuing with the existing business activities.

Esther is 43, married, and has a little son who is in pre-school. Her husband isn't employed. She sells ladies', men's and children's clothing. She applied for her loan in order to stock up on clothing, such as skirts, blouses, children's dresses, underwear, and ladies' pants.

She started her business three years ago through necessity. She sells in local markets. Her business is important because that's how she earns her livelihood. She feels proud to have her own business, to live near her customers, and serve them with friendliness. 

She is re-investing her earnings in her business. She wants to expand it to buy more merchandise, in order to have a well-stocked store. She intends to achieve this with the loan and her earnings. 

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business, to have the health to be able to work, and to improve her children's quality of life. 

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, "We appreciate the loans, because thanks to your support, our businesses and our families are moving forward."

loans.use: To buy ladies' underwear, skirts, blouses, children's dresses, and ladies' pants.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Familia Hernandez Group

texts.es:
Familia Hernández el grupo se llama así ya que el nombre se lo eligió doña Guadalupe porque en el solo participan familiares Hernandez su esposo Hilario y su Nuera Irma, es la primera vez que están en el crédito.
Sin embargo ellos se dedican  al comercio doña Guadalupe quien es representante del grupo tiene 60 años de edad vive en unión libre con el señor Hilario desde hace 33 años don Hilario trabaja en el campo, 
Los tres invertirán en sus negocios la tienda de abarrotes, y la papelería, son negocios familiares, la tienda la atiende Irma el negocio lo inicio sus esposo pero ella es quien ha quedado a cargo, lleva poco escasamente tres meses, y la tienda lleva ya 30 años esa la atiende doña Guadalupe, y don Hilario.
Esta vez doña Guadalupe ha adquirido el crédito para comprar todo lo que le hace falta en el negocio como detergente, leche, pan , huevo, productos enlatados, harinas, refrescos, arroz, semillas, mientras que Irma invertirá en la papelería, comprado mochilas, y cuadernos que es lo que mas le urge por el momento.
El desafío que presenta doña Guadalupe es que tiene mucha competencia abren muchas tiendas cercanas a la de ella por eso sus  ventas han bajado considerablemente ya que anteriormente obtenía el doble o triple de ganancias que las que ahora saca.
Sin embargo una de sus metas es volver atener la tienda bien surtida, ya que muchas veces las tiendas cierran muy rápido pero ella siempre le ha gustado tener su tienda, también quisiera ampliarla un poco mas.
Ellos están muy agradecidos con el préstamo que les hace doña Guadalupe comenta “Estoy muy contenta por la oportunidad que me han brindado, ya que sin su ayuda yo no podría haber levantado nunca el negocio, porque no tenia dinero para comprar lo que a mi tienda le hace falta, para nosotros es mucho mas difícil conseguir dinero ya que mi esposos gana muy poco y las ganancias de la tienda son para irla pasado”
texts.en:
Familia Hernández: the group has this name because it was chosen by Guadalupe because only members of the Hernandez family participate, such as her husband Hilario and her daughter in law Irma. This is the first time they are on the loan.  

They work as merchants. Guadalupe is the group's representative. She is 60 year old and has been in a common law marriage with Hilario for 33 years. Hilario works in the fields.  
 
The three will invest in their businesses, a grocery store and paper store. These are family businesses. Irma attends to the store. Her husband started the business but she is the one who is in charge of it. She has been doing this for three months, but the business is already 30 years old. Guadalupe and Hilario run it.

This time, Guadalupe has taken out the loan to buy everything she needs for the business, such as detergent, milk, bread, eggs, canned goods, drinks, rice, and seeds. Irma will invest in her paper store such as backpacks and notebooks, which is what is most needed at this time.  

Guadalupe's challenge is that there is a lot of competition. A lot of stores have been opened nearby and because of that her sales have gone down considerably, since before she made double or triple what she makes now. Nonetheless, one of her goals is to have a well stocked store again, since a lot of store close quickly, but she has always liked having her store. She would also like to enlarge it a little.  

They are very grateful for the loan. Guadalupe remarks: “I am very happy with the opportunity that has been given me, since without your help I would never have been able to lift the business up, because I didn't have the money to buy what my store needed. For us it has been very difficult to get money, since my husband makes very little, and the earnings from the store are to make more.”

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, eggs, drinks, and canned goods.

loans.name: Jade Group

texts.es: Los integrantes del grupo siguen en su actividad que vienen desarrollando. El señor Virgilio tiene 53 años de edad, el es soltero, no tiene hijos, el tiene una panadería, el solicito su préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, charolas, canastos, el ofrece a sus clientes pan de dulce y bolillos, el inicio su negocio hace 20 años es herencia de su papa ya no quiso seguir con el negocio y se la dejo, el tiene personal para vender el pan salen en las mañanas 5 muchachos en su triciclo a vender el pan por las calles del pueblo, su negocio es importante por las utilidades que obtiene, el está orgulloso de tener su propio negocio y seguir con la tradición de su papa, su negocio es popular por el sabor del pan de que es horneado con leña, los desafios que enfrenta su negocio son los costos en el aumento del precio de la harina y el azucar. Sus sueños y esperanzas son ampliar su panadería quiere compra una camioneta para salir a vender el pan a las comunidades cercanas. El está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar los materiales para surtir su panadería. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad “gracias por su confianza, les agradecemos sus préstamos, por contar con estos apoyos que nos favorecen a crecer los negocio”.
texts.en:
The members of this group are still working and developing their same activities.  

Señor Virgilio is 53 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  He has a bakery.  He is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, pans and baskets.  He makes sweet bread and rolls for his clients.  His father left him this business 20 years ago when he didn't want to continue in the business.  He has 5 young men that work as employees and sell the bread for him.  They leave in the mornings on tricycles and sell in the streets of their town.  His business is important because of the income it brings in.  He is proud to have his own business and continue his father's tradition.  His business is popular because of the flavor of his wood-fired bread.  The rising price of flour and sugar are a challenge for his business.  

His hopes and dreams are to expand his bakery.  He wants to buy a truck so that he can sell his bread in the nearby communities.  He is happy about the loan that he is going to receive.  He is going to buy materials to stock his bakery.  

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for your trust.  We are grateful for the loans and the support that has helped our businesses to grow."

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, pans and baskets.

loans.name: Beberlyn Cecibel

texts.es:
Beberlyn de 24 años, empezó con un negocio pequeño vendiendo colas, aguas y jugos y con la ayuda de Dios pudo implementar mas su negocio y ahora vende también productos de primera necesidad.

Su madre le ayuda en el negocio ya que ella trabaja fuera de casa. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ninguna dificultad. No está casada y no tiene hijos.

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar mercadería y viveres para la venta como papel, jabón, vegetales, verduras etc. Su meta es agrandar más su negocio y así producir más ingresos para así salir de su trabajo actual ya que es muy duro.
texts.en:
24-year-old Beberlyn started out with a small business selling soda, water, and juice, and with God's help she was able to further her business and now also sells essential items. 

Her mother helps her with the business since she already works outside the house. Thanks to God she has not had any difficulties. She is not married and does not have children. 

She has many aspirations for her business and because of this wants to buy merchandise and supplies to sell, like paper, soap, vegetables, greens, etc. Her goal is to expand her business even more and through this make more income so that she can leave her current job, which is very hard.

loans.use: to buy paper, soap, vegetables, and greens.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past twelve years, Ronald has been working hard to manage his small boutique, which sells various kinds of clothes. 

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Ronald to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Ronald hopes that in the future he will be able to build a good house for his family. 

Ronald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Mery sigue trabajando en la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos, chalinas, guantes, gorros, mantillas, mantas grandes, ponchos, chalecos y adorno en cerámica.

Mery con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio.

Mery solicita el préstamo para invertir en la comprar mantas, estandartes, ropa para santos, chullos y entre otros. 
	
Mery se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mery continues participating in the communal bank Choquequirao in the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

Mery is still working selling handicrafts such as weavings, scarves, gloves, hats, shawls, large blankets, ponchos, vests, and ceramic ornaments.

Mery, with the last loan, did very well and she was able to make a good profit and this is the reason she wants another loan as it helps her very much in the business.

Mery is asking for a loan to buy blankets, decorative banners, holiday clothing, woolen caps, and other items.

Mery is grateful for the opportunity this loan gives her and at the same time she promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy basic materials for her business

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Twaha has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare motor parts in the local market. 

To help expand his business, Twaha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts, and will help Twaha to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Twaha hopes that in the future he will be able to invest in his other agriculture business. 

Twaha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Twaha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare motor parts for resale.

loans.name: Erika Jasmin

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer joven de 19 años, madre soltera de una niña de tres años. Viven en el sector de "El Platanito" en Santo Domingo de los Colorados. 

Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del país, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Erika tiene un pequeño taller de costura en el que hace carteras y bolsos de tela para mujer. Esto lo aprendió de su madre desde hace algunos años y hoy en día ambas son socias. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y para ello acudió a Fundación Alternativa, en busca de un crédito para poder comprar tela y una máquina de coser. De esta manera ella y su madre podrán producir más carteras y así estar un poquito más cerca de su sueño que es tener una gran fábrica.
texts.en:
Erika is a young 19 year old woman. She is a single mother of a three year old girl. They live in the "El Platanito" sector in Santo Domingo de los Colorados. 

Santo Domingo de los Colorados is one of the youngest cities in the country. It is on the border between the sierra and coastal regions. It is a privileged place, not just for its ethnic heritage, but for the scenery to be found at the very entrance of this beautiful city. At present, Santo Domingo de los Colorados belongs to the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was recently formed. The main festival in Santo Domingo is celebrated with intense tourist movement and commercial and cultural exchange. There is a large fair in the facilities of the Rancher's Association. There the best examples of the different races and breeds of the region's cattle are shown. 

Erika has a small sewing workshop where she makes purses and fabric bags for women. She learned this from her mother some years ago and today both of them are members. Her dream is to grow her business and for that she went to the Fundación Alternativa, looking for a loan to be able to buy fabric and a sewing machine. In this way she and her mother will be able to produce more purses and get a little closer to their dream of having a great factory.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Flores De Pascua Group

texts.es:
Candelaria cuenta con 35 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando Nancy está cursando 1º de secundaria, yuliana está cursando 2º de primaria y ivett esta en 5º de primaria y la mas chica cuenta con 3 años de edad, su esposo se llama Héctor él es empleado.

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene una cocina económica ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza en su cocina como son: aceite, verduras, carne, etc. ella espera sacar adelante su negocio dice que próximamente lo convertirá en una pizzería porque y les venderá con los jóvenes de la escuelas.

Candelaria pertenece al grupo flores de pascua el cual está integrado por 10 miembros todos son mujeres trabajadoras las cueles se encuentran trabajando su dinero en actividades comerciales a continuación serán mencionadas: Hilda, Fabiola Epifanía, Reyna, Roberta, María Félix, Romalda, Elia e Isidra todas cuentan con una actividad comercial como son comida, venta de ropa, frutas, verduras, dulces, productos de abarrotes, huaraches, etc.
El negocio donde aparecen las integrantes del grupo en la foto es de hilda dicha representante del grupo.
texts.en:
Candelaria, 35, is married and has four children.  Nancy is in her first year of high school, Yuliana and Ivett are in elementary school, and the youngest is only three.  Her husband Hector is working.

She has a small cafe.  She will invest her loan in buying ingredients that she uses in her kitchen, such as oil, vegetables, meat, and so on.  In the future, she hopes to convert her restaurant into a pizzeria because then she can sell to the school children.

Candelaria is a member of the Flores de Pascua ("Easter Flowers") group, which has ten members, all of them working women.  The others are:  Hilda, Fabiola Epifanía, Reyna, Roberta, María Félix, Romalda, Elia and Isidra. All of them carry out some kind of commercial activity, such as preparing food or selling clothing, fruit, vegetables, sweets, groceries, and huaraches (a fried cornmeal cake).  The business in the photo is that of Hilda, who is the group's representative.

loans.use: to buy such products as oil, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Siempre Viva Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Siempre Viva” esta conformado por 10 integrantes de los cuales dos son hambre y las restantes son 8 mujeres todos los integrantes del grupo son responsables y muy trabajadores, El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque se consideran personas muy trabajadoras en sus respectivas actividades que realizan cada uno de ellos, “Somos personas que nos sentimos vivas, muy agiles y con muchas de salir de adelante.
Doña Angelina que es la representante del grupo tiene 27 años de edad esta casada con el señor José desde hace 10 años juntos han procreado tres hijos José Manuel de 10 años quien cursa el quinto año de primaria, Ángel Eduardo, de 9años de primaria esta en cuarto grado y Gabriel de 3 años quien aun no estudia. 
La señora Angelina tiene una tienda de abarrotes quien el cual tiene por nombre “miscelánea Dieguito” en ella ha trabajado desde hace 9 años solo que en negocio lo inicio en la ciudad ahora lleva tres años con ella en la comunidad, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para invertir en su tienda compra lo que mas le hace falta como productos enlatados, azúcar, leche, huevo, pan, lo que mas le hace falta son alimentos, lo que mas consume la gente.
Cometa que su único problema es que tienen demasiada competencia por todos lados y por lo mismo sus ventas no pueden aumentar, sin embargo esta segura que con el crédito le ayudara a tener un mejor precio para ofrecérselos a sus clientes ya que las personas buscan el mejor precio con la mejor calidad, así si ella da los precios mas bajos su clientela aumentara.
Una de sus metas es que su tienda de abarrotes este bien surtida y por su puesto beneficiar a toda la comunidad con los precios bajos.
Así como doña Angelina invertirá en la tienda de abarrotes los integrantes invertirán en otras actividades, Carlos en un ciber café, Guadalupe en Herbalife (tés), María, Estephani, Edith y Horalia invertirán en animales como borregos, pollos, cerdos  y guajolotes, Rosa María en una tienda chica, Rubén en cocina, Catalina en ropa. “Todos estamos muy contentos y agradecidos por el préstamo que nos han otorgado ya que nos ayudara a mejorar nuestra calidad de vida y también para nuestras familias”
texts.en:
Thte “Siempre Viva” [Always Live] group is made up of 10 members, two of whom are men and 8 of whom are women. All the group members are responsible and very hardworking. They chose the name of the group because they consider themselves to be very hardworking in their different activities. "We are people who feel alive, very agile, and who really want to get ahead."  

Angelina, who is the group representative, is 27 years old and has been married to Jose for 10 years. They have three children, José Manuel, 10, who is in fifth grade, Ángel Eduardo, 9, who is in fourth grade, and Gabriel, 3, who isn't in school yet. 

Angelina ha a grocery store named “Miscelánea Dieguito”. She has worked there for 9 years. She started it in the city and and has had it in the community now for three years. She is asking for the loan this time to invest in her store and buy what she needs the most, such as canned goods, sugar, milk, eggs, bread. What she needs the most is food, what people consume the most.   

She remarks that her only problem is that she has too much competition everywhere and because of this her sales can't go up. Nonetheless, she is sure that the loan will help her to have better prices to offer her customers since people always look for the best price with the best quality. So if she gives her customers lower prices her clientele will grow. 

One of her goals is to have her grocery store well stocked and off course benefit the whole community with the low prices. 
Angelina will invest in the grocery store and the other members will invest in other activities. Carlos in an internet cafe, Guadalupe in Herbalife (teas), María, Estephani, Edith and Horalia will invest in animals such as sheep, chickens, pigs and turkeys. Rosa Maria will invest in in a small store, Rubin in a stove, Catalina in clothes. “We are all very happy and grateful for the loan they have given us, since it will help us to improve our quality of life and also that of our families."

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, sugar, eggs and canned goods.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La sra. Teresa tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la aldea de Palo Herrado, ahi vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo, juntos trabajan duro para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Teresa es muy trabajadora y se dedica a la venta de desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas, actividad que realza desde hace 3 años, Teresa es responsable, honrada y trabaja fuerte cada dia para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de alimentos para preparar sus deliciosas comidas.
texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old, she lives in the Palo Herrado village with her two children and her husband, and both work hard to pay for their household expenses. Teresa is very hardworking and she engages in selling breakfast and lunch meals and sweets, an activity she has been engaged in for 3 years. Teresa is responsible and honest and she works hard every day to be able to provide her children with a better standard of living.

She will use this loan to buy food to prepare her delicious meals.

loans.use: To buy beef, chicken and pig meat, drinks, oil, eggs, noodles, rice, tortillas, sausages and dairy products.

loans.name: El Cisne Group

texts.es:
El grupo el cisne esta conformado por 9 integrantes dos de ellos hombres y 7 mujeres todos los integrantes pertenecen  a  la misma comunidad, el nombre del grupo lo eligió una persona que ya no esta en le grupo, el grupo lleva mucho tiempo trabajando con la institución algunos integrantes han salido pero también ingresan nuevos, así que el nombre lo eligió don Manuel suponen los integrantes recientes porque el criaba gansos en ese entonces.
Doña Eva quien gracias al crédito se ha beneficiado con los prestamos, ya que anteriormente ella se dedicaba a compra y venta de cerdos y con eso pudo mejorar su vivienda y poner una tienda de abarrotes, esta vez ha esta invirtiendo en su negocio de renta de sillas y mesas para eventos especiales en la comunidad o en otras comunidades vecinas, se las van a pedir rentadas cuando tiene bautizos, primeras comuniones, salidas de escuela y es cuando le va mejor.
Tiene 60 mesas con 108 sillas, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 60 manteles para sus mesas, las mesas las trajo de México y casi cumple un año en el negocio su esperanza es llegar a tener mas sillas para darle un mejor servicios a su clientes ya que era uno de sus desafíos porque no luego no puede a completar el muro de sillas o mesas que le solicitan.
Doña Eva tiene 63 años de edad es viuda ya no tiene quien dependa de ella ahora slo vive cercas de uno de sus hijos y convive con sus nietos, los integrantes del grupo están agradecidos y contentos por el préstamo se han comprometido a no quedar con el préstamo, cada uno de ellos invertirá en actividades diferentes, Amelia en bordados, Alicia en pollos, Elia comprara maíz para sus tortillería, Marco Antonio comprar pollo para su pollería, Luisa invertirá en maíz y alimenta para cerdos, Hermelinda para asbestos, Lucila para alimento de cerdos, Y Manuel comprara borregos.
texts.en:
El Cisne group is made up of 9 members, 2 men and 7 women who are all from the same community.  The group’s name was chosen by one of the members who is no longer part of the group.  They have been working with the institution for a long time although some members have left but also others have joined.   The new members figure that Manuel chose the name because he raised geese in those days.

Eva has benefited from the loans because previously she bought and sold pigs and could thus improve her home and set up a convenience store.  She has also used the money for her events chair and table rentals business for her community and for neighboring villages.  They are rented for baptisms, first communions, and graduations and these are when she does the best.

She has 60 tables and 108 chairs and this time she will use the money to buy 60 tablecloths for the tables.  She brought the tables from Mexico City and she has almost had the business for a year.  Her hope is to have more chairs to give her customers better service since one of the challenges was that she didn’t have enough chairs or tables to supply the numbers that were ordered.
Eva is 63, a widow, and she doesn’t have dependents.  She now lives close to one of her children and sees her grandchildren.  

The members of the group are grateful and happy with the loan and promise to make the repayments.  Each of them has different work: Amelia embroiders, Alicia has chickens.  Elia will buy the corn for her tortilla store, Marco Antonio will buy chickens for his poultry store, Luisa will purchase corn and feed her pigs, Hermelinda will use it for asbestos, Lucila for pig feed, and Manuel will buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery products such as oil, milk, soft drinks, juices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Las Artesanas Del Fresno Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Artesanas del Fresno” esta conformado por solo mujeres que son muy trabajadoras y responsables, el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque casi todas se dedican a las artesanía que son los bordados y tejidos, por eso son artesanas y lo de fresno por su comunidad.
Doña María Juana es una persona mayor de edad conoce muy bien de donde nació el bordado y el tejido de la comunidad, ella tiene 69 años de edad ya es viuda ahora vive sola pero muy cercas de sus hijos y casi pasa todo el día con sus nietos.
Doña María Juana comenta que antes la lana era natural por lo que ahora ya no solo es sintética, antes ellos mismos elaboraban esta producto, primero lavaban la lana del borrego que salía cuando les cortaban la lana, se hacia lino con la lana ya bien lavada y lo obtenían con ayuda de un instrumento de madera, después tejían todos estos hilos de lana hasta obtener una tela y finalmente pintaban la tela los colores mas comunes eran el negro, café y gris. Las cosas han cambiado ahora ya nada de esto se hace porque las telas ya son de muy mala calidad.
Ella bordando lleva ya 30 años desde que sus hijos eran pequeños comenta que esto le ayudo de mucho para darles estudios a sus hijos también ayudaba con los gastos del hogar cuando su esposo se quedaba sin empleo, vendía todos los días lunes en Ixtlahuaca sus bordados,
Ahora ya solo ofrece con sus conocidos de la comunidad esta sola y muchas veces pues no tiene para cubrir sus necesidades básicas como alimentación, calzado y vestimenta por eso se dedica a esto, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar estambres de colores, tela y aujas.
Su desafío es que muchas veces sus trabajo ya no lo valoran como antes y no le quieren pagar lo que realmente es el precio, comenta que es muy pasado ya que se tardan varios días elaborando este trabajo porque todo es echo a mano, ella hace chalecos, morrales, colchas, suéteres con figuras representativas de la comunidad, como pájaros, gretas, estrellas, flores, etc.
Una de las metas de doña Juana es llegar a vender muchos bordados para poder compra maíz, porque si no comprar no tendrá para hacer sus tortillas durante todo el año ya que es uno de sus alimentos primordiales de todos los días.
Todas las integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidas por el préstamo ya que podrá compra todo el material que les hace falta y podrán cumplir con sus pedidos ya atrasados.
Angelina, Leonila, Lucia, Gregoria, Rufina, Rosio,  y María Lucina invertirán en los bordados, mientras que María de los Ángeles y Juana Iríais invertirán en cosméticos.
texts.en:
The group "Artesanas del Fresno" is made up of women who are hardworking and responsible. They chose the group's name because almost all of them are artisans who make crafts like embroidery and knitting - so they called themselves Artesanas [artisans], and Fresno is the name of their community. 

Maria Juana is an older woman who is very familiar with the origins of embroidery and knitting in the community. She is 69, widowed and lives alone but very close to her children and she spends most of the day with her grandchildren. Maria Juana says that the wool used to all be natural, but now it's synthetic. They used to make it themselves, first washing the lambswool then making linen with the well-washed wool. They used a wooden instrument to obtain the wool. Afterwards they knitted all of their wool threads until they had fabric, and finally they dyed the fabric - the most common colors were black, brown and gray. Things have changed now and none of this is done the same way because the fabrics are of very bad quality.

She has been doing embroidery for 30 years, since her children were young. She says that it helped her to put them through school and also with their household costs when her husband was unemployed. She used to sell her embroidery every Monday in Ixtlahuaca, but now she only offers them to people she knows in her community. She is alone and often can't cover the costs of her basic necessities like food, clothing and shoes, which is why she works. This time she has asked for a loan to buy colored wool, fabric and needles. 

Her challenge is that her work is not as valued as it used to be and people don't want to pay a fair price. She says that it's very old-fashioned and it takes many days to finish a piece of work because everything is done by hand. She makes vests, bags, blankets, and sweaters with local figures like parrots, stars, flowers, etc.

One of Juana's goals is to sell more embroidery so she can buy corn, because if she doesn't, she won't have corn to make her tortillas all year, which is one of the foods she eats every day. 

All of the members of the group are very thankful for the loan because they can buy the materials that they lack and meet their back orders. Angelina, Leonila, Lucia, Gregoria, Rufina, Rosio and Maria Lucina will invest in embroidery; Maria de los Angeles and Juana Iriais will invest in cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy fabric for embroidery.

loans.name: Localidad  Del Carrizo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Localidad del Carrizo  está conformado por nueve integrantes indígenas que hablan el idioma mixteco.
Ellas nos comentan que con el nombre de su grupo se identifican con sus creencias y sus tradiciones  ya que todas las integrantes son de la misma comunidad  y todas son personas indígenas y trabajadoras.
Una de  las integrantes del grupo es la señora  Olivia quien se dedica a la venta de trastes de la marca tupeer ware  ya que se va a pueblos vecinos a ofrecer su mercancía.
Tiene con su negocio aproximadamente  cuatro años , ella nos platica que empezó a vender productos de Arabela pero no le dejaba buenas ganancias ya que en su localidad  las personas casi no se maquillan  y en los pueblos vecinos eran poco lo que vendía  así fue   que decidió vender  trastes por catalogo y darlos en tres pagos semanales.
Doña Olí es así  como la llaman sus compañeras de grupo  está felizmente casada con el señor Alfonso de  treinta y cuatro años de edad , don Poncho le ayuda  a su esposo a  vender ya que los fines de semana van a los pueblos vecinos visitar a sus familiares y llevan su mercancía para  ofrecerlas.
Tienen  tres hijos dos mujeres Michel  de doce años de edad, Miriam de nueve años de edad y un  pequeño niño Alfonso Damián de cinco años de edad.
Doña Olí pidió el préstamo para  la compra de más trastes como son: hoyas, toperes, vasos y sartenes.
Está muy contenta  por la oportunidad que le ha dado fundación para seguir con su negocio y hacerlo más grande y por ayudar a todas sus compañeras para  cumplir sus sueños que es crecer  y ayudar a sus familias.

Las otras personas que integran el grupo son:
Feliciana- se dedica a la venta de  pescado.
Floribertha – se dedica a la venta de  comida.
Patricia Juana- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Emma- se dedica  a la venta de  pollos.
Jerónimo  Rolando- se dedica a la venta de  frutas y legumbres.
Jerónimo  Francisco- se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras.
Reina - se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Reyna  Matilde- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Gracias fundación por ayudar a las personas de pueblos con deseos de superación.
texts.en:
This group is called “Localidad del Carrizo” and consists of nine indigenous individuals who speak the Mixtec language. They say that they chose this name for their group because they identify themselves according to their beliefs and traditions. All of them are from the same community and are hard workers who are of indigenous descent.

One of the members of the group is Sra. Olivia, who sells utensils of the Tupperware brand. She travels to neighboring towns in order to offer her merchandise. Olivia has been in business for approximately four years. She says that she started out selling Arabela products (a line of cosmetics and personal care products), but she was not able to generate good profits because the people in her town rarely use makeup. In addition, she sold very little in the neighboring towns so she decided to sell utensils through catalogs. She accepts payments in three weekly installments.

Doña Olí, as she is called by the other members of her group, has been happily married to Sr. Alfonso (Poncho) for 34 years. Don Poncho helps his wife sell on the weekends when they travel to the neighboring towns. Whenever they visit relatives, they bring merchandise to offer to them. They have three children, two daughters and a son. Michel is 12 years old, Miriam is 9 years old, and little Alfonso Damián is 5 years old. Doña Olí is requesting a loan in order to buy utensils such as wash basins, containers, glasses, and frying pans. She is pleased with the opportunity that Fundación Realidad has given her so that she can continue her business and make it larger. Olivia is also grateful that the organization is assisting all of the members so that they can fulfill their dreams of growing and helping their families.

The other members of the group are as follows: • Feliciana sells fish. • Floribertha sells food. • Patricia Juana sells food. • Emma sells chickens. • Jerónimo Rolando sells fruits and legumes. • Jerónimo Francisco sells fruits and vegetables. • Reina sells cheese. • Reyna Matilde sells food.

They thank Fundación Realidad for helping people from small towns who want to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase household utensils.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Teresa sigue trabajando en la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos, chalinas, guantes, gorros, mantillas, mantas grandes, ponchos, chalecos y adorno en cerámica.

Teresa con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio.

Teresa solicita el préstamo para invertir en la comprar mantas, estandartes, ropa para santos, chullos y entre otros. 
	
Teresa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Teresa continues participating in Asociación Arariwa's “Choquequirao” communal bank from the city of Cusco. Teresa continues selling craftwork like textiles, shawls, gloves, hats, baby clothes, large blankets, ponchos, cardigans and ceramic decorations.

The previous loan went very well for her, and she was able to make a good profit. This is why she wants another loan, because it helps her business a lot.

Teresa is asking for the loan to buy blankets, banners, clothing for saints' statues, woolen caps and other items.
	
Teresa is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials for clothes making

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosario es una mujer de 54 años, viuda y vive con sus tres hijos de 17, 15 y 13 años. Los mayores de sus hijos estudian en el colegio y el menor asiste a la escuela. Residen en el cantón Santo Domingo.

Santo Domingo es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda la ciudad entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

Rosario es propietaria de una tienda de víveres en el cantón donde reside. Pasa la mayor parte del tiempo en su negocio ya que su jornada es de 12 horas en promedio. La ayudan sus hijos luego de ir al centro de estudios. Nos comenta que su vida no ha sido fácil luego de la muerte de su esposo ya que ha tenido que asumir sola la crianza de sus hijos. Ella quiere invertir en mercadería y aprovechar la época navideña que nos comenta es muy buena en cuanto a las ventas. 

Ella acudió a Fundación Alternativa en búsqueda de un crédito que le ayude en sus planes. Nos cuenta que su oficial de crédito es muy amable e incluso ha asistido a dos capacitaciones que esta organización ha brindado a sus clientes.

Su sueño como el de toda madre es poder dar a sus hijos una educación de calidad y diariamente se esfuerza por ello.
texts.en: Rosario is a 54-year-old widow and lives with her three children, ages 17, 15 and 13. The eldest two children are in high school and the youngest is also in school. They live in the city of Santo Domingo, in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which is one of the most densely populated in Ecuador. It is a big tourist attraction because it has a number of monuments spread throughout the entire city, including the Monumento al Indio Colorado, a monument for the indigenous population in the area known as "Y del Colorado." Santo Domingo is a privileged place with marvelous, hard-working and enterprising people who tirelessly fight for progress and who welcome tourists with open arms and help them get to know the culture and surroundings. Rosario owns a grocery store in Santo Domingo, and she spends the majority of her time at the business. Her average workday is 12 hours. Her children help her after they get home from school. She tells us that her life has not been easy since her husband died since she has had to raise her children by herself. She wants to invest in merchandise and take advantage of Christmastime, which she says is a very good time for her sales. She is turning to Kiva partner Fundación Alternativa for a loan to help her with her plans. She says that her loan officer is very friendly, and adds that she has taken two training courses the organization has provided its clients. Her dream, like all mothers, is to be able to give her children a quality education, and she strives daily for that.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es: La nueva integrante del grupo es la señora Antonia va a comprar con su prestamo maiz, hojas para tamal, carne, azucar, piña, las otras integrantes siguen con su actividad que vienen desempeñando La señora Graciela tiene 33 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo trabaja en el campo o de albañil, ellos tiene 2 hijos 1 niña y un niño los dos estudian en la primaria, ella vende zapatos y cosméticos por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar zapatos,  cosméticos y va a comprar unas laminas para el techo de la cocina, ella inicio su negocio hace 1 año le enseño una señora a vender los zapatos, ella tenía unos ahorros y los tomo para iniciar a surtir sus pedidos, ella sale a ofreces sus productos por las calles de su comunidad, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para la escuela de sus hijos, a ella le gusta su negocio porque se distrae, camina y hace amistades, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio de poder estar al pendiente de sus hijos  y con las ganancias le puede comprar a sus hijos algún juguete que les guste, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir es una oportunidad de ampliar su negocio va a comprar zapatos de dama, caballero y niño. Sus sueños y esperanzas son tener su casa bien terminada, techarla y pintarla, que sus hijos sigan estudiando. Los integrantes del grupo les dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por sus préstamos, ayudan a las personas a tener nuevas oportunidades,
texts.en:
The new member of the group is Antonia. With her loan she is going to buy corn, leaves for tamales, meat, sugar, and pineapples. The other members continue with the activities that they have been carrying out. 

Graciela is 33 years old. She is married. Her husband works in the field or as a construction worker. They have 2 children, a son and a daughter, and both of them are in primary school. She sells shoes and cosmetics by catalog. She is asking for a loan in order to buy shoes, cosmetics, and she is going to buy some steel sheets for the kitchen roof. 

She began her business a year ago. A women taught her to sell shoes. She had some savings and she used it to start fulfilling her orders. She goes about through the street of her community offering her goods. 

Her business is important because she has income in order to pay the school fees for her children. She likes the business because she enjoys it, walking and making friends. She is proud of having her own business in order to be able to be keep an eye out for her children and with the earnings she can buy her children some toy that they like. 

She is happy with the money she will receive from the loan as it gives her an opportunity to expand her business. She is going to buy shoes for ladies, men and children. Her dreams and hopes are to have a nicely finished house, roofing and painting, and that her children continue their studies. 

The members of the group give thanks to Kiva and the Fundación Realidad for their loans, helping people to have new opportunities.

loans.use: to buy shoes for ladies, men and children, perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Ramathan

texts.en:
Ramathan is 32 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Ramathan has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells home products like food, cooking oil, and soap. 

To help expand his business, Ramathan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cooking oil and soap for resale, and will help Ramathan to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Ramathan hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Ramathan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ramathan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and soap for resale.

loans.name: Segundo Yinio

texts.es:
Segundo de 44 años, empezó su negocio hace 2 años atrás por falta de trabajo y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien hasta hoy.

Realiza su trabajo con ayuda de un sobrino, juntos recorre las calles de Guayaquil. La dificultad de su trabajo es la delincuencia ya que ha sufrido dos asaltas en el tiempo que lleva trabajando. Si está casado y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 18, 16 y 8 años, los dos últimos hijos estudian en establecimiento fiscal.

Tienes muchas aspiracion con sus ventas por eso quiere comprar al por mayor ventiladores y toldos. Su meta es poder incrementar su negocio para así poder recorrer más las calles de la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos.
texts.en:
Secundo is 44 years old. He began his business 2 years ago because he was unemployed and thanks to God it has been going very well so far.

He does his work with the help of a nephew, together throughout the streets of Guayaquil. 

An obstacle in his work is the crime and he has suffered two hold ups in the time that he has been working. 

He is married and has 4 children who are 22, 18, 16 and 8 years old. The two youngest attend a public school. 

He has many dreams for his sales venture and this is why he wants to buy fans and awnings at a wholesale price. His goal is to be able to expand his business in order to be able to cover more city streets when selling his products.

loans.use: to buy fans and awnings

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Marcelina sigue trabajando en la venta de artesanía como tejidos y ella elabora chalinas, guantes, gorros, mantillas, mantas grandes, ponchos y  chalecos.

Marcelina con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio.

Marcelina solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y otras cosas más. 
	
Marcelina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Marcelina continues to participate in the “Choquequirao” communal bank, which is part of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She makes and sells artisanal materials such as scarves, gloves, hats, mantillas, large blankets, ponchos, and vests.  Her previous loan went very well and she received good benefits. For this reason, she is requesting another loan since it will help her business a great deal.  She is requesting the loan to purchase alpaca wool and other items.  She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and promises to make her payments in accordance with the re-payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool and other materials.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel tiene  cuarenta años de edad es una señora trabajadora, humilde con ganas de salir adelante.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Brigido quien se dedica a la venta de maíz desde hace tres años  esta muy orgulloso de su esposa ya que doña María siempre a demostrado ser una señora trabajadora con las garras  de enfrentarse a la vida.
Ella se dedica  a la venta de comida desde hace cinco años vente lo que es tacos dorados, caldo  de pescado, caldo de pollo, caldo  de res.
Ella nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es cocinar para sus clientes y darles un buen servicio para que se vayan con ganas de volver.
Pidió el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración de comida: chile verde, Chile  seco, cebolla, manteca, carnes, maíz para la elaboración de tortillas y verduras.

Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir  con una de las cosas que mas quiere que es  su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora María Isabel is 40 years old. She is a humble, hard-working woman with the desire to advance. She is happily married to Señor Brigido, who has been working in corn sales for three years. He is very proud of his wife, since Doña Maria has always shown herself to be a hard-working woman with the will to confront life.

Maria has been selling food for five years. She sells hard-shell tacos, fish soup, chicken soup, and beef soup. She tells us that what she likes best about her business is cooking for her customers and giving them good service so that they leave with the desire to come back. She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients to prepare her food: green chiles, dried chiles, onions, lard, meats, corn to prepare tortillas, and vegetables.

She gives thanks to the foundation for the support they have given her to continue with one of the things that she loves most, which is her business.

loans.use: to buy chiles, onions, tomatoes, etc. to prepare food.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is 39 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small bar, which offers buffets, sodas, beer, and spirits. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chairs, tables, and food, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chairs, tables, and food

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
La señora Zenaida  tiene  cuarenta y siete años de edad se caracteriza como una persona  trabajadora y honesta.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa  y colchas  de lunes a viernes  y también  se dedica a la venta de pozole de pollo todos los domingos, le gusta  aprovechar su tiempo y sacarle provecho a las cosas buenas.
Esta  felizmente  casada con el señor Margarito con quien tiene  dos hijos  por quien trabaja día a día  para darles  un mejor futuro. 	
La señora Zenaida aparte de  vender pozole de pollo tambien se dedica a la venta de tamales de pollo  y a la vende pollos vivos y destazados.
Pidió el préstamo  para  comprar más ropa para niño y niña y dama que es a la ropa que le deja  más ganancias.

Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Zenaida is 47 years old and is known as an honest and hardworking person. She sells clothing from Monday to Friday and also sells chicken pozole (a traditional Mexican stew or soup) every Sunday. She enjoys making good use of her time.

She is happily married to Sr. Margarito with whom she has two sons. She works day after day to give her sons a better future. She requested a loan to buy more clothing for boys and girls and women, which are the most profitable items she sells. 

She thanks the Foundation for the support that has enabled her to get ahead and triumph in life.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de progresar, es conviviente con Juanito quien es técnico agropecuario, pero por el momento no tienen hijos, habitan cómodamente su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Gina es la crianza de cerdos, para eso cuenta con un terreno propio de 5 hectáreas de extensión, en donde habilitó un corral para la crianza, iniciándose con 2 dos cerdos que compró con un financiamiento. Desde entonces se dedica al cuidado y alimentación de estos animales, y ahora cuenta con 12 cerdos en tan solo 1 año y esto gracias al apoyo de y asesoramiento de su pareja que le ayuda en todo. Lo que le gusta a Gina es el poder criar animales como los cerdos, se siente animada de poder hacer crecer su negocio y más adelante ser una empresaria de la crianza porcina, pues lo considera bastante rentable por la gran demanda de consumo que tiene la carme de cerdo, por eso está consciente que eso solo lo podrá conseguir a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado dice sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de una producción de yuca de su vecino para emplearlo en la alimentación de los cerdos.
texts.en: Gina is a 23-year-old hard-working woman with a strong desire to make progress. She is married to Juantio, who is an agricultural technician, and at the moment they have no children. They live comfortably in their own home. Gina makes a living raising pigs on a 5-hectare plot of land where she has a breeding pen. She started out with two pigs she purchased with a loan. Since then she has dedicated herself to caring and feeding the animals, and now she has 12 pigs in only one year. This is thanks to the support and advice of her husband, who helps her with everything. What Gina enjoys about her work is being able to raise animals like pigs. She is encouraged by being able to grow her business and in the future wants to be an entrepreneur in swine breeding, since she considers it to be quite lucrative due to the demand for pork, but she knows she will only achieve it with a lot of hard work and dedication. This will be her second loan with the institution, and she is waiting for the credit to fulfill her objectives. She is happy with her community bank and considers her fellow members to be good people. With the amount she is requesting, Gina plans to invest in the purchase of yucca from her neighbor to feed her pigs.

loans.use: to purchase yucca to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Consolate

texts.en:
Consolate is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. For the past ten years, Consolate has been working hard to manage her dairy farm, which sells milk produced by her cows. 

To help expand her business, Consolate has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows to produce milk for resale and will help Consolate generate increased profits and buy food to feed her family. Consolate hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a large cattle ranch. 

Consolate is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Consolate who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cows to produce milk for resale.

loans.name: Carmen Alexandra

texts.es:
Carmen de 34 años, empezó hace 4 años atrás con este negocio ya que el ex esposó se enseño esta actividad y ella ahora se dedica a realizar este trabajo.

Trabaja sola todos los días sin horas fijas de trabaja. Carmen contrata personal cuando tiene bastante producción ya que hace impresiones de logos en fundas plasticas (en la foto aparece sus formatos). Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ninguna dificultad hasta el día de hoy. Es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 7 años que estudian en instituciones particulares.

Tienes muchas aspiracion con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo pinturas y fundas para la elaboracion de la imprenta. Su meta es poder comprar maquinaria moderna para aumentar más la producción y así poder agrandar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen, 34, began her business 4 years ago when her former husband taught her how to do the work, so that now she is able to do it on her own.

She usually works alone every day, without a fixed work schedule, however she does hire personnel when she has a lot of work. She makes impressions of logos on plastic bags (in the photo she displays examples of her designs). With God’s help she has not encountered any problems up to now. Carmen is a single mother with two children, 14 and 7, who are studying in private schools.

She is ambitious about her business and therefore wants to use the loan to purchase paint and bags to make her printings on. One goal is to be able to buy modern machinery so that she can increase production and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags and paint.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. For the past ten years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his drug shop, which sells different types of medicine to his community. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for resale, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and buy food to feed his family. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for resale

loans.name: Cecilia Argentina

texts.es:
La joven Cecilia tiene 26 años de edad,  vive en la comunidad de Palo Herrado,  junto a ella vive su madre  y juntas trabajan duro para salir adelante, Cecilia es muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio, que es prestar el servicio de moler maiz, tiene un molino, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años en su casa de habitacion, este tipo de negocio es bueno ya que aqui vienen a moler el maiz muchas personas para elaborar las deliciosas tortillas que son el alimento que acompaña los tres tiempos de comida de muchas familias.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para su molino y hacerle mantenimiento. 
Cecilia trabaja muy fuerte para hacer crecer su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a young woman aged 26 who lives in the Palo Herrado community together with her mother, and they both work had together to provide for themselves. Cecilia is very hardworking and committed to her activity: she provides corn grinding services with the grinder she owns in her own house. She has been engaged in this activity for 4 years, and this is a good kind of activity since many people come to her house to grind the corn they need to prepare delicious tortillas, food that goes with all the three main meals of many families.
She will use the loan to buy spare parts for her grinder and to pay for its maintenance.
Cecilia works really hard to make her activity grow and to reach a better standard of living.
