In her community, she has her own lands where she cultivates peas, spinach, carrots, and lettuce, etc. Since Juana is not satisfied with this production, she also rents other plots so she can raise more produce. In this way, she markets a wide variety of vegetables, which she sells with satisfaction at the wholesale market. “The vegetables from Tarma are in demand in Lima, and the buyers take them away in bags and baskets,” she says. As her business is profitable, she also buys and sells vegetables and tubers, since she has well-known customers in the capital city who request a variety of products from her. Juana plans to finish building her own home, which is something she has worked hard for and persevered on a daily basis with her business to attain. In the future, she will furnish her home with furniture and appliances that she will purchase little by little. Juana has requested an individual loan from MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma] because she feels the organization has helped her in decisive moments with her business. She is committed to make her payments on time. By receiving this help, this hard-working woman will be able to put a roof on her house. To do so, she will purchase cement and will hire workers to help her with this project.

loans.use: To purchase cement and hire workers.

loans.name: Matilde De Jesus

texts.es: Matilde, es un joven de 24 años, soltero, nacido en la comarca el Coyolito  ubicada en la Concordia municipio de Jinotega, el se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas. Esta actividad la trae por herencia de sus padres ya que sus hermanos mayores al igual que resto de  su familia se dedican a la agricultura, siembran repollo, tomate, chiltoma, cebolla y también se dedican a la crianza de ganado y venta de leche.  El hizo su primera siembra a los 16 años de edad fue de tomates. Ahora  que se independizo de su padre quiere sembrar repollo. Es por ello que realizo el préstamo para compra de insumos, fertilizantes para llevar a termino el cultivo de repollo. Una de sus metas próximas es comprar ganado lechero en la medida de lo posible y continuar con el negocio de las hortalizas para hacer prosperar y crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Matilde, 24 years old and single, was born in Coyolito county in La Concordia, a municipality of Jinotega.  He cultivates vegetables for a living since he inherited the activity from his parents.  His older siblings and the rest of the family are also involved in agriculture and grow cabbage, tomatoes, sweet pepper, and onions.  They also raise cattle and sell milk.  He planted his first crop of tomatoes when he was 16 years old.  Now that he is independent from his father he wants to grow cabbage.  In order to do this he has requested a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for his cabbage crop.  One of his future goals is to buy dairy cattle and continue with his vegetable activity so he can get ahead and grow his business.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers for his cabbage crop.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora tiene 58 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa nueva usada y cosméticos. Ella tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan de manera independiente, a pesar de que ha sido difícil para ella continuar con este medio de vida pues debido a las enfermedades que atraviesa ha logrado mejorar cada día. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos y diversidad de tallas.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora is 58 years old and sells new and used clothing and cosmetics for a living.  She has four adult children who work and live independently.  Despite the fact that it has been difficult for her to continue with this type of work, due to illness, she has been able to improve her situation daily.  The loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, skirt, suits and dresses in different sizes.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, and dresses in different sizes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fudge, cheeses, sodas and sweets for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy crates to store cheese, trays for fudge, sodas and mineral water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an electric grinder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora  Alicia  tiene  sesenta años de  edad se  dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace dos años ellas nos cuenta que  antes de tener su local vendía su ropa de casa en casa.
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos Adelina, Cristina y Diana  quienes la ayudan a atender su local  y acomodar su mercancía por talla para que sea más fácil y  más rápido  encontrarla y atender  a sus clientes.
Doña licha como mas bien la conocen sus amigas de grupo tambien se dedica a la  venta de masa y a moler nixtamal , las personas que van a moler nixtamal le pagan a 5 pesos el kilo.
Doña Alicia es viuda pero gracias a dios y al apoyo de sus hijos  está saliendo adelante  y trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos y nietos.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para ayudar a su familia
texts.en: Alicia is 60 years old and has been selling clothes for two years. She tells us that before she had her sales premises, she used to sell clothes door to door. Alicia has three children: Adelina, Cristina and Diana, who help her to serve her customers and arrange her merchandise by size so that it is easier and quicker to find. Licha, as she is better known by the friends in her group, also sells cornmeal and grinds nixtamal (cooked corn used to make tortillas). The people who come to grind nixtamal pay her 5 pesos a kilo. Alicia is a widow but, thanks to God and the support of her children, she is getting ahead and working to help her children and grandchildren. She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support that they have given her which enables her to help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Galia

texts.es:
Galia de 38 años, es una mujer felizmente casada con Dilmer, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la ciudad de La Merced. Galia es una mujer de negocios. “Con tal de que el trabajo sea honrado, yo hago lo que sea para ganarme la vida”. Esta frase la caracteriza, ya que a pesar de que su esposo cuenta con un empleo seguro y rentable, ella no se queda atrás y también sale a la lucha. Actualmente viene ofreciendo productos lácteos como: quesos de Oxapampa, yogurt natural, manjar, etc., y para adquirir estos productos viaja cada quincena de mes hacia la ciudad de Oxapampa. “Es rentable el negocio de los quesos, por ejemplo yo compro cada kilo a 8 soles y lo vendo a 15 soles”, menciona.
Sus clientes ya la conocen, son en su mayoría amigas y madres del colegio de sus hijos quienes la recomiendan a otros compradores, por eso no le faltan pedidos en todos los meses del año. Así también ya inició con al venta de panteones, adornos y algo de ropa importada, para adquirir  esta mercadería viaja hacia la ciudad de Lima.
Más adelante, Galia espera instalar una tienda para no tener que movilizarse de casa en casa. Con su ayuda, ella podrá acceder a su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar las cuotas en las fechas señaladas. Además dice sentirse emocionada de pertenecer a su banco comunal: “Mujeres al éxito”.
De obtener el dinero del crédito, comprará productos para la campaña navideña como son: panteones, ollas, artículos de cocina, ropa importada, etc.
texts.en:
38-year-old Galia is happily married to Dilmer, with whom she has two children who are 14 and 6 years old.  This family lives in their own home in the town of La Merced.  Galia is a businesswoman.  "As long as the work is honest, I do whatever to earn a living".  This sentence characterizes Galia because, despite the fact that her husband has a secure and profitable job, she doesn't get left behind and also works tenaciously.  Galia currently works selling dairy products such as Oxapampa cheeses, natural yoghurt, curds, etc.  In order to acquire these products, she travels every two weeks to the city of Oxapampa.  "The cheese business is profitable.  For example, I buy every kilo for 8 soles and sell it for 15 soles", she says.

Galia's customers already know her.  They are mainly friends, and mothers of pupils who attend her children's school, who recommend her to other buyers.  For this reason, she always has orders year round.  Galia also started selling panettones, decorations and some imported clothes.  In order to acquire this merchandise, she travels to the city of Lima.  In the future, Galia hopes to set up a store so that she doesn't have to go door to door.  With your help, she will be able to access her first loan from MFP.  She pledges to make her repayments on the assigned dates.  In addition, she says that she feels very happy to belong to her community bank "Mujeres al éxito”.

With her loan money, Galia will buy products for the Christmas season such as panettones, pots, cooking implements, imported clothes, etc.

loans.use: to buy panettones, pots, cooking utensils and imported clothes

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana  se dedica a la venta de  mercancía para abarrotes desde  hace cinco años, ella nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es atender a sus clientes.
Ella nos cuenta que su tienda ayuda a las personas de su localidad por que les da fiado y en la semana le pagan para  que puedan  comer  bien.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Eulogio un señor humilde que la quiere y apoya en lo que Doña Juana  decida y agá.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más mercancía de abarrotes  como es: leche, galletas, sabritas, chiles, cebollas.papas, frutas y productos lácteos.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Juana has been in the grocery store business for 5 years. She tells us that what she likes about her business is to serve her clients.

She tells us that the store helps people in her neighborhood because she extends credit to them so that they can eat well and during the week they pay her back.

She is happily married to Eulogio, a humble man, who loves and supports Juana in whatever she might decide or do.

She is asking for a loan to buy more groceries for her store such as milk, cookies, potatoes chips, chilies, onions, potatoes, fruit and dairy products.

She is thankful to the foundation for the support it has given to help her succeed and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
La señorita Azucena tiene  veinte un años de edad es una  amable, trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de pollos desde hace tres años.
Ella nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es pelar sus pollos, destazarlos y salir a vender, vende de casa en casa y en su domicilio.
Lo que la inspiro a tener su propio negocio es su familia  ya que su mama se dedicaba a la venta de pollo, le  gusta mucho su negocio por que puede manejar su tiempo  en las mañana vende pollos y en la tarde se queda  atendiendo a sus padres.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas pollos para la venta le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Azucena is 21 years old. She is friendly and a hard worker. She has worked selling chickens for 3 years. 

She tells us that what she likes most about her work is skinning the chickens, butchering them, and selling them, going from house to house in her neighborhood.

What inspired her to have her own business was her family. Her mother sold chickens. She likes her business because she can manage her time in the mornings selling chickens and in the afternoon she can attend to her parents.

She is asking for a loan to buy more chickens to sell. She gives thanks to the foundation for the help that it has given her to get ahead and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es: Buenaventura Es una mujer casada que vive en Galapa, en su propia casa, municipio muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y tien 3 hijos en las edades de 43 a 46 años. Ella es propietaria de un expendio de carnes ubicado en esta poblaciòn, donde vende especialmente visceras hueso y costilla y tambien en compañía de su esposo vende carbon vegetal por cargas. Su negocio lo iniciò en el año 1988 y gracias a esta actividad, que ha trabajado con su esposo, pudieron sacar a sus hijos adelante. Su sueño de crecer empresarialmente es inagotable, esta es la razòn por la cual solicita su credikiva para incrementar el surtido de carnes y atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Buenaventura es una mujer muy trabajadora  que simultaneamente labora en el consejo municipal de Galapa, desempeñandose en oficios varios; con las ventas del negocio cubre sus gastos personales y del negocio,  aporta para el pago de los créditos que ha usado para la educación superior de su hija. En su infraestructura tiene dos enfriadores para conservar las carnes. La rentabilidad está acorde al tipo de negocio, y las rotaciones de cartera y de inventarios es corta, como debe ser en un negocio con estas caracteristicas;  Su credikiva es el pirmer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprarà en mayor cantidad productos càrnicos, especialmente para atender la gran demanda que se acerca con motivo de las fiestas de fin de año: Navidad y Año nuevo.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is a married woman who lives in Galapa, in her own house in a town near the city of Barranquilla, with her husband and three children from the ages of 43 to 46 year old.

She is the owner of a small butcher shop located in her town where she sells entrails, bones, and pork chops, and she and her husband also sell bundles of charcoal.

Her business began in 1988 and thanks to this activity, that she has had with her husband, they could raise their children.

Her dream of growing as an entrepreneur is non-ending; this is the reason why she is asking for a loan in order to increase her supplies of meat and fulfill the orders from her clients.

Buenaventura is a very hardworking woman that simultaneously works on the city council of Galapa and carrying out various duties. The profit from her business covers her personal and business expenses, and pays for the higher education of her daughter.

Her butcher shop has 2 coolers to keep the meat fresh. The earning potential is according to this type of business, the turn-over of the meat and supplies is quick, as it should be in this type of business.

This is her first Kiva funded loan which was through the Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy in larger quantities meat products, especially to meet the greater demand as the holidays of the year approaches, both Christmas and the New York.

loans.use: to buy meat products in larger quantities

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora  Sonia es una señora trabajadora, humilde con muchas ganas de trabajar y darle una mejor  vida a su familia.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Juan a quien quiere por el apoyo que le ha dado para  salir adelante.
Ella se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace siete años.
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos  quienes la ayudan a la elaboración de pan  para que doña Sonia  no se canse tanto.
Ella pidió el  préstamo para la compra de harina, mateva, royal.mantequilla, huevos para la elaboraciones  pan.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir trabajando y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking, humble woman, eager to work and to give her family a better life.

She is happily married to Juan who has given her support in order to succeed. She has been selling bread for 7 years. Sonia has 3 children who help her prepare the bread so that she does not wear herself out. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy flour, pastry mats, jelly, butter, and eggs for the preparation of bread. She is thankful to the foundation for the support it has given so she can continue to work and offer a better future to her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to make bread

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida tiene 49 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa y gaseosas. Tiene más de 9 años de experiencia en este medio de vida. Ella es una persona responsable pues disfruta el tener un medio de trabajo. Elida sueña con llegar a tener un local mucho más grande y poder ofrecer una gran variedad de productos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Elida is 49 years old. She sells clothing and soft drinks. She has more than 9 years experience in this way of life. 

She is a responsible person and she enjoys her work. Elida dreams of having a much larger facility and to be able to offer a greater variety of products. 

Her reason for this loan is to buy pants, blouses, skirts, and suits, among other products.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, among other products

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 15 años de edad; él tiene un negocio donde ofrece el servicio de reparación y montaje de equipos de oficina y electrodomésticos, negocio que aprendió desde sus 12 años de edad cundo frecuentaba el taller de su tío quien hacia reparación y mantenimientos de rokolas y posteriormente aprendió este oficio técnicamente en una academia, donde se preparó como técnico electrónico y cuando finalizó sus estudios emprendió su propia aventura, haciendo reparaciones a grabadoras y equipos de sonido, pasando por televisores y cuando aprendió electrónica digital amplió su rango de acción y continuó con el mantenimiento y reparación de computadores y microondas. Simultáneamente trabajado como empleado durante 6 años en una empresa complementó su aprendizaje y experiencia, aunque en la actualidad ofrece estos servicios a esta empresa, pero además ha logrado nuevos clientes empresariales de muchas empresas que aun lo reconocen y le pagan por el mantenimiento cada  8 o 45 días En la actualidad está planeando un mayor crecimiento de su negocio en infraestructura, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará repuestos y materiales, como discos duros, memorias, puentes de alimentación entre otros necesarios para el servicio que ofrece.
texts.en:
Hector is 48 years old, lives in the city of Barranquilla, and has two children, ages 9 and 15. He has a business where he offers repair and assembly services for office equipment and domestic appliances. He learned this trade at 12 years old, when he frequented the workshop of his uncle, who did repair and maintenance on jukeboxes.

Later he learned this job technically in school, where he was trained as an electrical technician. When he finished these studies he began his own venture, doing repairs to recorders and sound equipment, then moving onto television sets. When he learned digital electronics he expanded his level of ability and continued with the maintenance and reparation of computers and microwaves. 

Working at the same time as an employee in a company for six years complimented his training and experience. Although he actually offers these services to the company, he has gained new business clients from many companies who now know him and pay him for maintenance every 8 or 45 days. In reality he is planning a major growth of his company's infrastructure. 

This is the reason why he is turning to the loan organization, his first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the loan he will buy parts and materials, like hard drives, memory, and power sources, among other items necessary for the service he offers.

loans.use: to buy parts and materials, like hard drives, memory, and power sources, among others.

loans.name: Miralys Beatriz

texts.es: Miralis con su anterior credikiva redujo los costos de transporte y de tiempo, comprando al por mayor materias primas e insumos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará insumos, para  financiar  las cuentas por cobrar de los almuerzos, que vende en construcciones de edificios,  quienes son sus principales clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:  “Estoy muy agradecida por el apoyo que brindan a las personas necesitadas, pues este crédito ha logrado estabilizar mi capital, con el cual estoy trabajando mas tranquila.”
texts.en: Miralis used her previous Kiva loan to reduce her transport costs and save time, buying her raw materials and supplies wholesale.  She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy supplies and to fund the credit facilities that she provides to people who buy her lunches.  Her customers are mainly people who work on building sites.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: "I am very grateful for the support that you provide to people in need.  This loan has allowed me to stabilize my capital and I am now working more peacefully".

loans.use: to buy supplies for making lunches

loans.name: Betty Judith

texts.es: Betty comprò productos de belleza y de aseo personal en mayor volumen , con su credikiva ha logrado mejorar su organización administrativa y se han mantenido las ventas por la oferta diversa de productos y el mejoramiento de la atención de sus clientes. Su meta es capacitarse en técnicas de prestación de servicios. Con su futuro credikiva al que esta aplicando, comprará mercancías como productos de estética y aseo personal, además de hacer adecuaciones a su local. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Mil gracias y que Dios se los multiplique, todo lo que están haciendo con nosotros las microempresarios. También un agradecimiento mayúsculo a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, por este apoyo y convencimiento de que las micro y pequeñas empresas, somos una fuerza de economía que crea desarrollo.”
texts.en: Betty used her previous Kiva loan to buy beauty products and personal care products in larger quantities.  She used her loan to improve her business organization and she has maintained her sales thanks to the diverse range of products she offers and the improvements she has made to her customer service.  Her goal is to train herself in service provision.  She will use the Kiva loan that she is applying for now to buy merchandise such as beauty products and personal care products.  She will also make some changes to her premises.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: "A thousand thanks, and may God multiply them, for everything you are doing for us micro business owners.  I would really like to thank Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for their support and for their belief that micro and small business owners are an economic force who create development".

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as beauty products and personal care products, and to make some changes to her premises

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior,  Luz Marina compró mucha mercancía, como calzado, ropa interior y exterior que vendió a un buen precio, porque así mismo los consiguió con descuentos. Su nuevo credikiva lo invertirá en la compra de productos de aseo personal y de belleza tales como colonias, talcos, chancletas y ropa interior. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Mis agradecimientos y entera satisfacción por el apoyo que Kiva brinda a los empresarios. Porque gracias a ellos han mejorado su nivel de vida
texts.en: With her prior loan, Luz Marina bought a lot of merchandise like shoes, clothing and undergarments that she sold for a good price because she got them at a discount. She'll invest her new loan in the purchase of personal hygiene and beauty products like colognes, powders, slippers and undergarments. Her message to Kiva lenders is, "I'm grateful and completely satisfied with the support Kiva provides businesspeople. Thanks to you they've improved their quality of life."

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene and beauty products such as cologne, powders, slippers, and undergarments.

loans.name: Enhtsolmon

texts.en:
Enhtsolmon, 29 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. His wife is employed and his daughter is a kindergarden student.

Enhtsolmon, who started his carpentry business in 2007, now has many customers but can't meet their needs due to a lack of equipment and tools. A sharp and hardworking man, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy tools and equipment.

loans.use: to buy equipment and tools.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, 52 years of age, married and blessed with four children, is a farmer who dedicates himself to his business to improve his family’s living. His loving wife also helps to lessen his burden by working with him to increase their crop yields to save for their future needs.

To achieve their desired yields, Robert is requesting a loan of P25,000 as additional working capital to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor costs involved in planting corn. He hopes for further development of their corn field through these inputs. Hopefully, with patience and hard work, Robert will reap an abundant crop this coming season which will enable him to save for the educational needs of his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor costs involved in planting corn.

loans.name: Furteliana

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year-old Furteliana is a married woman with five children aged between 13 and 27. Furteliana has a tricycle transportation business in Talibon, Bohol. Furteliana is also interested in venturing into other kinds of business. She does her best to take care of her family and improve their living situation.

Furteliana has requested this loan to buy tires and other spare parts. She hopes to save more for her future plans.

loans.use: to buy tires and other spare parts.

loans.name: Jenaime

texts.en:
Jenaime is a 26-year-old married woman with two young children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Jenaime has had a sari-sari store business for 5 years. She sells spices, coffee, canned goods, soap, and other various items. Jenaime earns 6000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month with her business.

Jenaime is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice and canned goods. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business. Jenaime also hopes to save for her childrens' education.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell such as rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is a married woman having two children. She is 24 years old and resides at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Irish owns and operates a swine fattening business, raising pigs for sale to earn a living and she's been one year in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Irish has been been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Irish's revenue will be to saved as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Emma is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Emma is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many more. Emma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,400 PHP a month for these activities.

Emma is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque has been farming rice since he got married to Milagros. He has been involved in this kind of business for 21 years. Roque had no other choice for an employment except rice farming because he only finished his elementary education.

He is now 47 years and has two children. Though his family experience of scarcity in financial matters, he still strives and perseveres to provide his family's needs.

Someday, Roque aims to see all his children earn a degree and be able to seek a good employment, too.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers used in farming.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She sells fish for a living. Lolita buys directly from fishermen in her town. She works hard to help provide for her needs and send her children to school.

Lolita has requested this loan to buy more fish to sell. Lolita hopes her business will grow. Aside from paying her children's school fees, she also plans to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 23 years old and lives in Talibon, Bohol. For the past year, she has run a sari-sari (retail) business where she sells items like canned goods, soap, and shampoo to the people in her community. She earns 3,000 PHP per month. 

Eugenie is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as school supplies and canned goods. She hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 42-year-old farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She has one child who is 17 years old.

She has been engaged in farming for ten years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. 

Evelyn works hard to support herself and her child. She is planning to send her child to college soon.

Evelyn has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Evelyn hopes to own a bigger farm in the future. She also hopes to sustain her child's college education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus's goal in life is to produce abundant crops every harvest season. This will increase his earnings too. Jesus is 49 years old and cultivates two- hectares of rice field. He plants and harvests rice to sell. His daily schedule is going to the field to do farming activities such as sowing, tilling and planting. After 6-8 months of sacrifice in the field, he usually earns P40,000. Harvest season falls during April and November. Last harvest season, profits were used for matriculation fees, meals and electric bills. He lacks funds now, so he is asking for a loan of P35,000 in order to sustain his crop. He will buy pesticides and insecticides used in rice farming.

In the future, Jesus would like to achieve his goal in improving conditions and assuring a brighter future for his children.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides used in rice farming.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is 23 years old and married, with three young children. The oldest child is only six years old.  Darlyn's husband is a fisherman.

Darlyn and her husband run a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol.  They also sell crabs to community residents.  Darlyn says they earn 6000 PHP per month.

Darlyn has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and crab traps.  She hopes that their business will grow. She wants to provide a bright future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and crab traps.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 42 years old and is a married woman with nine children. Her children are between the ages of 4 and 21 years old. Divina has been selling fish for five years. She also sells seashells and dried sea cucumbers. Divina does her best to support her family. She says that she and her husband really work hard to send all their children to school.

Divina has requested a loan to buy more fish, shells and sea cucumbers to sell. She hopes to have a stable business that will help sustain her children's education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fish, shells and sea cucumbers to sell

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a simple yet hardworking woman. Though she entered college, she was forced to drop out due to financial burdens. She then got married. She is married to Marcos, a farmer in their village. They help each other to earn an income. They have been farming rice for 20 years. According to her, they are not yet experts in this kind of business and they want to further improve their farming practices.

Andrea is now asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy farm inputs like urea (fertilizer) and insecticides used in farming. She hopes to make her crop more productive and earn income for the college education of her five children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like urea (fertilizer) and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is 52 years of age and blessed with two children. He is a farmer in their community who has been operating his farming business for ten years.  Because disastrous typhoons occur in their province, his expected crops did not mature. They were easily destroyed because of high location of his corn field. For this reason he’s in need of additional working capital to renew his corn field. He is asking for a loan amount of P25,000 to buy corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers. Hopefully, this time he can yield much so that he can save for the future of his family as well as to his business.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is from Guingona, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Lucina is married and has 12 adult children. 

To make a living, Norma operates a business venture, selling vegetables to local community members. Lucina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Lucina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more vegetables and for the expansion of the business. 

In 2007, Lucina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Deceluna

texts.en: 49-year-old Deceluna earns a living running a sari-sari store business. She is married and has three children. Deceluna sells various items like canned goods, packed noodles and soap. Her daily income from the store helps her to provide for her family's daily needs. Aside from the store, Deceluna also dries sea cucumbers to sell. Deceluna has requested this loan to buy more sea cucumbers and items to sell. She hopes to prosper in all her ventures. She also wants her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more sea cucumbers and items to sell

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is from the village of Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 37 years old. Aurea is married and has six children. 

To make a living, Aurea owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Aurea has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Aurea joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Aurea is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a 48-year-old married woman with 4 children. She sells fish and sea cucumbers for a living. She has been in this kind of business for 10 years. She works hard to earn more and help provide for her family’s household needs.

Natividad has requested a loan to buy more fish and sea cucumbers to sell. She hopes to achieve her dream of succeeding in life.

loans.use: to buy more fish and sea cucumbers to sell

loans.name: Julien Grace

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Julien Grace did not pursue her college because her parents cannot afford to finance her studies. Despite this, she did not lose her hope.She decided to work and help her parents to earn and save for her future. She is now 21 years old and still single. She plans to expand their corn plantation to increase their yields. 

To work out her plan, she is requesting a loan of  PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides and pay labor costs required in planting corn. 

She mentioned that this loan will be a great help for her to work out her plan. She believes that through patience and hard work, she will be successful in carrying out her plan. She hopes that she will be having a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides and pay labor costs required in planting corn.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 60-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living selling viands and delicacies in her community. She earns 6,000 PHP per month with her business. She works hard to support her family and improve her business.

Carmelita has requested a loan to purchase rice and other raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables and oil. She hopes to learn more about managing a business and growing it.

loans.use: to purchase rice and other raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables and oil

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 54 years old and married to Rogelio. She has six children and all have settled into marriage and live separately from them. They have no other source of income except corn production. 

Juliana is getting older but still aims to achieve financial independence. According to her, she is still strong to work. She usually earns an income twice a year for about P30,000 per harvest season. It usually falls during the month of March and October. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. She would like to improve her output to save for future emergencies. She doesn't want to rely on her children's remittances so at her age, she still generates an income.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in corn farming.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a mother whose ambition in life is to educate their children and give them a better life. She is now 55 and has five adult children. Despite the hardship of living, she has a strong determination to work out her plans and achieve her goals. 

She helps her husband in managing their corn production business to ensure a fruitful harvest. They aim to increase their yields so that they will earn a higher income to support the education of their children and satisfy their necessities. 

To do this, she would like to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn production. She believes that through this loan, she will be able to work out her plan and hopes that they will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn production.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario is a 33-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has children. He has been engaged in fishing for 15 years. He is able to sustain his family through his business. He works hard for his family.

Dario has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. He hopes to achieve his goals of sending all his children to college and improving his family’s house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials

loans.name: Ma. Aida

texts.en:
52-year-old Ma. Aida has been running a sari-sari store business for 10 years. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. Ma. Aida sells various items like soap, shampoo, bread and canned goods. She also makes ice scramble (smoothies) to sell in her community.

Ma. Aida is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, bread and canned goods. She hopes to earn more and be able to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, bread and canned goods

loans.name: Roquilio

texts.en:
Roquilio is a married man with six children between the ages of 9 and 20. He is a fisherman working in Talibon, Bohol. Roquilio earns 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month with his business. He works hard to support his family and send his children to school. 

Roquilio has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. Roquilio hopes to have a stable income. He also plans to improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 32 years old and married but has no child yet. He prays to have one soon. 

He owns a hectare plot of land that he has cultivated for almost eight years now.

He is now asking for a loan to ensure proper nutrition of his crop for a higher yield upon harvest. He is asking for PHP 30,000 to pay for land preparation and seeds to grow in his farming business.

He would like to keep producing plentiful crops and earn enough income for the improvements of their lives.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and seeds to grow in his farming business.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a 33-year-old married woman with three children, ages 15, 13 and 7. She sells fish and mobile prepaid load credit in her community. Rosela used to be a scrap buyer but, due to some circumstances, she decided to focus more on selling fish.

Rosela has requested a loan to buy more fish and mobile prepaid load to sell. Rosela hopes to have a stable business that will help her send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish and mobile prepaid load to sell

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Due to lack of job opportunities, Frankline is engaged in the corn production business to earn and save for his future. He is now 27 years old and still single. His ambition in life is to build his own house and become financially stable before he settles down. 

He plans to expand his corn plantation in order to increase his yields. Although farming is difficult to manage, he has the determination to achieve his goals. 

He would like to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 to be used in working out his plan. He mentioned that the loan will be used to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn production. He believes that he will have a fruitful harvest if he continues to work and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed in corn production.

loans.name: Emerito

texts.en:
Emerito is a 42-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 3 children ages 20, 18 and 13.

Emerito has had an ice cream production business for 9 years. He earns 18,000 PHP per month from his business. Emerito works hard to support his family. He plans to use his loan to buy more milk, sugar, and other ingredients for making ice cream. Emerito hopes to be a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to buy more milk, sugar and other ingredients for making ice cream

loans.name: Robin

texts.en:
Robin is a hardworking father. He and his wife have three young children. Two attend elementary school.

He cultivates a two-hectare rice field in Carilucud, Solana, Cagayan. Together with his wife, they plant rice seeds and sell to traders upon maturity and harvest. They are both involved in this business as the only source of their income. They did not even seek other employment so they patiently do farming activities.
 
He is now asking for a loan to pay for field plowing and to buy seeds to grow. He needs PHP 30,000. He hopes that this loan will be granted to him as the way to improve his business and his family's standard of living as well.

loans.use: to pay for field plowing and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a married woman wtih 4 children. She has a sari-sari store business located in Trinidad, Bohol. Alicia sells items like soft drinks, canned goods and rice. She also sells gasoline to her community. Alicia works hard to help improve her family's income. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, rice and gasoline. Alicia hopes to earn more and be able to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, rice and gasoline

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: 36-year-old Antonia has had a sari-sari store business for 12 years. She is married and has an 8-year-old child. Antonia sells various items at her store such as rice, soap, bread and many more. Antonia works hard to improve her family's living conditions. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks. Antonia hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Di

texts.en:
Di, a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of four single children, lives in Krong Siem Reap. 

She is in the business of raising piglets, both for slaughter and offspring, in a wooden piggery that was built in her backyard. She has worked on this project since 2000, earning a profit of $5 per day. Moreover, she has another skill in distilling Khmer traditional liquor (white wine). 

She is very hard-working at home because she wants to provide her children a better standard of living and a bright future. 

The purpose of this loan is to buy pig feed and vitamins. She hopes that she will be able to expand her pig farm some day.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 27 and is married to a farmer. They live happily in a village, planting and harvesting corn and vegetables for sale. They are gifted with two children and they want them to earn degrees and become professionals in the future. To this end, they endure the hardship in farming, for they want to earn and save to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their children. 

They plan to expand their corn plantation so that they will increase their yields. But due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs required in planting corn. They believe that this loan will help them to increase their yields and income.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs required in planting corn.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene sells fish to earn a living. She is 26 years old, married with 3 children. Her eldest is only 8 years old.

Arlene started selling fish 5 years ago. She said it helps her family a lot that she and her husband are both earning an income. Arlene does her best to take care of her children and continue to make money. She requested a loan to buy ice and more fish to sell. Arlene hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to buy ice and more fish to sell

loans.name: Aulita

texts.en:
Aulita is a 56-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for quite some time now. Aulita's husband is also a farmer. They work together to improve their business and sustain their family.

Aulita is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Aulita hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She also hopes for her children to continue their studies and finish college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Naadgai

texts.en: Naadgai is 69 years old and lives with her daughter, a nurse, in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Naadgai started her business in 1999 by renting a counter in the market. Over the years, she has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Her products are stylish, high quality and relatively cheap. Her business income has, however, remained the same ever since she started her business, so she has just rented another counter in the market. She doesn't have enough inventory to supply another counter; therefore, she's requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy supplies.

loans.use: To buy supplies to expand her business

loans.name: Genere

texts.en:
Genere is married and has three children. She is 37 years old and lives in San Roque, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte: Philippines. 

Genere has owned and operated a gardening business for 3 years, planting a variety of vegetables to earn a living. She earns PHP 2,000 monthly from her business. 

Genere has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Genere wants to make improvements to her house and to see her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner Asasah for her animal sales business, which she started after her husband's death. Zubaida purchases animals such as goats and sheep from the animal market at low rates and sells them to butchers after raising them. She gives them good quality food and takes cares of them so that they become healthy and sell for a good price.

Zubaida has one son who works in a shop selling clothes for a low wage. Zubaida is a great mother and has raised her son very well. She is confident that an investment will help her earn more profit from her business and enable her to save some money for her son’s marriage.

Note: In the photo, Zubaida is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for farming and to purchase some poultry and piglets to raise

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is 58 years old and has 4 adult children. She is a member of the An Tap cluster. Thuy's main job is farming. She grows rice and breeds pigs, earning a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2008. She borrowed 6,048,000 VND in her last loan and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle, Thuy would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina lives with her family: her husband and four children, all enrolled in school and getting their education. Rubina is very talented; she owns and operates a home-based sewing business. She receives orders from her community clients and earns a good income by completing them on time. Rubina's husband is a plumber by profession. He offers his services and sells plumbing supplies such as taps and water pipes to his clients. He has been operating his business for over 15 years.

Rubina is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He intends to use the loan to purchase plumbing supplies and tools. Rubina is hopeful that this loan will enable her husband to improve his client services and generate more revenue.

Note: In the photo, Rubina is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy plumbing supplies and tools

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is married and has three children. She is 31 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

For 5 years, Glenda has owned and operated a business raising pigs. She earns PHP 4,000 monthly from the business. Glenda has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Glenda has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Glenda plans to save her revenue as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran, 41 years old, is married and has 4 children. Two of her children work and two daughters stay at home and help Nazeeran with her household tasks. Nazeeran's husband has operated a livestock business for many years, selling animals and their milk. The quality of milk he provides is very good; therefore, he is known as a credible person among his customers and makes good sales every month. Nazeeran is a housewife who stays at home and manages her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she provides full support to her husband by milking the buffaloes and selling the milk to her community clients.

Nazeeran has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy another buffalo to help him get a larger quantity of milk and increase his profits. Nazeeran is very hopeful that a loan investment will help him earn larger profits.

Note: In the photo, Nazeeran is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: But

texts.en:
Mrs. But is 48 years old and a responsible housewife who helps her husband earn an income by selling fresh fish in mobile places or in the village. She generates an income of approximately $3 per day. Mrs. But lives with her husband and 3 single children in the Ressuey Keo commune, a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. But would like to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to fix some parts of her house that need repairs. She will use the remaining funds to pay for farming. Mrs. But is very happy and appreciative of all lenders. She hopes that this loan will enable the fast growth of her farming business.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia, aged 39, is married and lives with her family: her husband and five children. Her elder son is involved in a business selling motorbike spare parts and another son works in a factory. Two of her children are enrolled in school and her youngest one is not yet of school age.

Asia's husband is a mason. In order to support him financially, she offers a sewing service. Asia’s days are focused on managing her household work and handling her sewing jobs. She manages both of these very responsibly, giving them the required time. Her family and her customers are very satisfied with her. Asia has applied for this loan for her son, who will purchase spare parts in larger quantities to be able to meet his customers’ orders on time and to generate more revenue. Asia is hopeful that her son's business will be well-established after making this investment.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorbikes

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy is 38 years old. She has two children who are going to school. Quy not only grows rice, but also sells fruit in the market. She has had this job for 3 years. She has a monthly income of about 3,500 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. Quy is a member of An Tap cluster in SEDA. The last time, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio is 37 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and two children, which are his priority in life. Eugenio has fertile land on which he plants rice. Eugenio is an experienced farmer and has been in rice production for 10 years. According to him, he needs to provide maintenance to his crops so that he can produce more sacks of rice and can sell to traders.

He is now asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy inputs for growing rice, such as fertilizers and insecticides.

In the future, Eugenio hopes to earn money for the college education of his children.

loans.use: to buy inputs for growing rice, such as fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is a 31-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family, a husband and three children. All of her children are studying. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and has operated his rickshaw for over 3 years. He facilitates the passengers with his driving services. He has fixed the charges route-wise and area-wise.

Sajida’s days are focused on managing the progress of her sewing business. She operates her sewing works to supplement the income for her family. She is a very caring lady in nature and tries to fulfill the needs of her family with her efforts.  
  
With this loan, Sajida will purchase unstitched clothes and fiber, in bulk, to be able to sew them and offer to her clients for purchasing. She is hopeful that her income will be increased by offering the stitched dresses to the clients.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fiber for her sewing business

loans.name: Jonnalyn

texts.en:
Jonnalyn is single and 24 years old, residing at Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Jonnalyn is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. She's been in this business 3 years. Each month, she earns 3,600 PHP doing this type of work.

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Jonnalyn has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Jonnalyn wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the mother of 4 children, 3 daughters and a son. All of them are enrolled in local school and getting their education. Her husband sells cow milk. Nasreen also supports him in his business after getting free from her household responsibilities. She milks the cows and also gives them food.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan investment, he will buy another cow that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits. It has become very difficult for Nasreen to pay the school fees of her children and she is hopeful that by investing the loan, her husband will make more profits and she will be able to continue giving education to her children.

Note:In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: to buy a cow for a dairy business

loans.name: Feronika

texts.en:
Feronika is a 47-year-old lady who is married to Yahya, a 48-year-old man. From their marriage, they are blessed with an only son namely Mario, 17 years old, who is studying at a university in Java Island. 

Feronika runs a home-based business selling various pastries and cakes. She has been running the business for 10 years. Feronika employs four people to assist her in running the business. In a day she can produce various kinds of pastries with various flavors and cakes. Beside offering the products at kiosks or mini markets, Feronika also produces pastries according to customer’s order.

Since Christmas Day is coming, Feronika has received many orders from her customers. Actually she is happy as she will generate more income but due to the limited capacity of the roaster that she has, Feronika planned to seek a loan. 

She got information that TLM provides an individual lending program especially for micro- and small entrepreneurs. Therefore she is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM to purchase a roaster and more ingredients such wheat, sugar, eggs, butter, etc in the large quantity.

loans.use: to purchase a roaster and more ingredients such wheat, sugar, eggs, butter, etc.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед житель района Шахритус. Ему 28 лет. Он холост. Он живет вместе с матерью. Его мать домохозяйка. Сам Хуршед занимается разведением мелко - рогатого скота. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Khurshed is a resident of Shahrituz region. He is 28 years old, single and lives with his mother. His mother is a home maker and Khurshed raises sheep. He has had his herd for the last two years and would like to take out this loan to purchase cows for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house she owns in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, which involves running two stalls in a local market. Both of her children are in school. She started her business in 2002 and has done so well that she was able to build a house worth 12,000,000 MNT. She is applying for a loan for 3,000,000 MNT to buy more items to sell to her customers.  She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My mission is to make sure my kids get educated."

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her two stalls.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en: Adora is 39 years old, married, has five children and earns a living by helping her husband grow corn on their farm. Money is tight, but they are determined to keep their children in school because this is the only treasure they can give them. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to expand their farm by buying more corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. With help from Kiva lenders, Adora is sure her family can have a plentiful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a farm.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, who are 18 and 20 years old, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. Her family lives in a ger (or traditional nomadic tent) in the city's outer districts. Her husband works as a guard in a local shop. She supports her family by running a shop that sells books and magazines in the town's largest indoor market. When she first began her business in 2003, she had 2,000,000 tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Now she has 5,500,000 MNT and sells pre-paid phone cards as well as books, magazines and newspapers. Narantsetseg is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 MNT to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for next year is to improve her business by expanding her stall and increasing her working capital. This will help her attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in a book store.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is requesting a loan from KIVA's partner Asasah for her brother’s animal sales business. He will use the loan to buy goats and sheep in larger numbers. He will raise them and sell them to butchers for a profit. Khursheed's brother has been operating his business for many years and Khursheed is confident that an investment will enable him to be more productive and to increase his income.

Khursheed is a housewife, staying at home and managing her household responsibilities. Her husband has a job. Khursheed is the mother of 2 children, both very young and not yet of school going age. Khursheed is a very responsible person and is always willing to help her family in difficult times. She is hopeful that her brother will make good use of this loan and increase his income by expanding his business. Note: In the photo, Khursheed is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Maximilla

texts.en:
Maximilla is a 47-year-old lady, married to Jeremias, a 61-year-old farmer. Maximilla and Jeremias are blessed with three children: Yedida, 27, Endri, 25, (the two of them are married) and the youngest is Alfredo, 22,  who has graduated from Senior High School. 

Maximilla owns a kiosk business and Meatball Stall – called “Baso”. She initiated these businesses one year ago. Since running these businesses Maximilla can help her husband in covering their family’s living expenses. 

Maximilla and family are living in a rural place, so she was thinking to restock and add some new products as demanded by the customers. Therefore, Maximilla is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She would like to spend the loan on petrol, kerosene, snacks, instant noodles, sugar, coffee, etc. She is hoping that TLM is willing to assist her with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase petrol, kerosene, snacks, instant noodles, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.ru: Абдулазиз занимается выращивание овощей и посевом зерновых культур. Этим видом деятельности он занимается три года. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Кредит берет для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Abdulaziz grows vegetables and grains. He has been farming for three years. Abdulaziz is 34 years old, married and has four children. He is taking out this loan to plant winter wheat.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru:
Бурулкан  проживает в селе Каратай на юге Кыргызстана со своей семьей с четырьмя детьми, младшей из которых три года. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности, Бурулкан с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес еще 20 лет назад. На сегодняшний день, Бурулкан в своем хозяйстве имеет 2 головы дойных коров, и 10 баранов, продажа молока, молочных продуктов и мяса позволяет получать около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Также на поливной земле в 0,56 га Бурулкан выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу, что позволяет обеспечивать кормовой базой скот. 
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Бурулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку крупного рогатого скота для откорма и  перепродажи.    Доходы Бурулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает приобрести автомобиль для семьи.
texts.en: Burulkan lives with her four children in Karatay village in south Kyrgystan. Her youngest daughter is only three years old. As many other families in the countryside Burulkan raises cattle with her husband, a business which the two started more then 20 years ago. Currently their herd includes 2 milk cows and 10 sheep, and they earn a monthly profit of 5,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk, dairy products and meat. They also own a 1.2 acre plot of irrigated land where they grow corn and wheat for animal feed. In order to expand her business, Burulkan has turned to "Bai Tushum and partners" for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) which she will use to buy more cattle for meat production and resale. The profits from the loan Burulkan is planning to invest in her farm business. She is dreaming of be able to buy a car for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Tserenchimeg

texts.en:
Tserenchimeg, age 37, runs a clothing retail business at a local market in Ulaanbaatar. She has three years of work experience in the hospitality industry; however, she decided to start her own business in 2005 and has made much progress since then. 

Tserenchimeg usually sells women’s clothing imported from China, and this loan will help her to increase her product variety. She and her husband have two small children, ages 3 and 4. The family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Tserenchimeg is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to import more clothes for the winter, a very high shopping season. She is planning to expand her business by increasing her product variety, which she is confident will help her business’s sales to increase.

loans.use: to import more clothes for the winter shopping season

loans.name: Ochirhand

texts.en: Ochirhand is 51 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her husband is a plumber and her only daughter lives independently. Ochirhand started her meat retailing business in 1995. Over the years she has gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. Now that her daughter has grown and is independent, it's time for Ochirhand to concentrate on the business. Therefore, she has rented another counter in the market. However, she doesn't have enough inventory to fill another counter so is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy supplies.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
25-year-old Clara is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store business, where she sells various items like canned goods and soap. She also supports her husband in growing rice on their land. Clara works hard to support her family.

Clara is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and other items to sell, such as canned goods and noodles. Clara hopes their businesses will grow. She plans to save for her child's education and house renovations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other items to sell, such as canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Maazam

texts.ru: Маазам проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Маазам занимается торговлей семечек и и детских игрушек рядом с домом. Этим видом деятельности она занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Maazam lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. Maazam sells sunflower seeds and toys from a tray close to her home. She has been working like this for the last four years and wants to take out this loan to expand her business into an actual store at the market.

loans.use: to purchase a market stall at the central market and increasing goods turn over

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a responsible father who plans to improve the family's sources of income and give them a better life. He is 44 years old and has five school-aged children. Daniel mentions that life has become difficult due to the high cost of commodities, school fees and transportation. Despite these conditions, he has the strong determination to work out his plan and achieve his goals.

Daniel plans to expand his corn plantation to increase his yields and his income to satisfy his family's necessities and support his children's education. He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor costs required for planting corn. He believes that this loan will help him to improve the business. He hopes that his plans and aspirations will become successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs for planting corn

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan, age 41, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She operates a clothing retail stall at a local market and has made great progress in one and a half years of operation. Bayarsaikhan has fifteen years of experience in the clothing retail business as she used to operate a retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, until 2007. Bayarsaikhan started her current business after working in Korea for three years. She usually sells clothes imported from Beijing or Ereen, a border city in China.

Bayarsaikhan has three children: her 22-year-old son works as a machinist at a local company and her 13- and 18-year-old children attend local schools. Her husband operates a small business in town. Bayarsaikhan is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for the upcoming season. Bayarsaikhan is a responsible and very neat person who is intent on improving her family’s living standards and helping her children to become highly educated people in the future. She is also a trusted client of Transcapital Co Ltd.,

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is 47 years old and widowed with four chidren, of which only one daughter is dependent and still in school. She is a farmer, who has been farming for four years and supplementing her income by raising pigs and planting rubber. 
She is a second cycle client, who completely repaid the first loan with VisionFund. After the loan, she has a regular income to support her children and earns around 13 U.S. Dollars per day. 
Now she is requesting another loan. She will use this loan to buy feed for her pigs and will also use some of the loan to buy fertilizer for her rubber plantation. She hopes this loan will enable her pigs to become fat and healthy and to grow rubber trees to be bigger and healthier. 
In addition, she hopes to make a better living and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and fertilizer for her rubber plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona is a 20-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has two young children aged five and two.

Jhona has been selling dried fish for five years. She works hard to help her husband sustain their family. 
She applied for a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. Jhona hopes to earn a better income and be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a diligent woman who strives hard to meet her family's needs. She is 59 years old and married. Her husband, Edouardo, is also a farmer who raises crops. They have seven children. 

She wants to improve her farm, but she doesnt have the large capital which is required for supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer which she will use in her farming.

She hopes that the next harvest will be better so she will be able save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to use for farming.

loans.name: Jitahidi Shg Group

texts.en:
Andrea is the facilitator of the Jitahidi SHG group. Andrea and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Andrea takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Andrea had a very good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Andrea was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Andrea and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Andrea will educate his children and invest in business as future savings.

In 2012, the members of Jitahidi SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Andrea is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en: Melecio is 47 years old and has earned a living as a farmer for the last four years. Recently, he has faced several large challenges, including an unexpected typhoon, pests and other insects. He is applying for a loan for PHP 25,000 to help his farm recover by buying corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. He hopes that this loan and his hard work will allow him to recover from these difficulties.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a farm.

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Asbon is the facilitator of the Imani group. Asbon and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Asbon takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Asbon had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Asbon was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Asbon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Asbon will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Imani group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Asbon is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор проживает в районе Шахритус. Она более шести лет занимается скотоводством. В основном она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Зулхумор берет кредит для закупа бычков, так как от продажи быка можно получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en: Zulkhumor lives in the Shahrituz district.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over six years.  She primarily breeds cattle for future sale.  Zulkhumor is 45 years old, married and has five children.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of bulls because she can make a good profit from the sales of bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Kaneezan's Group

texts.en: Kaneezan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s grocery store. He will use the loan to buy items in bulk to sell to his customers, including spices, sugar and cooking oil. Her son is very experienced in his business, and Kanzeean believes that his loan will allow him to earn increased profits. Kaneezan helps support her family by sewing clothes for her neighbors and customers. She is 51 years, very active and fulfills her responsibilities very well. She has seven children, five daughters and two sons. She is teaching her daughters how to sew so that they can someday going into this business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, spices, cooking oil and other items for a grocery store.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His elder two children are employed, and his youngest one is a college student. He started his second-hand garment retailing business in 2005 by renting a counter in a market. Now that he running his business for a long time, he has gained many customers and trusted suppliers however, his suppliers aren't enough therefore, he's requesting 1,200,000 MNT to buy more used garments from Erlian.

loans.use: To buy more used garments

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Norn lives in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow. Her husband and one of her sons recently died due to an accident. 

Norn is a rice and lotus farmer. She is asking for another loan in the amount of 700 USD to continue her farming business. She will buy lotus seed and pay for plowing fees.  

Photo: Norn is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy lotus seed and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Lum Orng's Group

texts.en:
Lum Orng, aged 31, is a married mother with two children, who are still in school. She lives in a rural area of the Cheung Prey district and has been selling Khmer noodles to earn a living for nearly seven years. 
With her current business, she earns 20 U.S. dollars per day and can only save around 1.5 U.S. dollars per day after family and business expenses. 

Lum Orng leads a group of two female members. This is her first group loan with VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan to buy rice to make Khmer noodles for her business. 
With this loan, she hopes to make more Khmer noodles, so as to earn more income and thereby enabling her to build up some savings for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice for her Khmer noodle business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Samiidavga

texts.en: Samiidavga is 50 years old and lives with his wife and five children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His three eldest children are college students, and the youngest two are school students. He started his carpentry business in 2000. He makes traditional-style furniture. He also runs a well. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I have to work hard and maximize my capacity in order to pay my children's college fees." He is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy raw materials and some tools.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and some tools

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a cotton scarf weaver. She does not have her own loom but  is hired for a fee to weave scarves. She lives in a village along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Sina is in the process of building a new house but lacks some money to finish building it. She has decided to ask for a loan of $1,200 to finish this project.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a 52-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married and has children.

Jose has been a farmer for 20 years. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earned 3000 PHP per month with his last cropping. Jose works hard to sustain his family. 
He requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farming requirements and hopes to expand his farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farming requirements

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and has five children. She is 57 years old and lives in Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Lolita has owned and operated a farm for 3 years, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She earns PHP 1,500 monthly from this business. Lolita has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Lolita has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Lolita wants to make improvements to her house and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with three sons and three daughters. Five of her children are married and live in separate homes and the sixth is a garment worker. 

Than is a weaver. She is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000 to assist her son-in-law who is a taxi driver. His taxi is old and does not work well. He will use the loan to add to his own money to buy a new taxi.

loans.use: To buy a new taxi for her son-in-law.
